original: Aṭṭhakanipāta-aṭṭhakathā
analyzed: aṭṭhaka nipāta aṭṭhakathā

analyzed: paṭhama paṇṇāsakam  mettāvaggaḥ
translated: The First Fifty🔽The Chapter on Loving-kindness

original: 1. Mettāsuttavaṇṇanā🔽1. Aṭṭhakanipātassa paṭhame āsevitāyāti ādarena sevitāya. Bhāvitāyāti vaḍḍhitāya.🔽Bahulīkatāyāti punappunaṃ katāya. Yānikatāyāti yuttayānasadisakatāya. Vatthukatāyāti
analyzed: aṭṭhaka nipātassa paṭhame āsevitāya ati ādarena sevitāya bhāvitāya ati vaḍḍhitāya  bahulīkatāya ati punappunam katāya yānika tāya ati yutta yāna sadisaka tāya vatthuka tāya ati
translated: The Exposition of the Discourse on Loving-kindness🔽“Cultivated”: cultivated with devotion. “Developed”: developed to growth.

original: patiṭṭhānaṭṭhena vatthu viya katāya. Anuṭṭhitāyāti paccupaṭṭhitāya. Paricitāyāti
analyzed: patiṭṭhāna aṭṭhena vatthu viya katāya anuṭṭhitāya ati paccupaṭṭhitāya paricitāya ati
translated: “Increased”: increased by repetition. “Made to arise”: made to arise like a suitable vehicle. “Made the basis”: made the basis like a foundation.

original: samantato citāya upacitāya. Susamāraddhāyāti suṭṭhu samāraddhāya sukatāya. Ānisaṃsāti
analyzed: samantataḥ citāya upacitāya su samāraddhāya ati suṭṭhu samāraddhāya su katāya
translated: “Established”: established in the mind. “Well-compounded”: well-compounded, well-made. “Benefits”: qualities.

original: guṇā. Sukhaṃ supatītiādīsu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ ekādasakanipāte vakkhāma.
analyzed: guṇā sukham supati iti ādīsu yam vattabbam tam ekādasaka nipāte vakkhāma
translated: As to the passage beginning, “He sleeps happily,” we shall comment below in the eleven-factored version .

original: Appamāṇanti pharaṇavasena appamāṇaṃ. Tanū saṃyojanā honti, passato upadhikkhayanti
analyzed: appamāṇam ti pharaṇa vasena appamāṇam tanū saṃyojanāḥ honti passataḥ upadhikkhayanti
translated: “Measureless”: measureless in the sense of pervading. “Fetters are slackened”:

original: mettāpadaṭṭhānāya vipassanāya anukkamena upadhikkhayasaṅkhātaṃ arahattaṃ pattassa🔽dasa saṃyojanā pahīyantīti attho. Atha vā tanū saṃyojanā hontīti paṭighañceva paṭighasampayuttasaṃyojanā
analyzed: mettā pada ṭṭhānāya vipassanāya anukkamena upadhi khaya saṅkhātam arahattam pattassa  dasa saṃyojanā pahīyanti iti attho atha vā tanū saṃyojanā honti iti paṭigham ca iva paṭigha sampayutta saṃyojanā
translated: The meaning is that the ten fetters are abandoned in one who has reached Arahantship, which is called the destruction of the substratum, by insight into loving-kindness, which is the basis for that, and which is developed in due course.🔽Or alternatively, the fetters are reduced: both resistance and the fetters associated with resistance are reduced.

original: ca tanukā honti. Passato upadhikkhayanti tesaṃyeva kilesūpadhīnaṃ khayasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: ca tanukāḥ honti passataḥ upadhi khayanti tesam yeva kilesu upadhīnam khaya saṅkhātam
translated: Seeing the destruction of the substratum: seeing the destruction of the substratum of defilements, which is called the attainment of loving-kindness.

original: mettaṃ adhigamavasena passantassa. Kusalī tena hotīti tena mettāyanena kusalo hoti.
analyzed: mettam adhigama vasena passantassa kusalī tena hoti iti tena mettāyanena kusalaḥ hoti
translated: He becomes skilled in that: he becomes skilled in that loving-kindness.

original: Sattasaṇḍanti sattasaṅkhātena saṇḍena samannāgataṃ, sattabharitanti attho. Vijetvāti
analyzed: satta saṇḍanti satta saṅkhātena saṇḍena samannāgatam satta bharitam ti attho vijetvā ati
translated: The sevenfold bond: endowed with the sevenfold bond consisting of beings, i.e. crowded with beings, is the meaning.🔽Having conquered: having conquered by the Dhamma alone, without stick or sword.

original: adaṇḍena asatthena dhammeneva vijinitvā. Rājisayoti isisadisā dhammikarājāno. Yajamānāti
analyzed: a daṇḍena a satthena dhammena iva vijinitvā isi sadisāḥ dhammika rājānaḥ yajamāna ati
translated: The kings of the earth: righteous kings who are like seers.🔽The sacrificers: those who are performing sacrifices.

original: dānāni dadamānā. Anupariyagāti vicariṃsu.
analyzed: dānāni dadamānāḥ vicariṃsu
translated: They wandered about: they roamed about.

original: Assamedhantiādīsu porāṇakarājakāle kira sassamedhaṃ, purisamedhaṃ, sammāpāsaṃ, vācāpeyyanti
analyzed: assamedhanti ādīsu porāṇaka rāja kāle kira sassamedham purisamedham sammāpāsam vācāpeyyanti
translated: In the passages beginning with “horse sacrifice” , etc., it seems that in the time of the ancient kings there were the horse sacrifice, the human sacrifice, the sacrifice of all things not forbidden, and the sacrifice of speech,

original: cattāri saṅgahavatthūni ahesuṃ, yehi rājāno lokaṃ saṅgaṇhiṃsu. Tattha nipphannasassato🔽dasamabhāgaggahaṇaṃ sassamedhaṃ nāma, sassasampādane medhāvitāti attho. Mahāyodhānaṃ🔽chamāsikaṃ bhattavetanānuppadānaṃ purisamedhaṃ nāma, purisasaṅgaṇhane medhāvitāti🔽attho. Daliddamanussānaṃ hatthato lekhaṃ gahetvā tīṇi vassāni vinā vaḍḍhiyā sahassadvisahassamattadhanānuppadānaṃ
analyzed: cattāri saṅgaha vatthūni ahesum yehi rājānaḥ lokam saṅgaṇhiṃsu tattha nipphanna sassataḥ  dasama bhāga ggahaṇam sassamedham nāma sassa sampādane medhāvitā ati atthaḥ mahā yodhānam  cha māsikam bhatta vetana an uppadānam purisamedham nāma purisa saṅgaṇhane medhāvitā ati  atthaḥ dalidda manussānam hatthataḥ lekham gahetvā tīṇi vassāni vinā vaḍḍhiyā sahassa dvi sahassa matta dhana an uppadānam
translated: The four means of gathering people were the means by which kings gathered people in the world. Herein, the taking of the tenth part of the crops🔽when the crops are ready is called “the means of gathering by crops”; the meaning is, he is clever in the gathering of crops. The means of gathering by🔽great warriors is the provision of a stipend of food for six months; the meaning is, he is clever in the gathering of men. The means of gathering by🔽debt is the provision of a hundred thousand or a hundred thousand less than that in three years’ time, without interest, to poor people who have taken a promissory note in their own hand.

original: sammāpāsaṃ nāma. Tañhi sammā manusse pāseti hadaye bandhitvā viya ṭhapeti, tasmā🔽sammāpāsanti vuccati. “Tāta, mātulā”tiādinā nayena pana saṇhavācābhaṇanaṃ vācāpeyyaṃ🔽nāma, piyavācāti attho. Evaṃ catūhi saṅgahavatthūhi saṅgahitaṃ raṭṭhaṃ iddhañceva🔽hoti, phītañca, bahuannapānaṃ, khemaṃ, nirabbudaṃ. Manussā mudā modamānā ure putte
analyzed: sammāpāsam nāma tat hi sammā manusse pāsā iti hadaye bandhitvā viya ṭhapeti tasmā 🔽sammāpāsanti vuccati tāta mātulāti ādinā nayena pana saṇha vācā bhaṇanam vācāpeyyam 🔽nāma piya vācā iti attho evam catūhi saṅgaha vatthūhi saṅgahitam raṭṭham iddham ca iva 🔽hoti phītam ca bahu anna pānam khemam nirabbudam manussāḥ mudā modamānāḥ ure putte
translated: The four bases of beneficence are the means by which kings gather people to themselves. Herein, the giving of a share of the crop after the harvest is called “the beneficence of the crop.” The meaning is that he is beneficent in the production of the crop. The giving of a half-month’s wages to the great army is called “the beneficence of men.” The meaning is that he is beneficent in the gathering of men. The giving of a thousand or two thousand kahāpaṇas to poor people after taking a promissory note is called “the right bond.” For that is a right bond in that it binds men to him as if it were tied to their hearts. Therefore it is called “the right bond.” The speaking of gentle words in the way beginning, “Dear uncle,” is called “the beneficence of speech.” The meaning is that he is beneficent in speech. When the country is gathered to himself by means of these four bases of beneficence, it becomes prosperous and flourishing, with plenty of food and drink, peaceful, and free from troubles. The people, rejoicing and exultant, place their children on their laps,

original: naccentā apārutagharā viharanti. Idaṃ gharadvāresu aggaḷānaṃ abhāvato niraggaḷanti
analyzed: a pāruta gharāḥ viharanti idam ghara dvāresu aggaḷānam abhāvataḥ niraggaḷanti
translated: They lived in houses that were not closed in. This is called “without doors”

original: vuccati. Ayaṃ porāṇikā paveṇi.
analyzed: vuccati ayam porāṇikā paveṇi
translated: because there were no doors to the houses. This is the ancient practice.

original: Aparabhāge pana okkākarājakāle brāhmaṇā imāni cattāri saṅgahavatthūni imañca raṭṭhasampattiṃ
analyzed: aparabhāge pana okkāka rāja kāle brāhmaṇāḥ imāni cattāri saṅgaha vatthūni imañca raṭṭha sampattim
translated: Later, however, in the time of King Okkāka, the brahmins, having turned these four bases of beneficence and this prosperity of the country

original: parivattetvā uddhaṃmūlakaṃ katvā assamedhaṃ purisamedhantiādike pañca yaññe nāma
analyzed: parivattetvā uddhaṃmūlakam katvā assamedham purisamedhanti ādike pañca yaññe nāma
translated: into an upside-down state, performed the five sacrifices called the horse sacrifice, the human sacrifice, and so on.

original: akaṃsu. Tesu assamettha medhanti vadhentīti assamedho. Dvīhi pariyaññehi yajitabbassa
analyzed: tesu assamettha medhanti vadhenti iti assamedhaḥ dvīhi pariyaññehi yajitabbassa
translated: In these, the horse sacrifice is called “horse sacrifice” because horses are killed there . It is a sacrifice to be performed with two kinds of requisites,

original: ekavīsatiyūpassa ekasmiṃ pacchimadivaseyeva sattanavutipañcapasusataghātabhiṃsanassa
analyzed: ekavīsati yūpassa ekasmin pacchima divase yeva satta navuti pañca pasu sata ghāta bhiṃsanassa
translated: and on the last day of the twenty-one-day sacrifice, it is the slaughter of 875 cattle that is terrifying.

original: ṭhapetvā bhūmiñca purise ca avasesasabbavibhavadakkhiṇassa yaññassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: ṭhapetvā bhūmiñca purise ca avasesa sabba vibhava dakkhiṇassa yaññassa itam adhivacanam
translated: This is a term for a sacrifice in which all the requisites are given as a gift except for the land and the men.

original: Purisamettha medhantīti purisamedho. Catūhi pariyaññehi yajitabbassa saddhiṃ bhūmiyā
analyzed: purisam ettha medhanti iti purisamedhaḥ catūhi pariyaññehi yajitabbassa saddhim bhūmiyā
translated: The human sacrifice is called “human sacrifice” because men are killed there . It is a sacrifice to be performed with four kinds of requisites, together with the land,

original: assamedhe vuttavibhavadakkhiṇassa yaññassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Sammamettha pāsantīti
analyzed: assamedhe vutta vibhava dakkhiṇassa yaññassa etam adhivacanam sammam ettha pāsanti iti
translated: This is a term for the sacrifice called the “sacrifice of the distribution of the Dakkhiṇā at the end of the horse-sacrifice” .🔽The “right-channel” is that by which the right channel flows here.

original: sammāpāso. Divase divase yugacchiggaḷe pavesanadaṇḍakasaṅkhātaṃ sammaṃ khipitvā tassa
analyzed: sammāpāsaḥ divase divase yuga chiggaḷe pavesana daṇḍaka saṅkhātam sammam khipitvā tassa
translated: Having thrown the right channel, which is called the “stick of the day-to-day-stick-throwing” , into the place where it falls,

original: patitokāse vediṃ katvā saṃhārimehi yūpādīhi sarassatīnadiyā nimuggokāsato pabhuti
analyzed: patita ukāse vedim katvā saṃhārimehi yūpa ādīhi sarassatī nadiyāḥ nimugga ukāsataḥ
translated: having made an altar there, and having gone in the reverse direction from the place where the sacrificial post, etc., are submerged in the river Sarassati,

original: paṭilomaṃ gacchantena yajitabbassa satrayāgassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Vājamettha pivantīti
analyzed: paṭilomam gacchantena yajitabbassa satra yāgassa itam adhivacanam vājam ettha pivanti iti
translated: this is a term for the sacrifice that is to be performed.

original: vājapeyyo. Ekena pariyaññena sattarasahi pasūhi yajitabbassa beluvayūpassa sattarasakadakkhiṇassa
analyzed: vājapeyyaḥ ekena pariyaññena sattarasahi pasūhi yajitabbassa beluva yūpassa sattarasaka dakkhiṇassa
translated: The “drinking of the horse” is the Vajapeya. This is a term for the sacrifice of the Beluva sacrificial post, which is to be performed with seventeen animals by one sacrifice, and which has seventeen Dakkhiṇās.

original: yaññassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Natthi ettha aggaḷāti niraggaḷo. Navahi pariyaññehi yajitabbassa
analyzed: yaññassa itam adhivacanam na atthi ettha aggaḷā ati niraggaḷaḥ navahi pariyaññehi yajitabbassa
translated: The “without-gate” is that in which there is no gate. This is a term for the sacrifice called the “sacrifice of the complete distribution of the Dakkhiṇā at the end of the horse-sacrifice” , which is to be performed with nine sacrifices,

original: saddhiṃ bhūmiyā ca purisehi ca assamedhe vuttavibhavadakkhiṇassa sabbamedhapariyāyanāmassa🔽assamedhavikappassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: saddhim bhūmiyā ca purisehi ca assamedhe vutta vibhava dakkhiṇassa sabbamedha pariyāya nāmassa 🔽assamedha vikappassa itam adhivacanam
translated: together with the land and the men, in the vicinity of the horse-sacrifice.

original: Kalampi te nānubhavanti soḷasinti te sabbepi mahāyāgā ekassa mettācittassa vipākamahantatāya🔽soḷasiṃ kalaṃ na agghanti, soḷasamaṃ bhāgaṃ na pāpuṇantīti attho. Na jinātīti na🔽attanā parassa jāniṃ karoti. Na jāpayeti na parena parassa jāniṃ kāreti. Mettaṃsoti🔽mettāyamānacittakoṭṭhāso hutvā. Sabbabhūtānanti sabbasattesu. Veraṃ tassa na kenacīti
analyzed: te na anubhavanti te sabbe pi mahā yāgāḥ ekassa mettā cittassa vipāka mahanta tāya  soḷasim kalam na agghanti soḷasamam bhāgam na pāpuṇanti iti atthaḥ na jināti iti na  attanā parassa jānim karoti na jāpayeti na parena parassa jānim kāreti mettaṃsoti  mettāyamāna citta koṭṭhāsaḥ hutvā sabba bhūtānanti sabba sattesu veram tassa na kenaci iti
translated: They do not equal a sixteenth part of it.🔽All those great sacrifices do not equal a sixteenth part of the result of a single thought of loving-kindness.🔽They do not reach a sixteenth part, is the meaning.🔽He does not win, he does not cause another to win.🔽He is full of loving-kindness, he is a store of loving-kindness.🔽Towards all beings, towards all living beings.🔽He has no enemy anywhere.

original: tassa kenaci saddhiṃ akusalaveraṃ vā puggalaveraṃ vā natthi.🔽2. Paññāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tassa kenaci saddhim akusala veram vā puggala veram vā natthi  paññā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: They do not equal a sixteenth part of it. All those great sacrifices do not equal a sixteenth part of the result of a mind of loving-kindness, do not come up to a sixteenth part of it. The meaning is that they do not come up to a sixteenth part of it. He does not take a wife: he does not take another’s wife for himself. Nor is he taken as a wife: nor does he cause another to take his own wife. He is full of loving-kindness: he is a store of loving-kindness. To all beings: to all living beings. He has no foe: he has no unprofitable foe or personal foe.🔽. Commentary

original: 2. Dutiye ādibrahmacariyikāyāti maggabrahmacariyassa ādibhūtāya. Paññāyāti vipassanāya.
analyzed: dutiye ādibrahmacariyikāya ati magga brahmacariyassa ādi bhūtāya paññāya ati vipassanāya
translated: In the second, the first of the life of purity: the first of the life of purity of the path. Wisdom: insight.

original: Garuṭṭhāniyanti gāravuppattipaccayabhūtaṃ garubhāvanīyaṃ. Tibbanti bahalaṃ. Paripucchatīti
analyzed: garuṭṭhāniyanti gārava uppatti paccaya bhūtam garu bhāvanīyam tibbanti bahalam paripucchati iti
translated: Worthy of esteem: worthy of being developed, a cause for the arising of esteem. Thick: dense.

original: atthapāḷianusandhipubbāparaṃ pucchati. Paripañhatīti pañhaṃ karoti, idañcidañca paṭipucchissāmīti🔽vitakketi. Dvayenāti duvidhena. Anānākathikoti anānattakathiko hoti. Atiracchānakathikoti🔽nānāvidhaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ na katheti. Ariyaṃ vā tuṇhībhāvanti ariyatuṇhībhāvo nāma🔽catutthajjhānaṃ, sesakammaṭṭhānamanasikāropi vaṭṭati. Jānaṃ jānātīti jānitabbakaṃ🔽jānāti. Passaṃ passatīti passitabbakaṃ passati. Piyattāyāti piyabhāvatthāya. Garuttāyāti
analyzed: attha pāḷi anusandhi pubba aparam pucchati paripañhati iti pañham karoti idam ca idam ca paṭipucchissāmi iti  vitakka iti dvayena ati duvidhena anānā kathikaḥ uti anānatta kathikaḥ hoti a tiracchāna kathikaḥ uti  nānāvidham tiracchānakatham na kathā iti ariyam vā ariya tuṇhībhāvaḥ nāma  catuttha jhānam sesa kammaṭṭhāna manasikāraḥ api vaṭṭati jānam jānāti iti jānitabbakam  jānāti passam passati iti passitabbakam passati piyattāya ati piya bhāva atthāya garuttāya ati
translated: He asks about the meaning, the text, the connection, the situation, the person, the summary, the phrasing, and the sequential order. He questions: he asks a question. He thinks: he thinks, “I shall ask this and that.”

original: garubhāvatthāya. Bhāvanāyāti bhāvanatthāya guṇasambhāvanāya vā. Sāmaññāyāti samaṇadhammatthāya.🔽Ekībhāvāyāti nirantarabhāvatthāya.🔽3-4. Appiyasuttadvayavaṇṇanā🔽3-4. Tatiye appiyapasaṃsīti appiyajanassa pasaṃsako vaṇṇabhāṇī. Piyagarahīti piyajanassa
analyzed: garu bhāva tthāya bhāvanāya ati bhāvanā tthāya guṇa sambhāvanāya vā sāmaññāya ati samaṇa dhamma tthāya 🔽ekībhāvāya ati 🔽        🔽tatiye appiya pasaṃsī iti appiya janassa pasaṃsakaḥ vaṇṇa bhāṇī piya garahī iti piya janassa
translated: By two means: by two ways. He is not a chatterer: he is not one who chatters indiscriminately. He is not a teller of tales: he does not tell various kinds of animal tales. He is a master of the discipline: he is a master of the rules of the Vinaya. He is a master of the Teaching: he is a master of the Dhamma of the Suttas and Abhidhamma. He is a master of the line of advancement: he is a master of the line of advancement in the thirty- seven aids to enlightenment. He is a master of the commentaries: he is a master of the commentaries on the meaning, the text, the phrasing, and the sequential order. He is a master of the five special knowledges: he is a master of the five special knowledges of the supernormal power, etc. He is a master of the six kinds of direct knowledge: he is a master of the six kinds of direct knowledge consisting of the three true knowledges, the supernormal powers, and the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers. He is a master of the nine supramundane states: he is a master of the nine supramundane states consisting of the four paths, the four fruitions, and Nibbāna. He is a master of the four discriminations: he is a master of the four discriminations of the meaning, the Dhamma, the language, and inspired speech. He is a master of the ten powers of one who knows: he is a master of the ten powers of one who knows consisting of the knowledge of what is possible and what is impossible, etc. He is a master of the four analytical knowledges: he is a master of the four analytical knowledges of the Dhamma, the meaning, the language, and inspired speech. He is a master of the five aggregates: he is a master of the five aggregates of the aggregate of virtue, etc. He is a master of the six sense bases: he is a master of the six sense bases of the eye, etc. He is a master of the seven factors of enlightenment: he is a master of the seven factors of enlightenment consisting of mindfulness, investigation of states, energy, rapture, calm, concentration,

original: nindako garahako. Catutthe anavaññattikāmoti “aho vata maṃ aññena avajāneyyu”nti
analyzed: nindakaḥ garahako catutthe an avaññatti kāmo ti aho vata mama aññena avajāneyyun ti
translated: One who finds fault and criticizes. In the fourth, one who wants to be thought well of: one who wants to be thought well of, thinking, “Oh, that others would think well of me!”

original: anavajānanakāmo. Akālaññūti kathākālaṃ na jānāti, akāle katheti. Asucīti asucīhi
analyzed: an avajānana kāmaḥ akālaññu iti kathā kālam na jānāti akāle kathā iti asuci iti asucīhi
translated: One who does not know the proper time: one who does not know the time for telling a story, who tells a story at the wrong time. One who is impure: one who is endowed with impure bodily,

original: kāyakammādīhi samannāgato.
analyzed: kāya kamma ādīhi samannāgataḥ
translated: verbal, and mental action.

original: 5. Paṭhamalokadhammasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary on the First Discourse on Worldly Ideas

original: 5. Pañcame lokassa dhammāti lokadhammā. Etehi muttā nāma natthi, buddhānampi honti.
analyzed: pañcame lokassa dhammā ati loka dhammā etehi muttāḥ nāma natthi buddhānam pi honti
translated: In the fifth, worldly ideas: worldly ideas are ideas of the world. There is no one who is free from them, not even the Buddhas.

original: Tenevāha – lokaṃ anuparivattantīti anubandhanti nappajahanti, lokato na nivattantīti
analyzed: tena iva āha lokam anuparivattanti iti anubandhanti na pajahanti lokataḥ na nivattanti iti
translated: Hence it is said: “They revolve in the world” : they follow, they do not abandon; the meaning is, they do not turn away from the world.

original: attho. Loko ca aṭṭha lokadhamme anuparivattatīti ayañca loko ete anubandhati na pajahati,
analyzed: atthaḥ loko ca aṭṭha loka dhamme anuparivattati iti ayam ca lokaḥ ete anubandhati na pajahati
translated: And this world revolves in the eight worldly ideas: and this world follows these ideas, does not abandon them;

original: tehi dhammehi na nivattatīti attho.
analyzed: tehi dhammehi na nivattati iti atthaḥ
translated: the meaning is, it does not turn away from those ideas.

original: Lābho alābhoti lābhe āgate alābho āgatoyevāti veditabbo. Ayasādīsupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: lābhaḥ alābhaḥ iti lābhe āgate alābhaḥ āgataḥ yeva ati veditabbaḥ ayas ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ
translated: Gain and loss: when gain comes, loss comes too, it should be understood. The same method applies to disrepute and so on.

original: Avekkhati vipariṇāmadhammeti “vipariṇāmadhammā ime”ti evaṃ avekkhati. Vidhūpitāti
analyzed: avekkhati vipariṇāma dhammā iti vipariṇāma dhammāḥ ime iti evam avekkhati vidhūpitā ati
translated: He contemplates as subject to destruction: he contemplates thus, “These are subject to destruction.” He has expelled:

original: vidhamitā viddhaṃsitā. Padañca ñatvāti nibbānapadaṃ jānitvā. Sammappajānāti bhavassa🔽pāragūti bhavassa pāraṃ gato nipphattiṃ matthakaṃ patto, nibbānapadaṃ ñatvāva taṃ
analyzed: vidhamitā viddhaṃsitā padam ca ñatvā ati nibbāna padam jānitvā sammappajānāti bhavassa  pāragū ti bhavassa pāram gataḥ nipphattim matthakam pattaḥ nibbāna padam ñatvā ava taṃ
translated: “The one who has understood the state of peace” : the one who has known the state of peace, Nibbāna. “Having understood the state of peace, the one who has crossed over the flood without remainder” : the one who has crossed over the flood, who has gone to the other shore, who has reached the culmination of success, who has known the state of peace, Nibbāna.

original: pāraṃ gatabhāvaṃ sammappajānātīti. Imasmiṃ sutte vaṭṭavivaṭṭaṃ kathitaṃ.
analyzed: pāram gata bhāvam sammappajānāti iti imasmin sutte vaṭṭa vivaṭṭam kathitam
translated: ‘Dispelled’ means ‘destroyed’. ‘And knowing the state’: knowing the state of extinction. ‘And rightly understands the end of being’: he has gone to the end of being, he has reached the culmination of success, he rightly understands the state of having gone to the end of being by knowing the state of extinction. In this sutta the round and the reversal of the round are taught.

original: 6. Dutiyalokadhammasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya lokadhamma sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The second on worldly conditions

original: 6. Chaṭṭhe ko visesoti kiṃ visesakāraṇaṃ. Ko adhippayāsoti ko adhikappayogo. Pariyādāyāti gahetvā pariniṭṭhapetvā. Idhāpi vaṭṭavivaṭṭameva kathitaṃ.
analyzed: chaṭṭhe kaḥ viseso ti kim visesa kāraṇam kaḥ adhippayāso ti kaḥ adhika ppayogo pariyādāya ati gahetvā pariniṭṭhapetvā idha api vaṭṭa vivaṭṭam eva kathitam
translated: . In the sixth , ‘What is the distinction?’ means ‘What is the reason for the distinction?’. ‘What is the purpose?’ means ‘What is the special purpose?’. ‘Having grasped’ means ‘having taken and completed’. Here too the round and the reversal of the round are taught.

original: 7. Devadattavipattisuttavaṇṇanā🔽7. Sattame acirapakkanteti saṅghaṃ bhinditvā na cirapakkante. Ārabbhāti āgamma paṭicca🔽sandhāya. Attavipattinti attano vipattiṃ vipannākāraṃ. Sesapadesupi eseva nayo. Abhibhuyyāti🔽abhibhavitvā madditvā.
analyzed: sattame acira pakkanta iti saṅgham bhinditvā na cira pakkante ārabbha ati āgamma paṭicca  sandhāya atta vipattim ti attanaḥ vipattim vipanna ākāram sesa padesu pi esa iva nayaḥ abhibhuyya ati  abhibhavitvā madditvā
translated: . The sutta on Devadatta’s downfall

original: 8. Uttaravipattisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: uttara vipatti sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . In the seventh , ‘after he had gone away’ means after he had gone away not long after he had split the Order. ‘In regard to’ means having come, having depended on, having taken as the basis. ‘His own downfall’ means his own downfall, the way he had failed. The same method of explanation applies in the other passages. ‘Having overcome’ means having overcome, having crushed.

original: 8. Aṭṭhame vaṭajālikāyanti evaṃnāmake vihāre. So kira vaṭavane niviṭṭhattā vaṭajālikāti
analyzed: aṭṭhame vaṭajālikāyanti evaṃnāmake vihāre saḥ kira vaṭa vane vaṭa jālikā ati
translated: In the eighth, in the Vaṭajālikā, in a monastery of that name. It is said that it got its name because it was built in a banyan grove.

original: saṅkhaṃ gato. Pāturahosīti imamatthaṃ devarañño ārocessāmīti gantvā pākaṭo ahosi.
analyzed: saṅkham gataḥ pāturahosi iti imam attham deva raññaḥ ārocessāmi iti gantvā pākaṭaḥ ahosi
translated: Pāturahosīti: I will go and make known this matter to the king of the gods. Having gone, he became manifest.

original: Ādibrahmacariyakoti sikkhattayasaṅgahassa sakalasāsanabrahmacariyassa ādibhūto.
analyzed: ādi brahmacariyako ti sikkhattaya saṅgahassa sakala sāsana brahmacariyassa ādi bhūtaḥ
translated: Ādibrahmacariyako: The beginning of the whole spiritual life of the Dispensation, which is included in the three trainings.

original: 9. Nandasuttavaṇṇanā🔽9. Navame kulaputtoti jātikulaputto. Balavāti thāmasampanno. Pāsādikoti rūpasampattiyā🔽pasādajanako. Tibbarāgoti bahalarāgo. Kimaññatrātiādīsu ayamattho – kiṃ aññena kāraṇena
analyzed: nanda sutta vaṇṇanā  navame kula putto ti jāti kula putto balavā ati thāma sampanno pāsādikaḥ iti rūpa sampattiyā  pasāda janakaḥ tibba rāgaḥ ti bahala rāgaḥ kim aññatra ati ādīsu ayam attho kim aññena kāraṇena
translated: . Commentary to the Nandasutta

original: kathitena, ayaṃ nando indriyesu guttadvāro bhojane mattaññū jāgariyamanuyutto satisampajaññena
analyzed: kathitena ayam nandaḥ indriyesu gutta dvāraḥ bhojane mattaññū jāgariyam anuyuttaḥ sati sampajaññena
translated: In the ninth, kulaputto: a son of a good family. Balavā: endowed with strength. Pāsādiko: one who generates confidence by his physical beauty. Tibbarāgo: one with strong passion. Kimaññatrātiādīsu: What is the meaning of this? What is the purpose of saying this? This Nanda is one who guards the doors of the senses, who knows moderation in eating, who is devoted to wakefulness, who is endowed with mindfulness and clear comprehension.

original: samannāgato, yehi nando sakkoti paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ. Sace
analyzed: samannāgataḥ yehi nando sakkoti paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam caritum sace
translated: By these means, Nanda is able to live the holy life in its fullness and purity.

original: imehi kāraṇehi samannāgato nābhavissa, na sakkuṇeyyāti. Itiha tatthāti evaṃ tattha.
analyzed: imehi kāraṇehi samannāgataḥ na abhavissa na sakkuṇeyya ati iti ha tattha ati evam tattha
translated: “If he were not endowed with these reasons, he would not be able to.” Thus, there, thus there.

original: Imasmiṃ sutte vaṭṭameva kathitaṃ.
analyzed: imasmin sutte vaṭṭam eva kathitam
translated: In this sutta only the round is explained.

original: 10. Kāraṇḍavasuttavaṇṇanā🔽10. Dasame aññenāññaṃ paṭicaratīti aññena kāraṇena vacanena vā aññaṃ kāraṇaṃ vacanaṃ
analyzed: kāraṇḍava sutta vaṇṇanā  dasame aññena aññam paṭicarati iti aññena kāraṇena vacanena vā aññam kāraṇam vacanam
translated: The Commentary on the Kāraṇḍava Sutta

original: vā paṭicchādeti. Bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmetīti bāhirato aññaṃ āgantukakathaṃ otāreti.🔽Apaneyyesoti apaneyyo nīharitabbo esa. Samaṇadūsīti samaṇadūsako. Samaṇapalāpoti🔽vīhīsu vīhipalāpo viya nissāratāya samaṇesu samaṇapalāpo. Samaṇakāraṇḍavoti samaṇakacavaro.

A corrupter of monks means a corrupter of monks. A drifter among monks means🔽a drifter among monks, like a drifter among rice, because of his lack of essence. A monk’s jackal means a monk’s jackal.

original: Bahiddhā nāsentīti bahi nīharanti. Yavakaraṇeti yavakhette. Phuṇamānassāti ucce ṭhāne
analyzed: bahiddhā na āsenti iti bahi nīharanti yava karaṇe iti yava khette phuṇamānassa ati ucce ṭhāne

analyzed: ṭhatvā mahāvāte opuniyamānassa apasammajjanti iti sāra dhaññānam ekatas dubbala dhaññānam

analyzed: phandati iti attho imasmin sutte vaṭṭam eva kathetvā gāthāsu vaṭṭa vivaṭṭam kathitan ti

translated: The Great Chapter

original: loke abhivādanapaccuṭṭhānaañjalikammasāmīcikammaṃ “sāmaggiraso”ti vuccati, taṃ bhoto
analyzed: loke abhivādana paccuṭṭhāna añjalikamma sāmīcikammam sāmaggiraso ti vuccati tam bhoto
translated: The juice of the world is said to be the paying of homage, rising up from one’s seat, saluting with joined palms, and courteous behaviour.

original: gotamassa natthi. Tasmā arasarūpo bhavaṃ gotamo, arasajātiko arasasabhāvoti. Athassa🔽bhagavā cittamudubhāvajananatthaṃ ujuvipaccanīkabhāvaṃ pariharanto aññathā tassa
analyzed: gotamassa na atthi tasmai a rasa rūpaḥ bhavam gotamaḥ a rasa jātikaḥ a rasa sabhāvaḥ ti athassa  bhagavā citta mudu bhāva janana attham uju vipaccanīka bhāvam pariharantaḥ aññathā tassa
translated: Master Gotama has none of that. Therefore Master Gotama is without juice, of a juiceless birth, of a juiceless nature.

original: vacanassa atthaṃ attani sandassento atthi khvesa, brāhmaṇa, pariyāyotiādimāha.🔽Tattha atthi khvesāti atthi kho esa. Pariyāyoti kāraṇaṃ. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – atthi
analyzed: vacanassa attham sandassentaḥ atthi khvā isa brāhmaṇa pariyāyā iti ādim āha  tattha atthi khu esā ati atthi kho esa pariyāyaḥ ti kāraṇam idam vuttam hoti atthi
translated: Then the Exalted One, in order to soften his mind, and avoiding a direct contradiction, showed him the meaning of his statement in another way, saying, “There is, brahmin, a cause.”

original: kho, brāhmaṇa, etaṃ kāraṇaṃ, yena kāraṇena maṃ “arasarūpo bhavaṃ gotamo”ti vadamāno
analyzed: kho brāhmaṇaḥ etam kāraṇam yena kāraṇena mam a rasa rūpaḥ bhavam gotama iti vadamānaḥ
translated: Herein, there is, brahmin, is there is, indeed. A cause is a reason. This is what is said: “There is, brahmin, a reason for which a person who says, ‘Master Gotama is without juice,’

original: puggalo sammā vadeyya, avitathavādīti saṅkhaṃ gaccheyya. Katamo pana soti? Ye te,
analyzed: puggalaḥ sammā vadeyya avitatha vādī iti saṅkham gaccheyya katamaḥ pana saḥ iti ye te
translated: would speak rightly and not fall into error.” But what is that reason?

original: brāhmaṇa, rūparasā…pe… phoṭṭhabbarasā, te tathāgatassa pahīnāti. Kiṃ vuttaṃ hoti?🔽Ye te jātivasena vā upapattivasena vā seṭṭhasammatānampi puthujjanānaṃ rūpārammaṇādīni
analyzed: brāhmaṇa phoṭṭhabba rasā te tathāgatassa pahīnā ti kim vuttam hoti  ye te jāti vasena vā upapatti vasena vā seṭṭha sammatānam pi puthujjanānam rūpa ārammaṇa ādīni
translated: “Brahmin, the essence of visible forms, the essence of sounds, the essence of odours, the essence of tastes, and the essence of touches have been abandoned by the Tathāgata.” What is meant?🔽The essence of visible forms, etc., called the gratification in the pleasure of sense desires, which arises in ordinary people who are considered the best by reason of their birth or their rebirth,

original: assādentānaṃ abhinandantānaṃ rajjantānaṃ uppajjanti kāmasukhassādasaṅkhātā rūparasā,
analyzed: assādentānam abhinandantānam rajjantānam uppajjanti kāma sukha ssāda saṅkhātāḥ rūpa rasāḥ
translated: and who enjoy visible forms, etc., as objects, delight in them, and are in bondage to them,

original: saddarasā, gandharasā, rasarasā, phoṭṭhabbarasā, ye imaṃ lokaṃ gīvāya bandhitvā viya
analyzed: sadda rasāḥ gandha rasāḥ rasa rasāḥ phoṭṭhabba rasāḥ ye imam lokam gīvāya bandhitvā
translated: and which lead the world by the neck as if it were a waterwheel,🔽and which are called the essence of union because they arise in the union of the object with the eye, etc.,

original: āviñchanti, vatthārammaṇādisāmaggiyañca uppannattā sāmaggirasāti vuccanti. Te sabbepi
analyzed: āviñchanti vattha ārammaṇa ādi sāmaggiyam ca uppanna ttā sāmaggi rasā ti vuccanti te sabbe pi
translated: all these have been abandoned by the Tathāgata.

original: tathāgatassa pahīnā. “Mayhaṃ pahīnā”ti vattabbepi mamākārena attānaṃ anukkhipanto
analyzed: tathāgatassa pahīnā mayham pahīnā ati vattabbe pi mama ākārena attānam an ukkhipanto
translated: Although he could say “abandoned by me,” he speaks of them as “abandoned by the Tathāgata” without referring to himself by the word “I.”

original: dhammaṃ deseti, desanāvilāso vā esa tathāgatassa.
analyzed: dhammam deseti desanā vilāsaḥ vā esa tathāgatassa
translated: He teaches the Dhamma in this way in order to show his lack of conceit, or else this is the Tathāgata’s way of teaching.

original: Tattha pahīnāti cittasantānato vigatā, pajahitā vā. Etasmiṃ panatthe karaṇe sāmivacanaṃ
analyzed: tattha pahīnā ati citta santānataḥ vigatā pajahitā vā etasmin pana atthe karaṇe sāmi vacanam
translated: Herein, abandoned means abandoned from the continuity of consciousness, or given up. In this sense the word “abandoned” is used in the instrumental case

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Ariyamaggasatthena ucchinnaṃ taṇhāvijjāmayaṃ mūlaṃ etesanti ucchinnamūlā.
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam ariya magga satthena ucchinnam taṇhā vijjā mayam mūlam etesan ti ucchinna mūlā
translated: They are “cut off at the root” because the root consisting of craving and ignorance has been cut off by the noble path.

original: Tālavatthu viya nesaṃ vatthu katanti tālāvatthukatā. Yathā hi tālarukkhaṃ samūlaṃ
analyzed: tāla vatthu viya vatthu katanti tālāvatthukatāḥ yathā hi tāla rukkham sa mūlam
translated: They are “like a palm stump” because their “stump” has been made like a palm stump. For just as, when a palm tree is uprooted,

original: uddharitvā tassa vatthumatte tasmiṃ padese kate na puna tassa tālassa uppatti paññāyati,
analyzed: uddharitvā tassa vatthumatte tasmin padese kate na puna tassa tālassa uppatti paññāyati
translated: after it has been pulled out of the ground and its stump has been made in the ground, the palm tree does not grow again,

original: evaṃ ariyamaggasatthena samūle rūpādirase uddharitvā tesaṃ pubbe uppannapubbabhāvena
analyzed: evam ariya magga satthena sa mūle rūpa ādi rase uddharitvā tesam pubbe uppanna pubba bhāvena
translated: so too, after the noble path has pulled out the roots consisting of form, etc., together with the underlying tendency to lust for form, etc., and has made their “stump” in the form of the residual formations in the continuity of aggregates that have already arisen,

original: vatthumatte cittasantāne kate sabbepi te tālāvatthukatāti vuccanti. Aviruḷhidhammattā
analyzed: vatthumatte citta santāne kate sabbe pi te tālā vatthukatā ati vuccanti a viruḷhi dhamma ttā
translated: all those are called “like a palm stump” because they are dhammas that have not grown up again.

original: vā matthakacchinnatālo viya katāti tālāvatthukatā. Yasmā pana evaṃ tālāvatthukatā🔽anabhāvaṃkatā honti, yathā nesaṃ pacchābhāvo na hoti, tathā katā honti. Tasmā āha
analyzed: vā matthaka chinna tālaḥ tālāvatthuka tā pana evam tālāvatthuka tā  anabhāvaṃkatāḥ honti yathā pacchābhāvaḥ na hoti tathā katāḥ honti tasmai āha
translated: Or alternatively, they are “like a palm stump” because they have been made like a palm stump whose top has been cut off and which will not grow up again.🔽But since they have been made “like a palm stump” in this way, they have been made “non-existent” in the sense that they will not come to be again in the future. That is why it is said:

original: – anabhāvaṃkatāti. Āyatiṃ anuppādadhammāti anāgate anuppajjanakasabhāvā.
analyzed: anabhāvaṃkatā ati āyatim an uppāda dhammā ati anāgate an uppajjanaka sabhāvā
translated: “They have been made non-existent” . “They have become non-existent in the future” : they have become non-arisen in the future.

original: No ca kho yaṃ tvaṃ sandhāya vadesīti yañca kho tvaṃ sandhāya vadesi, so pariyāyo
analyzed: no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti yat ca kho tvam sandhāya vadesi saḥ pariyāyaḥ
translated: But not in the way you mean.

original: na hoti. Nanu ca evaṃ vutte yo brāhmaṇena vutto sāmaggiraso, tassa attani vijjamānatā
analyzed: na hoti nanu ca evam vutte yaḥ brāhmaṇena vuttaḥ tassa attani vijjamāna tā
translated: When this was said, was not the fact that the brahmin’s own words applied to himself admitted?

original: anuññātā hotīti? Na hoti. Yo hi naṃ sāmaggirasaṃ kātuṃ bhabbo hutvā na karoti, so
analyzed: anuññātā hoti iti na hoti yaḥ hi nam sāmaggirasam kātum bhabbaḥ hutvā na karoti so
translated: No, it was not. For one who is able to make the statement “I am one who has attained the state of union” but does not do so,

original: tadabhāvena arasarūpoti vattabbataṃ arahati. Bhagavā pana abhabbova etaṃ kātuṃ, tenassa🔽kāraṇe abhabbataṃ pakāsento āha – “no ca kho yaṃ tvaṃ sandhāya vadesī”ti. Yaṃ pariyāyaṃ🔽sandhāya tvaṃ maṃ “arasarūpo”ti vadesi, so amhesu neva vattabboti.
analyzed: tad abhāvena arasa rūpaḥ ti vattabba tam arahati bhagavā pana abhabbaḥ uva etam kātum tena assa  kāraṇe abhabba tam pakāsentaḥ āha no ca kho yam tvam sandhāya vadesi iti yam pariyāyam  sandhāya tvam mam arasarūpaḥ iti vadesi saḥ amhesu na iva vattabbo ti
translated: is worthy to be called “one who has not attained the state of union” because of his failure to do so. But the Exalted One is incapable of making that statement, and therefore,🔽in order to show that he is incapable of doing so, the Exalted One said: “But not in the way you mean.” The brahmin should not make the statement “I am one who has attained the state of union” in reference to any of the four ways.

original: Evaṃ brāhmaṇo attanā adhippetaṃ arasarūpataṃ āropetuṃ asakkonto athāparaṃ nibbhogo
analyzed: evam brāhmaṇaḥ attanā adhippetam a rasa rūpa tam āropetum a sakkontaḥ atha aparam nibbhogaḥ
translated: When the brahmin was unable to impose the meaning he intended by the term “one who has not attained the state of union,” he then said: “He is not a man of renunciation,” etc.

original: bhavantiādimāha. Sabbapariyāyesu cettha vuttanayeneva yojanākkamaṃ viditvā sandhāyabhāsitamatthaṃ
analyzed: bhavanti ādim āha sabba pariyāyesu ca ittha vutta nayena iva yojanā kkamam viditvā sandhāya bhāsitam attham
translated: In all the four ways, the meaning of the statement should be understood in accordance with the method stated above.

original: evaṃ veditabbaṃ – brāhmaṇo tadeva vayovuddhānaṃ abhivādanādikammaṃ loke “sāmaggiparibhogo”ti🔽maññamāno tadabhāvena ca bhagavantaṃ “nibbhogo”tiādimāha. Bhagavā ca yvāyaṃ rūpādīsu
analyzed: evam veditabbam brāhmaṇaḥ tat eva vayaḥ vuddhānam abhivādana ādi kammam loke sāmaggi paribhogā ti  maññamānaḥ tad abhāvena ca bhagavantam nibbhoga uti ādim āha bhagavā ca yvā ayam rūpa ādīsu
translated: This is how it should be understood. The brahmin, thinking that the very same duties of paying homage to the elders, etc., which are done in the world,

original: sattānaṃ chandarāgaparibhogo, tadabhāvaṃ attani sampassamāno aparaṃ pariyāyamanujāni.
analyzed: sattānam chanda rāga paribhogaḥ tad abhāvam attani sampassamānaḥ aparam pariyāyam anujāni
translated: are “enjoyment through association,” and seeing that the Blessed One does not do them, says, “He is one who enjoys non-enjoyment.” But the Blessed One, seeing that the enjoyment of beings in the world is the enjoyment of form, etc.,🔽and that he himself is devoid of that, assents to the brahmin’s statement by his silence.

original: Puna brāhmaṇo yaṃ loke vayovuddhānaṃ abhivādanādikulasamudācārakammaṃ lokiyā karonti,🔽tassa akiriyaṃ sampassamāno bhagavantaṃ akiriyavādoti āha. Bhagavā pana yasmā kāyaduccaritādīnaṃ
analyzed: puna brāhmaṇaḥ yam loke vayaḥ vuddhānam abhivādana ādi kula samudācāra kammam lokiyā karonti  tassa akiriyam sampassamānaḥ bhagavantam akiriya vādaḥ iti āha bhagavā pana yasmā kāya duccarita ādīnam
translated: Again, the brahmin, seeing that the Blessed One does not do the duties of worldly courtesy, such as paying homage to the elders, etc.,

original: akiriyaṃ vadati, tasmā taṃ akiriyavāditaṃ attani sampassamāno aparaṃ pariyāyamanujāni.
analyzed: akiriyam vadati tasmai tam akiriya vāditam attani sampassamānaḥ aparam pariyāyam anujāni
translated: which are done in the world by those who are worldly, says, “He is one who advocates non-doing.” But the Blessed One, seeing that he himself advocates the non-doing of bodily misconduct, etc.,🔽assents to the brahmin’s statement by his silence.

original: Tattha ṭhapetvā kāyaduccaritādīni avasesā akusalā dhammā anekavihitā pāpakā akusalā dhammāti veditabbā.
analyzed: tattha ṭhapetvā kāya duccarita ādīni avasesāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ aneka vihitā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammā ti veditabbā
translated: Herein, all the unwholesome states other than bodily misconduct, etc., should be understood as “the many kinds of evil unwholesome states.”

original: Puna brāhmaṇo tadeva abhivādanādikammaṃ bhagavati apassanto “imaṃ āgamma ayaṃ lokatanti
analyzed: puna brāhmaṇaḥ tat eva abhivādana ādi kammam bhagavati a passantaḥ imam āgamma ayam loka tanti
translated: Then, since the brahmin did not see the Blessed One do the duties of salutation, etc., he thought: “This world has been led astray by this man.

original: lokapaveṇī ucchijjatī”ti maññamāno bhagavantaṃ ucchedavādoti āha. Bhagavā pana yasmā
analyzed: loka paveṇī ucchijjati iti maññamānaḥ bhagavantam uccheda vādā iti āha bhagavā pana yasmai
translated: The current of the world has been broken.” Thinking thus, he said to the Blessed One: “You are an annihilationist.”

original: pañcakāmaguṇikarāgassa ceva akusalacittadvayasampayuttassa ca dosassa anāgāmimaggena
analyzed: pañca kāmaguṇika rāgassa ca iva akusala citta dvaya sampayuttassa ca dosassa anāgāmi maggena
translated: But the Blessed One, since he declares the annihilation of the lust for the five strands of sense pleasure and of the hate associated with the two unwholesome types of consciousness by means of the path of non-return,

original: ucchedaṃ vadati, sabbākusalasambhavassa pana mohassa arahattamaggena ucchedaṃ vadati,
analyzed: ucchedam vadati sabba akusala sambhavassa pana mohassa arahatta maggena ucchedam vadati
translated: and the annihilation of the delusion that is the source of all unwholesome states by means of the path of arahatship,

original: ṭhapetvā te tayo avasesānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ yathānurūpaṃ catūhi maggehi
analyzed: ṭhapetvā te tayaḥ avasesānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam yathānurūpam catūhi maggehi
translated: and the annihilation of the remaining evil unwholesome states by means of the four paths in accordance with their respective spheres,

original: ucchedaṃ vadati, tasmā taṃ ucchedavādaṃ attani sampassamāno aparaṃ pariyāyamanujāni.
analyzed: ucchedam vadati tasmai tam uccheda vādam attani sampassamānaḥ aparam pariyāyam anujāni
translated: saw that he himself was an annihilationist. Therefore he approved the other method.

original: Puna brāhmaṇo “jigucchati maññe samaṇo gotamo idaṃ vayovuddhānaṃ abhivādanādikulasamudācārakammaṃ,
analyzed: puna brāhmaṇaḥ jigucchati maññe samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ idam vayaḥ vuddhānam abhivādana ādi kula samudācāra kammaṃ
translated: Then the brahmin thought: “The recluse Gotama despises the duties of salutation, etc., which are the practice of good families in this world.

original: tena taṃ na karotī”ti maññamāno bhagavantaṃ jegucchīti āha. Bhagavā pana yasmā jigucchati
analyzed: tena tam na karoti iti maññamānaḥ bhagavantam jegucchi iti āha bhagavā pana yasmai jigucchati
translated: But the Blessed One is disgusted with

original: kāyaduccaritādīhi, yāni kāyavacīmanoduccaritāni ceva yāva ca akusalānaṃ lāmakadhammānaṃ🔽samāpatti samāpajjanā samaṅgibhāvo, taṃ sabbampi gūthaṃ viya maṇḍanakajātiko puriso
analyzed: kāya duccarita ādīhi yāni kāya vacī manaḥ duccaritāni ca iva yāva ca akusalānam  samāpatti samāpajjanā samaṅgi bhāvo tam sabbam pi gūtham viya maṇḍanaka jātikaḥ puriso
translated: the bodily misconduct, etc., and with the attainment of the evil states of lust, hate, and delusion,

original: jigucchati hirīyati, tasmā taṃ jegucchitaṃ attani sampassamāno aparaṃ pariyāyamanujāni.
analyzed: jigucchati hirīyati tasmai tam jegucchitam attani sampassamānaḥ aparam pariyāyam anujāni
translated: just as a man of good family is disgusted with and ashamed of excrement. Therefore, seeing that he is disgusted with it, he allowed another method.

original: Tattha kāyaduccaritenātiādi karaṇavacanaṃ upayogatthe daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: tattha kāya duccaritena ati ādi karaṇavacanam upayoga atthe daṭṭhabbam
translated: Herein, the words “with bodily misconduct” and so on should be regarded as verbal expressions in the instrumental case to show the method.

original: Puna brāhmaṇo tadeva abhivādanādikammaṃ bhagavati apassanto “ayaṃ idaṃ lokajeṭṭhakakammaṃ🔽vineti vināseti, atha vā yasmā etaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ na karoti, tasmā ayaṃ vinetabbo
analyzed: puna brāhmaṇaḥ tat eva abhivādana ādi kammam bhagavati a passantaḥ ayam idam loka jeṭṭhaka kammaṃ  vineti atha vā yasmai etam sāmīci kammam na karoti tasmai ayam vinetabbo
translated: Again, the brahmin, not seeing the Blessed One doing the duties of saluting, etc., thought, “This man rejects and destroys the duties of the world’s chief;

original: niggaṇhitabbo”ti maññamāno bhagavantaṃ venayikoti āha. Tatrāyaṃ padattho – vinayatīti
analyzed: niggaṇhitabbo ti maññamānaḥ bhagavantam venayikaḥ iti āha tatra ayam padatthaḥ vinayati iti
translated: or else, since he does not do the duties of a pupil, he should be rejected and subdued,” and so he said that the Blessed One is a venayika. Herein, the meaning of the words is this: he rejects, thus he is a venayika ;

original: vinayo, vināsetīti vuttaṃ hoti. Vinayo eva venayiko. Vinayaṃ vā arahatīti venayiko,
analyzed: vinayaḥ vināseti iti vuttam hoti vinayaḥ eva venayikaḥ vinayam vai arahati iti venayikaḥ
translated: Vinaya means that which causes to be destroyed; that which is to be destroyed is the defilements. Or else, vinaya means that which is worthy of being restrained; that which is worthy of being restrained is the defilements.

original: niggahaṃ arahatīti vuttaṃ hoti. Bhagavā pana yasmā rāgādīnaṃ vinayāya vūpasamāya🔽dhammaṃ deseti, tasmā venayiko hoti. Ayameva cettha padattho – vinayāya dhammaṃ desetīti
analyzed: niggaham arahati iti vuttam hoti bhagavā pana yasmai rāga ādīnam vinayāya vūpasamāya  dhammam deseti tasmai venayikaḥ hoti ayam eva ca ittha padatthaḥ vinayāya dhammam deseti iti
translated: The Blessed One is called a “vinaya-master” because he teaches the Dhamma for the destruction of the defilements.🔽The Blessed One is called a “vinaya-master” because he teaches the Dhamma for the destruction of the defilements.🔽The Blessed One is called a “vinaya-master” because he teaches the Dhamma for the destruction of the defilements.🔽The Blessed One is called a “vinaya-master” because he teaches the Dhamma for the destruction of the defilements.

analyzed: venayikaḥ vicitrā hi tad hita vutti svāyam tam venayika bhāvam attani sampassamānaḥ  aparam  puna brāhmaṇaḥ yasmai abhivādana ādīni sāmīci kammāni karontā vayaḥ vuddhe tosenti hāsenti
translated: The Blessed One is called a “vinaya-master” because he teaches the Dhamma for the destruction of the defilements.🔽The Blessed One is called a “vinaya-master” because he teaches the Dhamma for the destruction of the defilements.🔽The Blessed One is called a “vinaya-master” because he teaches the Dhamma for the destruction of the defilements.🔽The Blessed One is called a “vinaya-master” because he teaches the Dhamma for the destruction of the defilements.

analyzed: a karontā pana tāpenti vihesenti domanassam uppādenti bhagavā ca tāni na karoti 🔽tasmai ayam vayaḥ vuddhe tapati iti maññamāno sappurisa ācāra virahita ttā vā kapaṇa puriso

original: aya”nti maññamāno bhagavantaṃ tapassīti āha. Tatrāyaṃ padattho – tapatīti tapo, roseti
analyzed: ayanti maññamānaḥ bhagavantam tapassi iti āha tatra ayam padatthaḥ tapati iti tapaḥ rosa iti
translated: thinking, “He is a self-mortifier,” he said to the Exalted One, “self-mortifier.” Herein, the word-meaning is this: He burns, thus he is a burner ;

original: vihesetīti attho. Sāmīcikammākaraṇassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Tapo assa atthīti tapassī.
analyzed: viheseti iti attho sāmīci kamma akaraṇassa etam adhivacanam tapaḥ assa atthi iti tapassī
translated: the meaning is, he torments, he harasses. This is a designation for one who does not do what is proper. He has burning, thus he is a self-mortifier .

original: Dutiye atthavikappe byañjanāni avicāretvā loke kapaṇapuriso tapassīti vuccati. Bhagavā🔽pana ye akusalā dhammā lokaṃ tapanato tapanīyāni vuccanti, tesaṃ pahīnattā yasmā
analyzed: dutiye attha vikappe byañjanāni a vicāretvā loke kapaṇa puriso tapassī iti vuccati bhagavā  pana ye akusalāḥ dhammāḥ lokam tapanataḥ tapanīyāni vuccanti tesam pahīna ttā yasmā
translated: In the second interpretation, without considering the syllables, the world calls a poor man a self-mortifier. But the Exalted One

original: tapassīti saṅkhaṃ gato. Tasmā taṃ tapassitaṃ attani sampassamāno aparaṃ pariyāyamanujāni.
analyzed: tapassīti saṅkham gataḥ tasmā tam tapassitam attani sampassamānaḥ aparam pariyāyam anujāni
translated: has become known as a self-mortifier because he has abandoned the unprofitable states called “burnings” because they burn the world. Therefore, seeing that self-mortification in himself, he consented to another interpretation.

original: Tatrāyaṃ vacanattho – tapantīti tapā, akusaladhammānametaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Te tape assi
analyzed: tatra ayam vacana atthaḥ tapanti iti tapā akusala dhammānam etam adhivacanam te tape assi
translated: Herein, the word-meaning is this: They burn, thus they are burnings ; this is a designation for unprofitable states. He has no burnings,

original: nirassi pahāsi viddhaṃsīti tapassī.
analyzed: nirassi pahāsi viddhaṃsi iti tapassī
translated: he has abandoned them, he has destroyed them, thus he is a self-mortifier .

original: Puna brāhmaṇo taṃ abhivādanādikammaṃ devalokagabbhasampattiyā devalokapaṭisandhipaṭilābhāya
analyzed: puna brāhmaṇaḥ tam abhivādana ādi kammam deva loka gabbha sampattiyā deva loka paṭisandhi paṭilābhāya
translated: Again, the brahmin thought, “That act of paying homage, etc., is a condition for the obtaining of rebirth-linking in the womb of a deity’s order in the heavenly world,

original: saṃvattatīti maññamāno bhagavati cassa abhāvaṃ disvā bhagavantaṃ apagabbhoti āha.
analyzed: saṃvattati iti maññamānaḥ bhagavati ca assa abhāvam disvā bhagavantam apagabbho ti āha
translated: and thinking that it was the cause of his being reborn in a womb, he said that the Blessed One was not reborn in a womb because he did not have it.

original: Kodhavasena vā bhagavato mātukucchismiṃ paṭisandhiggahaṇe dosaṃ dassentopi evamāha.
analyzed: kodha vasena vā bhagavataḥ mātukucchismim paṭisandhi ggahaṇe dosam dassentaḥ api evam āha
translated: Or else, by showing the danger in the Blessed One’s conception in his mother’s womb through anger, he said this.

original: Tatrāyaṃ vacanattho – gabbhato apagatoti apagabbho, abhabbo devalokūpapattiṃ pāpuṇitunti
analyzed: tatra ayam vacana atthaḥ gabbhataḥ apagataḥ ti apagabbhaḥ abhabbaḥ deva loka upapattim pāpuṇitun ti
translated: Here is the meaning of the words: He has gone out from a womb is apagabbha; he is incapable of attaining rebirth in the deva world is the intention.

original: adhippāyo. Hīno vā gabbho assāti apagabbho. Devalokagabbhaparibāhirattā āyatiṃ hīnagabbhapaṭilābhabhāgīti.
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ hīnaḥ vā gabbhaḥ assa ati apagabbhaḥ deva loka gabbha paribāhira ttā āyatim hīna gabbha paṭilābha bhāgī iti
translated: Or else, he is apagabbha because his womb is low; because he is excluded from the womb of the deva world, he is a partaker of the attainment of a low womb in the future.

original: Hīno vāssa mātukucchismiṃ gabbhavāso ahosīti adhippāyo. Bhagavato pana yasmā āyatiṃ🔽gabbhaseyyā apagatā, tasmā so taṃ apagabbhataṃ attani sampassamāno aparaṃ pariyāyamanujāni.
analyzed: hīnaḥ vā assa mātukucchismim gabbha vāsaḥ ahosi iti adhippāyaḥ bhagavataḥ pana yasmai āyatim  gabbhaseyyā apagatā tasmā saḥ tam apagabbhatam attani sampassamānaḥ aparam pariyāyam anujāni
translated: The intention is that his stay in the womb of his mother was low. But since the Blessed One has gone out from a womb in the future,🔽he allowed another explanation.

original: Tatra ca yassa kho, brāhmaṇa, āyatiṃ gabbhaseyyā punabbhavābhinibbatti pahīnāti etesaṃ
analyzed: tatra ca yassa kho brāhmaṇaḥ āyatim gabbhaseyyā punabbhava abhinibbatti etesam
translated: And here, in the case of those who have abandoned future lying in a womb and rebirth in a new existence,

original: padānaṃ evamattho daṭṭhabbo – “brāhmaṇa, yassa puggalassa anāgate gabbhaseyyā punabbhave🔽ca abhinibbatti anuttarena maggena vihatakāraṇattā pahīnā. Gabbhaseyyāgahaṇena cettha
analyzed: padānam evamatthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ brāhmaṇa yassa puggalassa anāgate gabbhaseyyā punabbhave  ca abhinibbatti anuttarena maggena vihata kāraṇa ttā pahīnā gabbhaseyyā gahaṇena ca ittha
translated: The meaning should be regarded thus: “Brahmin, the person in whom the lying down in a womb and the rebirth in future existence🔽have been abandoned by the noble path, which has destroyed them, has no more lying down in a womb or rebirth in future existence.”

original: jalābujayoni gahitā, punabbhavābhinibbattiggahaṇena itarā tisso”pi.
analyzed: jalābu jayoni gahitā punabbhava abhinibbatti ggahaṇena itarā tissaḥ api
translated: By the mention of lying down in a womb here, the womb-born generation is included, and by the mention of rebirth in future existence, the other three generations are included.

original: Apica gabbhassa seyyā gabbhaseyyā. Punabbhavo eva abhinibbatti punabbhavābhinibbattīti
analyzed: apica gabbhassa seyyā gabbha seyyā punabbhavaḥ eva abhinibbatti punabbhava abhinibbatti iti
translated: Moreover, the lying down in a womb is the lying down in a womb. Rebirth itself is rebirth in future existence.

original: evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo. Yathā ca viññāṇaṭṭhitīti vuttepi na viññāṇato aññā ṭhiti🔽atthi, evamidhāpi na gabbhato aññā seyyā veditabbā. Abhinibbatti ca nāma yasmā punabbhavabhūtāpi🔽apunabbhavabhūtāpi atthi, idha ca punabbhavabhūtā adhippetā, tasmā vuttaṃ – “punabbhavo
analyzed: evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo yathā ca viññāṇa ṭhiti iti vutte pi na viññāṇataḥ aññā ṭhiti  atthi evam idha api na gabbhataḥ aññā seyyā veditabbā abhinibbatti ca nāma yasmā punabbhava bhūtā api  a punabbhava bhūtā api atthi idha ca punabbhava bhūtā adhippetā tasmā vuttam punabbhavaḥ
translated: Thus the meaning should be regarded here. And just as, when it is said “the station of consciousness,” there is no station other than consciousness,🔽so here too the lying down should not be regarded as anything other than the womb. And rebirth is of two kinds: that which is rebirth in the sense of a new becoming and that which is rebirth in the sense of a repeated becoming. Here rebirth in the sense of a new becoming is intended.

original: eva abhinibbatti punabbhavābhinibbattī”ti.
analyzed: eva abhinibbatti punabbhava abhinibbattī iti
translated: Therefore it is said: “Rebirth itself is rebirth in future existence.”

original: Evaṃ āgatakālato paṭṭhāya arasarūpatādīhi aṭṭhahi akkosavatthūhi akkosantampi brāhmaṇaṃ
analyzed: evam āgata kālataḥ paṭṭhāya a rasa rūpa tā ādīhi aṭṭhahi akkosa vatthūhi akkosantam pi brāhmaṇam
translated: From the time of his arrival, the brahmin had been reviling the Blessed One with eight grounds for accusation, such as “He is without the essence” .

original: bhagavā dhammissaro dhammarājā dhammasāmī tathāgato anukampāya sītaleneva cakkhunā
analyzed: bhagavā dhammissaraḥ dhamma rājā dhamma sāmī tathāgataḥ anukampāya sītalena iva cakkhunā
translated: But the Blessed One, the Lord of the Dhamma, the King of the Dhamma, the Master of the Dhamma, the Tathāgata, looked upon the brahmin with a cool eye

original: brāhmaṇaṃ olekento yaṃ dhammadhātuṃ paṭivijjhitvā desanāvilāsappattā nāma hoti, tassā🔽dhammadhātuyā suppaṭividdhattā vigatavalāhake nabhe puṇṇacando viya ca saradakāle
analyzed: brāhmaṇam olekentaḥ yam dhammadhātum paṭivijjhitvā desanā vilāsa pattā nāma hoti tassā  dhammadhātuyā vigata valāhake nabhe puṇṇa candaḥ viya ca sarada kāle
translated: and, having penetrated the plane of the Dhamma that is called “the attainment of the radiance of the teaching,”🔽he revealed it to the brahmin as if it were the full moon in a cloudless sky,

original: sūriyo viya ca brāhmaṇassa hadayandhakāraṃ vidhamento tāniyeva akkosavatthūni tena
analyzed: sūriyaḥ viya ca brāhmaṇassa hadaya andhakāram vidhamento tāniyā iva akkosa vatthūni tena
translated: or as if it were the sun in autumn, dispelling the darkness of his heart.

original: tena pariyāyena aññathā dassetvā punapi attano karuṇāvipphāraṃ aṭṭhahi lokadhammehi
analyzed: tena pariyāyena aññathā dassetvā puna api attano karuṇā vipphāram aṭṭhahi loka dhammehi
translated: Having shown the grounds for accusation in various ways, he again revealed his own compassion, which is unshaken by the eight worldly conditions,

original: akampiyabhāvena paṭiladdhatādiguṇalakkhaṇaṃ pathavisamacittataṃ akuppadhammatañca
analyzed: akampiya bhāvena paṭiladdha tā ādi guṇa lakkhaṇam pathavi sama citta tam akuppa dhamma tam ca
translated: and which has the characteristic of attaining the qualities beginning with the state of being immovable.

original: pakāsento “ayaṃ brāhmaṇo kevalaṃ palitasirakhaṇḍadantavalittacatādīhi attano vuddhabhāvaṃ
analyzed: pakāsentaḥ ayam brāhmaṇaḥ kevalam vuddha bhāvam
translated: “This brahmin,” he thought, “is old, with grey hair and broken teeth, and his skin is wrinkled. He is bent like a roof-beam and limps as he walks.

original: sallakkheti, no ca kho jānāti attānaṃ jātiyā anugataṃ jarāya anusaṭaṃ byādhino adhibhūtaṃ
analyzed: sallakkheti no ca kho jānāti attānam jātiyāḥ anugatam jarāya anusaṭam byādhinaḥ adhibhūtam
translated: He did not know that he himself was subject to birth, subject to old age, subject to disease, subject to death,

original: maraṇena abbhāhataṃ ajja maritvā puna sveva uttānaseyyadārakabhāvagamanīyaṃ. Mahantena
analyzed: maraṇena abbhāhatam ajja maritvā punar svā iva uttānaseyya dāraka bhāva gamanīyam mahantena
translated: and that after dying he would have to go to the womb of a mother and be reborn as a child lying on his back, and then grow up and become a youth.

original: kho pana ussāhena mama santikaṃ āgato, tadassa āgamanaṃ sātthakaṃ hotū”ti cintetvā🔽imasmiṃ loke attano appaṭisamaṃ purejātabhāvaṃ dassento seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇātiādinā
analyzed: kho pana ussāhena mama santikam āgataḥ tat assa āgamanam sātthakam hotu iti cintetvā  imasmin loke attanaḥ appaṭisamam purejāta bhāvam dassento seyyathā api brāhmaṇa ati ādinā
translated: But he had come to me with great effort, and so I thought, “Let his coming be not in vain.”🔽And so I increased the brahmin’s understanding of the Dhamma by showing him my own incomparable pre-eminence in the world, saying,

original: nayena brāhmaṇassa dhammadesanaṃ vaḍḍhesi.
analyzed: nayena brāhmaṇassa dhamma desanam vaḍḍhesi
translated: “Brahmin, just as the young of animals…”

original: Tattha seyyathāpītiādīnaṃ heṭṭhā vutanayeneva attho veditabbo. Ayaṃ pana viseso –
analyzed: tattha seyyathā api iti ādīnam heṭṭhā vuta nayena iva atthaḥ veditabbaḥ ayam pana viseso
translated: Herein, the meaning of “just as” and so on should be understood in the way already given . But there is this difference.

original: heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva hi te kukkuṭapotakā pakkhe vidhunantā taṃkhaṇānurūpaṃ viravantā
analyzed: heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva hi te kukkuṭa potakā pakkhe vidhunantā tad khaṇa anurūpam viravantā
translated: For just as those chicks, shaking their wings, chirping in the way peculiar to them,🔽came out of the eggs, so those who have gone forth from the home life come out of the four kinds of birth.

original: nikkhamanti. Evaṃ nikkhamantānañca tesaṃ yo paṭhamataraṃ nikkhamati, so jeṭṭhoti
analyzed: nikkhamanti evam nikkhamantānam ca tesam yaḥ paṭhamataram nikkhamati so jeṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: And of those who have gone forth, he who goes forth first is the eldest,

original: vuccati. Tasmā bhagavā tāya upamāya attano jeṭṭhabhāvaṃ sādhetukāmo brāhmaṇaṃ pucchati🔽– yo nu kho tesaṃ kukkuṭacchāpotakānaṃ…pe… kinti svāssa vacanīyoti. Tattha kukkuṭacchāpakānanti
analyzed: vuccati tasmai bhagavā tāya upamāya attanaḥ jeṭṭha bhāvam sādhetu kāmaḥ brāhmaṇam pucchati  yaḥ nu kho tesam kukkuṭa chāpotakānam pe kinti tattha kukkuṭa chāpakānam ti
translated: is said. Therefore, the Blessed One, wishing to establish his own seniority by that simile, asks the brahmin🔽– “Which of those chicks would be the one to say: ‘I am the eldest, I am the eldest’?” Herein, of those chicks means

original: kukkuṭapotakānaṃ. Kinti svāssa vacanīyoti so kinti vacanīyo assa, kiṃ vattabbo bhaveyya
analyzed: kukkuṭa potakānam kinti svā assa vacanīyaḥ iti saḥ kinti vacanīyaḥ assa kim vattabbaḥ bhaveyya
translated: of the chicks. Which would be the one to say: ‘I am the eldest, I am the eldest’ means which would be the one to say: ‘I am the eldest, I am the eldest’, which would be the one to say: ‘I am the eldest, I am the eldest’.

original: jeṭṭho vā kaniṭṭho vāti.
analyzed: jeṭṭhaḥ vā kaniṭṭhaḥ vā ati
translated: Eldest or youngest?

original: “Jeṭṭho”tissa, bho gotama, vacanīyoti, bho gotama, so jeṭṭho iti assa vacanīyo. Kasmāti
analyzed: jeṭṭhaḥ tissa bho gotama vacanīyo ti bho gotama saḥ jeṭṭhaḥ iti assa vacanīyo kasmā iti
translated: “‘Eldest’, Master Gotama, would be the one to say: ‘I am the eldest, I am the eldest’?” “Why is that, Master Gotama?”

original: ce? So hi nesaṃ jeṭṭhoti, yasmā so nesaṃ vuddhataroti attho. Athassa bhagavā opammaṃ
analyzed: ce saḥ hi nesam jeṭṭhaḥ ti yasmā so nesam vuddhataraḥ ti atthaḥ athassa bhagavā opammaṃ
translated: “Because he is the eldest of them.” “But why is he the eldest of them?” “Because he is the oldest of them.” Then the Blessed One,

original: sampaṭipādento evameva khoti āha, yathā so kukkuṭapotako, evaṃ ahampi. Avijjāgatāya
analyzed: sampaṭipādentaḥ evam eva kho ti āha yathā saḥ kukkuṭa potakaḥ evam aham pi avijjā gatāya
translated: teaching the Dhamma with a simile, said: “So too, brahmin, I am the eldest of the world, the first, the chief, the originator, the producer, the cause, the condition, of all beings.

original: pajāyāti avijjā vuccati aññāṇaṃ, tattha gatāya. Pajāyāti sattadhivacanametaṃ, avijjākosassa
analyzed: pajāyā ti avijjā vuccati aññāṇam tattha gatāya pajāyā ati satta adhivacanam etam avijjā kosassa
translated: “‘To the generation gone astray’ means to the generation that has gone to ignorance. ‘Gone astray’ is a term for the mass of ignorance.

original: anto paviṭṭhesu sattesūpi vuttaṃ hoti. Aṇḍabhūtāyāti aṇḍe bhūtāya pajātāya sañjātāya.
analyzed: antar paviṭṭhesu sattesu api vuttam hoti aṇḍa bhūtāya ati aṇḍe bhūtāya pajātāya sañjātāya
translated: “In the egg” : in the egg that has been formed, produced, generated.

original: Yathā hi aṇḍe nibbattā ekacce sattā aṇḍabhūtāti vuccanti, evamayaṃ sabbāpi pajā avijjaṇḍakose🔽nibbattattā aṇḍabhūtāti vuccati. Pariyonaddhāyāti tena avijjaṇḍakosena samantato
analyzed: yathā hi aṇḍe nibbattāḥ ekacce sattāḥ aṇḍa bhūtāḥ iti vuccanti evam ayam sabbā api pajā  nibbatta ttā aṇḍa bhūtā iti vuccati pariyonaddhāya iti tena a vijjaṇḍa kosena samantataḥ
translated: For just as some beings are called “in the egg” because they are conceived in an egg, so too this whole generation is called “in the egg”🔽because it is conceived in the egg of ignorance.🔽“Enveloped” : completely covered, bound, wrapped, by that egg of ignorance.

original: onaddhāya baddhāya veṭhitāya. Avijjaṇḍakosaṃ padāletvāti taṃ avijjāmayaṃ aṇḍakosaṃ
analyzed: onaddhāya baddhāya veṭhitāya avijja ṇḍa kosam padāletvā ati tam avijja mayam aṇḍa kosam
translated: “Having broken through the egg of ignorance” : having split open that egg of ignorance.

original: bhinditvā. Ekova loketi sakalepi lokasannivāse ahameva eko adutiyo. Anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ🔽abhisambuddhoti uttararahitaṃ sabbaseṭṭhaṃ sammā sāmañca bodhiṃ, atha vā pasatthaṃ
analyzed: bhinditvā ekaḥ iva loka iti sakale api loka sannivāse aham eva ekaḥ adutiyaḥ anuttaram sammāsambodhim  abhisambuddhaḥ ti uttara rahitam sabba seṭṭham sammā sāmañca bodhim atha vā pasattham
translated: “I alone am in the world” : in the entire world-sphere I alone am the one, the only one.

original: sundarañca bodhiṃ. Arahattamaggañāṇassetaṃ nāmaṃ, sabbaññutaññāṇassāpi nāmameva.
analyzed: sundaram ca bodhim arahatta magga ñāṇassa itam nāmam sabbaññuta ññāṇassa api nāmam eva
translated: “I have awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment” : I have awakened to the unsurpassed, most excellent, perfect, and complete enlightenment. Or else: I have awakened to the enlightenment that is praised and beautiful. This is a name for the knowledge of the path of arahatship, and also for the knowledge of omniscience.🔽Both are appropriate.

original: Ubhayampi vaṭṭati. Aññesaṃ arahattamaggo anuttarā bodhi hoti, na hotīti? Na hoti.
analyzed: ubhayam pi vaṭṭati aññesam arahatta maggo anuttarā bodhi hoti na hoti iti na hoti
translated: Is the path of arahatship the unsurpassed enlightenment of others? No, it is not.

original: Kasmā? Asabbaguṇadāyakattā. Tesañhi kassaci arahattamaggo arahattaphalameva deti,
analyzed: kasmai asabba guṇa dāyaka ttā tesam hi kassaci arahatta maggaḥ arahatta phalam eva deti
translated: Why? Because it does not give all the special qualities. For some it gives only the path of arahatship and the fruit of arahatship,

original: kassaci tisso vijjā, kassaci cha abhiññā, kassaci catasso paṭisambhidā, kassaci sāvakapāramiñāṇaṃ.
analyzed: kassaci tissaḥ vijjā kassaci cha abhiññā kassaci catasso paṭisambhidā kassaci sāvaka pāramiñāṇam
translated: for some the three knowledges, for some the six kinds of direct knowledge, for some the four discriminations, for some the knowledge of one endowed with the ten powers,

original: Paccekabuddhānampi paccekabodhiñāṇameva deti, buddhānaṃ pana sabbaguṇasampattiṃ deti
analyzed: paccekabuddhānam pi pacceka bodhi ñāṇam eva deti buddhānam pana sabba guṇa sampattim deti
translated: for some the knowledge of a paccekabuddha, but for the Buddhas it gives the perfection of all special qualities,

original: abhiseko viya rañño sabbalokissarabhāvaṃ. Tasmā aññassa kassacipi anuttarā bodhi
analyzed: abhisekaḥ viya raññaḥ sabba lokissara bhāvam tasmai aññassa kassaci pi anuttarā bodhi
translated: like the anointing of a king, which gives him lordship over the whole world. Therefore no one else’s enlightenment is supreme.

original: na hotīti. Abhisambuddhoti abbhaññāsiṃ paṭivijjhiṃ, pattomhi adhigatomhīti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: na hoti iti abhisambuddhaḥ ti abbhaññāsim paṭivijjhim pattomhi adhigatomhi iti vuttam hoti
translated: Abhisambuddho: I have known, penetrated, attained, and realized.

original: Idāni yadetaṃ bhagavatā “evameva kho”tiādinā nayena vuttaṃ opammasampaṭipādanaṃ,

translated: and he should say: “Having burst the egg of ignorance, which conceals and hides the appearance of this world and the other world, and having broken through the shell of ignorance, he knows: ‘Destroyed is birth, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more for this state of being.’ ”

original: Yaṃ panetaṃ paccavekkhaṇañāṇapariggahitaṃ āsavānaṃ khayañāṇādhigamaṃ brāhmaṇassa
analyzed: yam pana etam paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇa pariggahitam āsavānam khaya ñāṇa adhigamam brāhmaṇassa
translated: But when he shows the brahmin the attainment of the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers, which is accompanied by the knowledge of reviewing,

original: dassento ayaṃ kho me, brāhmaṇa, tatiyā vijjātiādimāha, tattha vijjāti arahattamaggavijjā.🔽Avijjāti catusaccappaṭicchādikā avijjā. Ayaṃ kho me, brāhmaṇa, tatiyā abhinibbhidā
analyzed: dassentaḥ ayam kho me brāhmaṇa tatiyā vijjā ti ādim āha tattha vijjā ti arahatta magga vijjā  avijjā ati catu sacca paṭicchādikā avijjā ayam kho me brāhmaṇa tatiyā abhinibbhidā
translated: he says: “This, brahmin, was my third true knowledge. Ignorance was destroyed; knowledge arose — darkness was destroyed; light arose, as happens in one who abides diligent, ardent, and resolute” .🔽Herein, true knowledge is the knowledge of the path of arahatship.🔽Ignorance is the ignorance that conceals the four truths.🔽This was my third breaking out ,

original: ahosīti ettha ayaṃ kho mama, brāhmaṇa, āsavānaṃ khayañāṇamukhatuṇḍakena catusaccapaṭicchādakaṃ🔽avijjaṇḍakosaṃ padāletvā tatiyā abhinibbhidā tatiyā nikkhanti tatiyā ariyajāti ahosi
analyzed: ettha ayam kho mama brāhmaṇaḥ āsavānam khaya ñāṇa mukha tuṇḍakena catu sacca paṭicchādakam  avijjaṇḍa kosam padāletvā tatiyā abhinibbhidā tatiyā nikkhanti tatiyā ariya jāti ahosi
translated: Herein, having burst the egg of ignorance, which conceals the four truths, with the beak of the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers, which is my third breaking out, my third emergence, my third birth into the noble state,

original: kukkuṭacchāpakasseva mukhatuṇḍakena vā pādanakhasikhāya vā aṇḍakosaṃ padāletvā tamhā🔽aṇḍakosamhā abhinibbhidā nikkhanti kukkuṭanikāye paccājātīti.
analyzed: kukkuṭa chāpakassa iva mukha tuṇḍakena vā pāda nakha sikhāya vā aṇḍa kosam padāletvā tamhā 🔽aṇḍa kosamhā abhinibbhidā nikkhanti kukkuṭa nikāye paccājāti iti
translated: like a chick’s breaking out of the egg-shell with its claw-tips and beak, and having emerged from that egg of ignorance,🔽I have become a noble one, arisen in the noble state.”

original: Ettāvatā kiṃ dassesīti? So hi, brāhmaṇa, kukkuṭacchāpako aṇḍakosaṃ padāletvā tato🔽nikkhamanto sakimeva jāyati, ahaṃ pana pubbenivutthakkhandhappaṭicchādakaṃ avijjaṇḍakosaṃ
analyzed: ettāvatā kim dassesi iti saḥ hi brāhmaṇa kukkuṭa chāpakaḥ aṇḍa kosam padāletvā  nikkhamanto sa kim eva jāyati aham pana pubbenivuttha kkhandha ppaṭicchādakam a vijjaṇḍa kosam
translated: What does he show by this? — The cock-hawker, O Brahmin, breaks the shell of the egg with his foot and then comes out.🔽But I, having broken the shell of ignorance which covers the aggregates of existence, was born first by the knowledge of the recollection of former existences.

original: bhinditvā paṭhamaṃ tāva pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇavijjāya jāto. Tato sattānaṃ cutipaṭisandhippaṭicchādakaṃ🔽avijjaṇḍakosaṃ padāletvā dutiyaṃ dibbacakkhuñāṇavijjāya jāto, puna catusaccappaṭicchādakaṃ
analyzed: bhinditvā paṭhamam tāva pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇa vijjāya jātaḥ tatas sattānam cuti paṭisandhi paṭicchādakam  avijjaṇḍa kosam padāletvā dutiyam dibba cakkhu ñāṇa vijjāya jātaḥ puna catu sacca paṭicchādakam
translated: Then, having broken the shell of ignorance which covers the passing away and rebirth of beings, I was born a second time by the knowledge of the divine eye.

original: avijjaṇḍakosaṃ padāletvā tatiyaṃ āsavānaṃ khayañāṇavijjāya jāto. Evaṃ tīhi vijjāhi
analyzed: a vijjaṇḍa kosam padāletvā tatiyam āsavānam khaya ñāṇa vijjāya jātaḥ evam tīhi vijjāhi
translated: Then, having broken the shell of ignorance which covers the Four Noble Truths, I was born a third time by the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers. Thus I was born three times by the three knowledges.

original: tikkhattuṃ jātomhi. Sā ca me jāti ariyā suparisuddhāti idaṃ dasseti. Evaṃdassento
analyzed: tikkhattum jātaḥ amhi sā ca me jāti ariyā su parisuddhā ti idam dasseti evam dassento
translated: And that birth of mine is noble and pure. This is what he shows.

original: ca pubbenivāsañāṇena atītaṃsañāṇaṃ, dibbacakkhunā paccuppannānāgataṃsañāṇaṃ, āsavakkhayena
analyzed: ca pubbenivāsa ñāṇena atīta ṃsa ñāṇam dibba cakkhunā paccuppanna anāgata ṃsa ñāṇam āsava kkhayena
translated: And showing this, he shows by the knowledge of the recollection of former existences the knowledge of the past, by the divine eye the knowledge of the present and the future, and by the destruction of the cankers the knowledge of the future.

original: sakalalokiyalokuttaraguṇanti evaṃ tīhi vijjāhi sabbepi sabbaññuguṇe pakāsetvā attano🔽ariyāya jātiyā jeṭṭhaseṭṭhabhāvaṃ brāhmaṇassa dassesi.🔽Evaṃ vutte verañjo brāhmaṇoti evaṃ bhagavatā lokānukampakena brāhmaṇaṃ anukampamānena🔽niguhitabbepi attano ariyāya jātiyā jeṭṭhaseṭṭhabhāve vijjāttayapakāsikāya dhammadesanāya
analyzed: sakala lokiya lokuttara guṇanti evam tīhi vijjāhi sabbe api sabbaññu guṇe pakāsetvā attanaḥ  ariyāya jātiyāḥ jeṭṭha seṭṭha bhāvam brāhmaṇassa dassesi  evam vutte verañjaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ iti evam bhagavatā loka anukampakena brāhmaṇam anukampamānena  niguhitabbe pi attanaḥ ariyāya jātiyā jeṭṭha seṭṭha bhāve vijjā ttaya pakāsikāya dhamma desanāya
translated: “All the special qualities of the world and of the supramundane world” — thus, having revealed all the special qualities of omniscience by means of the three knowledges, he showed the brahmin🔽the pre-eminence of his own noble birth.🔽When this was said, the brahmin of Verañjā …🔽the Blessed One, the compassionate one, out of compassion for the brahmin,🔽revealed his own pre-eminence of noble birth, which he had concealed, by teaching the Dhamma, which reveals the three knowledges,🔽

original: vutte pītivipphāraparipuṇṇagattacitto verañjo brāhmaṇo taṃ bhagavato ariyāya jātiyā🔽jeṭṭhaseṭṭhabhāvaṃ viditvā “īdisaṃ nāmāhaṃ sabbalokajeṭṭhaṃ sabbaguṇasamannāgataṃ🔽sabbaññuṃ ‘aññesaṃ abhivādanādikammaṃ na karotī’ti avacaṃ, dhiratthu vata, bho, aññāṇa”nti🔽attānaṃ garahitvā “ayaṃ dāni loke ariyāya jātiyā purejātaṭṭhena jeṭṭho, sabbaguṇehi
analyzed: vutte pīti vipphāra paripuṇṇa gatta cittaḥ verañjaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tam bhagavataḥ ariyāya jātiyā 🔽jeṭṭha seṭṭha bhāvam viditvā īdisam nāma aham sabba loka jeṭṭham sabba guṇa samannāgatam 🔽sabbaññum aññesam abhivādana ādi kammam na karoti iti avacam vata bho aññāṇam ti 🔽attānam garahitvā ayam dāni loke ariyāya jātiyā purejāta ṭṭhena jeṭṭhaḥ sabba guṇehi
