analyzed: manāpaḥ hutvā khāyati evam tuyham pi cīvara santosa mahāariya vaṃsena tuṭṭhassa viharato  paṃsukūla cīvaram khāyissati upaṭṭhahissati ratiyā ati rati atthāya aparitassāya ati
translated: because it is pleasing to him, so too, when you live satisfied with the rag-robe, which is the Great Man’s requisite,

original: taṇhādiṭṭhiparitassanāhi aparitassanatthāya. Phāsuvihārāyāti sukhavihāratthāya. Okkamanāya
analyzed: taṇhā diṭṭhi paritassanāhi a paritassana tthāya phāsu vihārāya ati sukha vihāra tthāya okkamanāya
translated: the rag-robe will be delightful to you, it will be a help to you. For delight: for the sake of delight. For non-remorse: for the sake of non-remorse due to craving and views. For a comfortable living: for the sake of a comfortable life. For the attainment of: for the sake of the attainment of.

original: nibbānassāti amataṃ nibbānaṃ otaraṇatthāya.
analyzed: nibbānassa ati amatam nibbānam otaraṇa atthāya
translated: Nibbana: of the deathless Nibbāna.

original: Piṇḍiyālopabhojananti gāmanigamarājadhānīsu jaṅghābalaṃ nissāya gharapaṭipāṭiyā carantena
analyzed: piṇḍiyā lopabhojananti gāma nigama rājadhānīsu jaṅghā balam nissāya ghara paṭipāṭiyā carantena
translated: Eating almsfood: eating the almsfood obtained by going on continuous almsround in villages, towns, and royal cities, relying on the strength of one’s legs.

original: laddhapiṇḍiyālopabhojanaṃ. Khāyissatīti tassa gahapatino nānaggarasabhojanaṃ viya🔽upaṭṭhahissati. Santuṭṭhassa viharatoti piṇḍapātasantosamahāariyavaṃsena santuṭṭhassa🔽viharato. Rukkhamūlasenāsanaṃ khāyissatīti tassa gahapatino tebhūmakapāsāde gandhakusumavāsasugandhaṃ
analyzed: laddha piṇḍiyā lopa bhojanam khāyissati iti tassa gahapatino nānagga rasa bhojanam viya  upaṭṭhahissati santuṭṭhassa viharato ti piṇḍapāta santosa mahāariya vaṃsena santuṭṭhassa  viharataḥ rukkha mūla senāsanam khāyissati iti tassa gahapatino tebhūmaka pāsāde gandha kusuma vāsa sugandham
translated: It will be pleasant: it will be as pleasant to him as the various kinds of tasty food of the householder.🔽Dwelling contentedly: dwelling contentedly with the great noble contentment with almsfood.🔽The foot of a tree as a dwelling place will be pleasant: the foot of a tree will be as pleasant to him as the three-terraced stilt house perfumed by incense and scented with flowers.

original: santuṭṭhassa. Tiṇasanthārakoti tiṇehi vā paṇṇehi vā bhūmiyaṃ vā phalakapāsāṇatalāni🔽vā aññatarasmiṃ santhatasanthato. Pūtimuttanti yaṃkiñci muttaṃ. Taṅkhaṇe gahitampi
analyzed: santuṭṭhassa tiṇa santhārakaḥ tiṇehi vā paṇṇehi vā bhūmiyam vā phalaka pāsāṇa talāni 🔽vā aññatarasmin yat kiñci muttam taṅkhaṇe gahitam pi
translated: A spread of grass: a spread made with grass or leaves or on the bare ground or on a wooden or stone surface.🔽Any urine: urine obtained at that moment.

original: pūtimuttameva vuccati duggandhattā. Santuṭṭhassa viharatoti gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārasantosena
analyzed: pūti muttam eva vuccati duggandha ttā santuṭṭhassa viharato ti gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhāra santosena
translated: “Thus, Anuruddha, when you are practicing in this way, if there is lust, you will abandon it;🔽if there is hate, you will abandon it; if there is delusion, you will abandon it; if there is any other evil unwholesome state, you will abandon it.”🔽“In what abiding, Anuruddha, does one who is practicing in this way dwell?”

original: santuṭṭhassa viharato.
analyzed: santuṭṭhassa viharataḥ
translated: “In voidness, venerable sir.”

original: Iti bhagavā catūsu ṭhānesu arahattaṃ pakkhipanto kammaṭṭhānaṃ kathetvā “katarasenāsane
analyzed: iti bhagavā catūsu ṭhānesu arahattam pakkhipantaḥ kammaṭṭhānam kathetvā katarasena āsane
translated: “Thus, Anuruddha, when you are practicing in this way, you should train thus: ‘Our minds will remain unaffected, and we shall utter no cry of pain; we shall not fall into any quandary, and our mind will be undamaged, though this body with its various parts is burning, blazing, and flaming.’🔽“Thus, Anuruddha, when you are practicing in this way, if there is lust, you will abandon it; if there is hate, you will abandon it; if there is delusion, you will abandon it; if there is any other evil unwholesome state, you will abandon it.”🔽“In what abiding, venerable sir, does one who is practicing in this way dwell?”

original: nu kho vasantassa kammaṭṭhānaṃ sappāyaṃ bhavissatī”ti āvajjento “tasmiññeva vasantassā”ti
analyzed: nu kho vasantassa kammaṭṭhānam sappāyam bhavissati iti āvajjento tasmin ñeva vasantassa ati
translated: “In voidness, venerable sir.”

translated: “Thus, Anuruddha, when you are practicing in this way, you should train thus: ‘Our minds will remain unaffected, and we shall utter no cry of pain; we shall not fall into any quandary, and our mind will be undamaged, though this body with its various parts is burning, blazing, and flaming.’🔽“Thus, Anuruddha, when you are practicing in this way, if there is lust, you will abandon it; if there is hate, you will abandon it; if there is delusion, you will abandon it; if there is any other evil unwholesome state, you will abandon it.”🔽“In what abiding, venerable sir, does one who is practicing in this way dwell?”

original: viharantassa. Uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttanti uyyojanikeheva vacanehi paṭisaṃyuttaṃ, tesaṃ
analyzed: viharantassa uyyojanika paṭisaṃyuttanti uyyojanikehi iva vacanehi paṭisaṃyuttam tesam
translated: “In voidness, venerable sir.”

analyzed: iti bhagavā cetiraṭṭhe pācīna vaṃsa dāye āyasmataḥ anuruddhassa kathite aṭṭha mahāpurisa vitakke

analyzed: puna bhesakaḷāvana mahā vihāre nisīditvā bhikkhu saṅghassa vitthārena kathesi  manaḥ mayena ati manena nibbattita kāyaḥ api manaḥ mayaḥ iti vuccati manena gata kāyaḥ api idha manena
translated: again sat down in the Great Monastery in the Bhesakala Grove and spoke them in detail to the Community of Bhikkhus.🔽“With a mind-made body”: a body produced by mind is called “mind-made” , and a body gone by mind is also called “mind-made” . analyzed: a danta damanam dānam a dānam danta dūsakam

analyzed: dutiya dāna sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: 2. The second on giving

original: 32. Dutiye saddhāti yāya saddhāya dānaṃ deti, sā saddhā. Hiriyanti yāya hiriyā dānaṃ deti, sāva adhippetā. Kusalañca dānanti anavajjañca dānaṃ. Diviyanti divaṅgamaṃ.
analyzed: dutiye yāya saddhāya dānam deti sā saddhā hiriyanti yāya hiriyā dānam deti sā ava adhippetā kusalam ca dānanti anavajjam ca dānam diviyanti divaṅgamam
translated: In the second, faith is the faith by means of which he gives the gift. Shame is the shame by means of which he gives the gift. That is what is intended. And virtue: blameless giving. Heavenly: leading to heaven.

original: 3. Dānavatthusuttavaṇṇanā🔽33. Tatiye dānavatthūnīti dānakāraṇāni. Chandā dānaṃ detīti pemena dānaṃ deti. Dosāti
analyzed: tatiye dāna vatthūni iti dāna kāraṇāni chandā dānam deti iti pemena dānam deti
translated: The discourse on the basis for giving

original: dosena kuddho hutvā yaṃ atthi, taṃ vegena gaṇhitvā deti. Mohāti mohena mūḷho deti.
analyzed: dosena kuddhaḥ hutvā yam atthi tam vegena gaṇhitvā deti mohāti mohena mūḷhaḥ deti
translated: In the third, the bases for giving are the reasons for giving. He gives out of desire: he gives out of love. Out of hatred: he gives in a hurry when he is angry, taking whatever there is. Out of delusion: he gives confused by delusion.

original: Bhayāti garahabhayena vā apāyabhayena vā, tassa tasseva vā pana bhayena deti. Kulavaṃsanti kulapaveṇiṃ.
analyzed: garaha bhayena vā apāya bhayena vā tassa tassa iva vā pana bhayena deti kula vaṃsanti kula paveṇim
translated: Out of fear: he gives out of fear of blame, out of fear of an unhappy destiny, or out of fear of this or that. Family tradition: the family line.

original: 4. Khettasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: khetta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The discourse on the field

original: 34. Catutthe na mahapphalaṃ hotīti dhaññaphalena mahapphalaṃ na hoti. Na mahassādanti
analyzed: catutthe na mahat phalam hoti iti dhañña phalena mahat phalam na hoti na mahassa adanti
translated: In the fourth, it does not become very fruitful: it does not become very fruitful with a crop of grain. It does not become very rewarding:

original: yampissa phalaṃ hoti, tassa assādo na mahā hoti mandassādaṃ na madhuraṃ. Na phātiseyyanti
analyzed: yat pissa phalam hoti tassa assādaḥ na mahā hoti manda ssādam na madhuram na
translated: the crop that it has is not very rewarding, it is not sweet, it is not delicious. It does not yield an abundant harvest:

original: seyyāpissa na hoti vuḍḍhi, tassa mahantaṃ vīhithambhasannivesaṃ na hotīti attho.🔽Unnāmaninnāmīti thalaninnavasena visamatalaṃ. Tattha thale udakaṃ na saṇṭhāti, ninne🔽atibahu tiṭṭhati. Pāsāṇasakkharikanti pattharitvā ṭhitapiṭṭhipāsāṇehi ca khuddakapāsāṇehi
analyzed: seyya api issa na hoti tassa mahantam vīhi thambha sannivesam na hoti iti attho  thala ninna vasena visama talam tattha thale udakam na ninne  atibahu tiṭṭhati pāsāṇa sakkharikanti pattharitvā ṭhita piṭṭhi pāsāṇehi ca khuddaka pāsāṇehi
translated: and it is not good for him, and it is not a great store of rice for him.🔽It is uneven, with high and low places, with high and low ground. Water does not stand on the high ground,

original: ca sakkharāhi ca samannāgataṃ. Ūsaranti ubbhinnaloṇaṃ. Na ca gambhīrasitanti thaddhabhūmitāya
analyzed: ca sakkharāhi ca samannāgatam ubbhinna loṇam na ca thaddha bhū mitāya
translated: and on the low ground it stands in excess. It is strewn with gravel and with pebbles. It is salty and alkaline. It is not deep-soiled,

original: gambhīrānugataṃ, naṅgalamaggaṃ katvā kasituṃ na sakkā hoti, uttānanaṅgalamaggameva🔽hoti. Na āyasampannanti na udakāgamanasampannaṃ. Na apāyasampannanti pacchābhāge
analyzed: gambhīra anugatam naṅgala maggam katvā kasitum na sakkā hoti uttāna naṅgala maggam eva  na āya sampannanti na udaka āgamana sampannam na apāya sampannanti pacchābhāge
translated: and it is not possible to plough it after making a deep furrow. The ploughshare is raised up and the furrow is shallow.

original: udakaniggamanamaggasampannaṃ na hoti. Na mātikāsampannanti na khuddakamahantīhi udakamātikāhi🔽sampannaṃ hoti. Na mariyādasampannanti na kedāramariyādāhi sampannaṃ. Na mahapphalantiādīni
analyzed: udaka niggamana magga sampannam na hoti na mātikā sampannam ati na khuddaka mahantīhi udaka mātikāhi 🔽sampannam hoti na mariyāda sampannanti na kedāra mariyādāhi sampannam na mahapphala ntiādīni
translated: It is not well-watered. It is not well-drained. It is not well-plotted. It is not well-terraced. It is not productive.

original: sabbāni vipākaphalavaseneva veditabbāni.
analyzed: sabbāni vipāka phala vasena iva veditabbāni
translated: All should be understood according to the fruit of ripening.

original: Sampanneti paripuṇṇe sampattiyutte. Pavuttā bījasampadāti sampannaṃ bījaṃ ropitaṃ.
analyzed: sampannā iti paripuṇṇe sampatti yutte pavuttā bīja sampadā iti sampannam bījam ropitam
translated: “Complete” means fulfilled, endowed with excellence. “When the seed is complete and sown” means when the seed is complete and planted.

original: Deve sampādayantamhīti deve sammā vassante. Anītisampadā hotīti kīṭakimiādipāṇakaītiyā
analyzed: deve sampādayantamhi iti deve sammā vassante anīti sampadā hoti iti
translated: “When the gods are causing it to rain” means when the gods are raining properly. “There is the excellence of no-pest” means the absence of pests such as insects, worms, etc.

original: abhāvo ekā sampadā hoti. Virūḷhīti vaḍḍhi dutiyā sampadā hoti. Vepullanti vipulabhāvo
analyzed: ekā sampadā hoti virūḍhi iti dutiyā sampadā hoti vepullanti vipula bhāvo
translated: “There is one excellence” means the absence of pests is one excellence. “When it has grown” means when it has increased. “There is a second excellence” means the increase is a second excellence. “When it is abundant” means when it is extensive.

original: tatiyā sampadā hoti. Phalanti paripuṇṇaphalaṃ catutthī sampadā hoti. Sampannasīlesūti
analyzed: tatiyā sampadā hoti phalanti paripuṇṇa phalam catutthī sampadā hoti sampanna sīlesu iti
translated: “There is a third excellence” means the abundance is a third excellence. “When it bears fruit” means when it has fully ripened fruit. “There is a fourth excellence” means the bearing of fruit is a fourth excellence. “For those whose virtue is complete” means

original: paripuṇṇasīlesu. Bhojanasampadāti sampannaṃ vividhabhojanaṃ. Sampadānanti tividhaṃ🔽kusalasampadaṃ. Upanetīti sā bhojanasampadā upanayati. Kasmā? Sampannañhissa taṃ
analyzed: paripuṇṇa sīlesu bhojana sampadā ati sampannam vividha bhojanam tividham  kusala sampadam upaneti iti sā bhojana sampadā upanayati kasmā sampannam hi sa tam
translated: for those whose virtue is fulfilled. “The excellence of food” means the excellence of various kinds of food. “The excellences” means the three kinds of

original: kataṃ, yasmāssa taṃ katakammaṃ sampannaṃ paripuṇṇanti attho. Sampannatthūdhāti sampanno
analyzed: katam tam kata kammam sampannam paripuṇṇanti sampanno
translated: excellence in the wholesome. “It brings” means that excellence of food brings. Why? “Because that is complete for him that he has done” means because that action he has done is complete, fulfilled, is the meaning. “For one whose object is complete” means

original: atthu idha. Vijjācaraṇasampannoti tīhi vijjāhi ca pañcadasahi caraṇadhammehi ca samannāgato.
analyzed: atthu idha vijjā caraṇa sampannaḥ ti tīhi vijjāhi ca pañcadasahi caraṇa dhammehi ca samannāgataḥ
translated: Herein, “endowed with knowledge and conduct” means endowed with the three knowledges and the fifteen component factors of conduct.

original: Laddhāti evarūpo puggalo cittassa sampadaṃ avekallaparipuṇṇabhāvaṃ labhitvā. Karoti
analyzed: laddhā ati evarūpaḥ puggalo cittassa sampadam avekalla paripuṇṇa bhāvam labhitvā karoti
translated: “Has attained” : such a person, having attained the excellence of mind, the state of being fulfilled in non-confusion,🔽“does what should be done” : he does the fulfilled action.

original: kammasampadanti paripuṇṇakammaṃ karoti. Labhati catthasampadanti atthañca paripuṇṇaṃ
analyzed: kamma sampadanti paripuṇṇa kammam karoti labhati ca attha sampadanti attham ca paripuṇṇam
translated: “Attains the excellence of welfare” : he attains the fulfilled welfare.🔽“Attains the excellence of view” : he attains the insight-view.

original: labhati. Diṭṭhisampadanti vipassanādiṭṭhiṃ. Maggasampadanti sotāpattimaggaṃ. Yāti🔽sampannamānasoti paripuṇṇacitto hutvā arahattaṃ yāti. Sā hoti sabbasampadāti sā sabbadukkhehi
analyzed: labhati diṭṭhi sampadanti vipassanā diṭṭhim magga sampadanti sotāpatti maggam yāti  sampanna mānasaḥ iti paripuṇṇa cittaḥ hutvā arahattam yāti sā hoti sabba sampadā ati sā sabba dukkhehi
translated: “Attains the excellence of the path” : he attains the path of stream-entry.🔽“Goes with a fulfilled mind” : having become one whose mind is fulfilled, he goes to arahatship.

original: vimutti sabbasampadā nāma hotīti.
analyzed: vimutti sabbasampadā nāma hoti iti
translated: “That is the excellence of all” : that deliverance from all suffering is called the excellence of all.

original: 5. Dānūpapattisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dānūpapatti sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The explanation of the fifth stanza, “The rebirth that comes from giving,”🔽etc.🔽“The rebirth that comes from giving” : the rebirths that come from giving.

original: 35. Pañcame dānūpapattiyoti dānapaccayā upapattiyo. Dahatīti ṭhapeti. Adhiṭṭhātīti
analyzed: pañcame dāna upapattiyaḥ ti dāna paccayāḥ upapattiyaḥ dahati iti ṭhapeti adhiṭṭhāti iti
translated: “Gives” : he places. “Resolves” : this is a synonym for the same.🔽“Develops” : he increases.

original: tasseva vevacanaṃ. Bhāvetīti vaḍḍheti. Hīne vimuttanti hīnesu pañcasu kāmaguṇesu
analyzed: tassa iva vevacanam bhāveti iti vaḍḍheti hīne hīnesu pañcasu kāmaguṇesu
translated: “Is freed from the low” : he is freed from the five lower fetters.

original: vimuttaṃ. Uttari abhāvitanti tato uttarimaggaphalatthāya abhāvitaṃ. Tatrūpapattiyā
analyzed: vimuttam uttari abhāvitanti tatas uttari magga phala tthāya abhāvitam tatru upapattiyā
translated: Liberated. Not developed further: not developed further for the purpose of the higher path and fruition. There is rebirth there for one who has not developed the fourth jhāna.

original: saṃvattatīti yaṃ ṭhānaṃ patthetvā kusalaṃ kataṃ, tattha nibbattanatthāya saṃvattati.
analyzed: saṃvattati iti yam ṭhānam patthetvā kusalam katam tattha nibbattana atthāya saṃvattati
translated: and is liberated. Not developed further: not developed for the purpose of the higher paths and fruits. It leads to reappearance there: it leads to rebirth there in the place for which the profitable action was done.

original: Vītarāgassāti maggena vā samucchinnarāgassa samāpattiyā vā vikkhambhitarāgassa. Dānamatteneva
analyzed: vīta rāgassa ati maggena vā samucchinna rāgassa samāpattiyā vā vikkhambhita rāgassa dāna mattena iva
translated: Of one free from lust: of one whose lust has been cut off by the path or suppressed by attainment.

original: hi brahmaloke nibbattituṃ na sakkā, dānaṃ pana samādhivipassanācittassa alaṅkāraparivāraṃ
analyzed: hi brahma loke nibbattitum na sakkā dānam pana samādhi vipassanā cittassa alaṅkāra parivāram
translated: For it is not possible to be reborn in the Brahmā-world merely by giving; but giving is an adornment and a requisite for the mind that is developing concentration and insight.

original: hoti. Tato dānena muducitto brahmavihāre bhāvetvā brahmaloke nibbattati. Tena vuttaṃ
analyzed: hoti tatas dānena mudu cittaḥ brahmavihāre bhāvetvā brahma loke nibbattati tena vuttam
translated: So with the mind made supple by giving, he develops the divine abidings and is reborn in the Brahmā-world. That is why it is said

original: – “vītarāgassa no sarāgassā”ti.🔽6. Puññakiriyavatthusuttavaṇṇanā🔽36. Chaṭṭhe puññakiriyāni ca tāni tesaṃ tesaṃ ānisaṃsānaṃ vatthūni cāti puññakiriyavatthūni.
analyzed: vīta rāgassa no sa rāgassa ati  puññakiriya vatthu sutta vaṇṇanā  chaṭṭhe puñña kiriyāni ca tāni tesam tesam ānisaṃsānam vatthūni ca ati puñña kiriya vatthūni
translated: “of one free from lust, not of one subject to lust.”🔽The explanation of the “Discourse on the Bases of Psychic Power” is finished.🔽In the sixth, the bases for giving merit, etc., are “bases for giving merit” because they are the foundations for the various kinds of merit.

original: Dānādīnañhi lakkhaṇe cittaṃ ṭhapetvā “evarūpaṃ nāma amhehi dānaṃ dātabbaṃ, sīlaṃ
analyzed: dāna ādīnam hi lakkhaṇe cittam ṭhapetvā evarūpam nāma amhehi dānam dātabbam sīlam
translated: For the characteristic of giving merit, etc., is this: when a person has done a meritorious deed, such as giving, etc., he can direct it to the attainment of any one of the kinds of existence in the four systems of cosmology, or to the destruction of birth, etc., by adding the appropriate words of direction.

original: rakkhitabbaṃ, bhāvanā bhāvetabbā”ti sattā puññāni karonti. Dānameva dānamayaṃ, dānacetanāsu
analyzed: rakkhitabbam bhāvanā bhāvetabbā ati sattā puññāni karonti dānam eva dāna mayam dāna cetanāsu
translated: and they make merit, thinking, “It should be guarded, it should be developed.”🔽Giving itself is the kind consisting of giving. Or else the volition of giving is the kind consisting of giving,

original: vā purimacetanāto nipphannā sanniṭṭhāpakacetanā dānamayaṃ sīlādīhi sīlamayādīni viya.
analyzed: vā purima cetanātaḥ nipphannā sanniṭṭhāpaka cetanā dāna mayam sīla ādīhi sīla maya ādīni
translated: which is produced from the prior volition and brings the giving to a conclusion, like the kind consisting of virtue, etc., which is produced from the prior volition and brings the virtue, etc., to a conclusion.🔽The same method applies in the case of the other two kinds.

original: Sesadvayesupi eseva nayo. Parittaṃ kataṃ hotīti thokaṃ mandaṃ kataṃ hoti. Nābhisambhotīti
analyzed: sesa dvayesu pi esā iva nayo parittam katam hoti iti thokam mandam katam hoti na abhisambhoti iti
translated: It is done on a small scale: it is done little and weakly. It does not come to fulfilment:

original: na nipphajjati. Akataṃ hotīti bhāvanāyayogoyeva anāraddho hotīti attho. Manussadobhagyanti
analyzed: na nipphajjati a katam hoti iti an āraddhaḥ hoti iti
translated: it does not come to completion. It is not done: the practice of development is not begun.🔽The human state devoid of opportunity: the five kinds of low birth among human beings, which are devoid of opportunity.

original: manussesu sampattirahitaṃ pañcavidhaṃ nīcakulaṃ. Upapajjatīti paṭisandhivasena upagacchati,
analyzed: manussesu sampatti rahitam pañcavidham nīca kulam upapajjati iti paṭisandhi vasena upagacchati
translated: He is reborn: he goes by way of rebirth-linking.🔽The meaning is that he is reborn there.🔽It is done to a small extent: it is done to a small degree, not much.

original: tattha nibbattatīti attho. Mattaso katanti pamāṇena kataṃ, thokaṃ na bahu. Manussasobhagyanti
analyzed: tattha nibbattati iti atthaḥ mattasaḥ katanti pamāṇena katam thokam na bahu
translated: The human state with opportunity:🔽the three kinds of high birth among human beings, which are endowed with opportunity.

original: manussesu subhagabhāvaṃ tividhakulasampattiṃ. Adhimattanti adhikappamāṇaṃ balavaṃ
analyzed: manussesu subhaga bhāvam tividha kula sampattim adhimattam ti adhikappamāṇam balavam
translated: It is done to a great extent: it is done to a high degree, strongly.

original: vā. Adhigaṇhantīti abhibhavitvā gaṇhanti, visiṭṭhatarā jeṭṭhakā hontīti attho.
analyzed: vā adhigaṇhanti iti abhibhavitvā gaṇhanti visiṭṭhatarāḥ jeṭṭhakāḥ honti iti attho
translated: “They surpass” means they surpass and take them over; the meaning is, they become more excellent, more senior.

original: 7. Sappurisadānasuttavaṇṇanā🔽37. Sattame sucinti parisuddhaṃ vaṇṇasampannaṃ deti. Paṇītanti rasūpapannaṃ. Kālenāti🔽yuttapattakālena. Kappiyanti yaṃ kappiyaṃ, taṃ deti. Viceyya detīti “imassa dinnaṃ🔽mahapphalaṃ bhavissati, imassa na mahapphala”nti evaṃ paṭiggāhakapariyesanavasena
analyzed: sappurisa dāna sutta vaṇṇanā  sattame parisuddham vaṇṇa sampannam deti rasūpapannam kālena ati  yutta patta kālena yam kappiyam tam deti viceyya deti iti imassa dinnam  mahapphalam bhavissati imassa na mahapphalanti evam paṭiggāhaka pariyesana vasena
translated: The explanation of the seventh sutta🔽is finished.

original: dānaṃ vā paṇidhāyavasena dānaṃ vā vicinitvā deti.
analyzed: dānam vā paṇidhāya vasena dānam vā vicinitvā deti
translated: In the seventh sutta “pure” means well-considered and of good colour. “Excellent” means of good taste. “In time” means at the right time. “Proper” means what is proper. “He gives after examining” means he gives after examining the gift thus: “If I give this it will be of great fruit; if I give that it will not be of great fruit” or after determining the gift thus: “I will give this, not that.”

original: 8. Sappurisasuttavaṇṇanā🔽38. Aṭṭhame atthāyāti atthatthāya. Hitāya sukhāyāti hitatthāya sukhatthāya. Pubbapetānanti🔽paralokagatānaṃ ñātīnaṃ. Imasmiṃ sutte anuppanne buddhe cakkavattirājāno bodhisattā
analyzed: sappurisa sutta vaṇṇanā  aṭṭhame atthāya āti attha atthāya hitāya sukhāya ati hita atthāya sukha tthāya pubbapetānam ti  para loka gatānam ñātīnam imasmin sutte anuppanne buddhe cakkavatti rājānaḥ bodhisattā
translated: The explanation of the eighth sutta🔽is finished.

original: paccekabuddhā labbhanti, buddhakāle buddhā ceva buddhasāvakā ca. Yathāvuttānañhi
analyzed: paccekabuddhāḥ labbhanti buddha kāle buddhā ca iva buddha sāvakā ca
translated: In the eighth sutta “for welfare” means for the sake of welfare. “For happiness” means for the sake of happiness. “Ancestors” means relatives who have passed on to the other world. In this sutta, before the Buddha arose, the cakkavatti kings, the bodhisattas, and the paccekabuddhas were the givers of gifts; after the Buddha arose, the Buddhas and the Buddhas’ disciples were the givers of gifts. For the Buddhas and the Buddhas’ disciples are the best field of merit for the world with its gods.

original: etesaṃ atthāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattanti. Bahunnaṃ vata atthāya, sappañño gharamāvasanti
analyzed: etesam atthāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattanti bahunnam vata atthāya sappaññaḥ gharam āvasanti
translated: They lead to the welfare, benefit, and happiness of many.🔽He is wise, and he lives at home with a mind free from the stain of miserliness, open, expansive, exalted, and free flowing,

original: sappañño ghare vasanto bahūnaṃ vata atthāya hoti. Pubbeti paṭhameva. Pubbekatamanussaranti
analyzed: sappaññaḥ ghare vasantaḥ bahūnam vata atthāya hoti pubbeti paṭhamā iva pubbekatam anussaranti
translated: he is wise, and he lives at home with a mind free from the stain of miserliness, open, expansive, exalted, and free flowing.🔽He remembers the kindness shown to him in the past by his mother and father,

original: mātāpitūnaṃ pubbakāraguṇe anussaranto. Sahadhammenāti sakāraṇena paccayapūjanena
analyzed: mātā pitūnam pubba kāra guṇe anussarantaḥ sahadhammena ati sa kāraṇena paccaya pūjanena
translated: he honours them with reasons, with causes, with conditions.

original: pūjeti. Apace brahmacārayoti brahmacārino apacayati, nīcavuttitaṃ nesaṃ āpajjati. Pesaloti piyasīlo.
analyzed: pūjā iti brahmacārino apacayati nīca vutti tam na īsam āpajjati pesalaḥ ti piya sīlo
translated: He does not despise those who are celibate, he does not treat them with contempt, he does not treat them with disdain. He is a good person, he has a pleasing character.

original: 9. Abhisandasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: abhisanda sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the “Meeting” sutta.

original: 39. Navame dānānīti cetanādānāni. Aggaññānītiādīnaṃ attho heṭṭhā vuttoyeva.
analyzed: navame dānāni iti cetanā dānāni aggaññāni iti ādīnam attho heṭṭhā vuttaḥ yeva
translated: In the ninth, “now” refers to the volitions. The meaning of “foremost” and so on has already been given above.

original: 10. Duccaritavipākasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: duccarita vipāka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the “Result of misconduct” sutta.

original: 40. Dasame pāṇātipātoti pāṇātipātacetanā. Sabbalahusoti sabbalahuko. Appāyukasaṃvattanikoti
analyzed: dasame pāṇa atipātoti pāṇa atipāta cetanā sabba lahuso ti sabba lahukaḥ appāyuka saṃvattaniko ti
translated: In the tenth, “killing living beings” is the volition to kill living beings. “Most” means most easy. “Leads to a short life span” means

original: tena parittakena kammavipākena appāyuko hoti, dinnamattāya vā paṭisandhiyā vilīyati
analyzed: tena parittakena kamma vipākena appāyukaḥ hoti dinna mattāya vā paṭisandhiyā vilīyati
translated: by that limited result of kamma one has a short life span. Or else, as soon as one is reborn, one perishes.

original: mātukucchito nikkhantamatte vā. Evarūpo hi na aññassa kassaci nissando, pāṇātipātasseva

translated: “Will they be?” — “Yes, they will, but after much trouble. And when they have asked many times, I have allowed them to go forth. original: buddhasiriyā anopamena buddhavilāsena aturitacārikaṃ pakkāmi.🔽Sambahulāhi sākiyānīhi saddhinti antonivesanamhiyeva dasabalaṃ uddissa pabbajjāvesaṃ🔽gahetvā pañcasatā sākiyāniyo pabbajjāvesaṃyeva gāhāpetvā sabbāhipi tāhi sambahulāhi

translated: “Will they be?” They will, but after much trouble and repeated requests. He refused, wishing to grant the going-forth after due consideration, thinking, “The going-forth that is obtained with difficulty will be properly maintained.” He left, and again entered Kapilapura. Having stayed there as long as he wished, he looked for the beings who were ready to be developed. Having stayed as long as he liked, he set out on his journey, gathering a great multitude, and with the highest splendor of a Buddha, with incomparable Buddha-play, he went on his journey.
