original: dhammā cittaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassantīti iminā tāvassa ovādena niyakajjhattavasena cittekaggatāmatto mūlasamādhi vutto.
analyzed: dhammā cittam pariyādāya ṭhassanti iti iminā tāvassa ovādena niyaka jjhatta vasena citta ekagga tā mattaḥ mūlasamādhi vutto
translated: Herein, his concentration in its primary function is simply unification of mind, in the sense of steadiness, by means of the direction of cognizance and postdirection of cognizance stated thus, “My cognizance will be steadied internally and well steadied” and “No evil unprofitable states will beset my cognizance” .

original: Tato “ettakeneva santuṭṭhiṃ anāpajjitvā evaṃ so samādhi vaḍḍhetabbo”ti dassetuṃ yato🔽kho te bhikkhu ajjhattaṃ cittaṃ ṭhitaṃ hoti susaṇṭhitaṃ, na ca uppannā pāpakā akusalā
analyzed: tatas ettakena iva santuṭṭhim an āpajjitvā evam saḥ samādhi vaḍḍhetabbaḥ ti dassetum yatas  kho te bhikkhu ajjhattam cittam ṭhitam hoti su saṇṭhitam na ca uppannā pāpakā akusalā
translated: But in order to show that, without being satisfied with that much, that concentration should be developed further, it is said next, “When your cognizance is steadied internally and well steadied” , and so on.

original: dhammā cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhanti, tato te bhikkhu evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ “mettā me cetovimutti🔽bhāvitā bhavissati…pe… susamāraddhā”ti evamassa mettāvasena bhāvanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā puna
analyzed: dhammā cittam pariyādāya tiṭṭhanti tatas te bhikkhu evam sikkhitabbam mettā me cetaḥ vimutti  bhāvitā bhavissati pe su samāraddhā ati evam assa mettā vasena bhāvanam vaḍḍhetvā puna
translated: Herein, when his cognizance is steadied internally and well steadied, and no evil unprofitable states beset his cognizance, then he should train thus, “I shall develop the deliverance of mind through loving-kindness, I shall make much of it, make it my vehicle, make it my basis, make it my island, make it my refuge, make it my haven” .🔽So he should develop it by means of loving-kindness.

original: yato kho te bhikkhu ayaṃ samādhi evaṃ bhāvito hoti bahulīkato, tato tvaṃ bhikkhu
analyzed: yatas kho te bhikkhu ayam samādhi evam bhāvitaḥ hoti bahulīkato tatas tvam bhikkhu
translated: Then, when this concentration has been developed in this way and frequently practiced, he should next develop it by means of compassion, and by means of sympathetic joy, and by means of equanimity.

original: imaṃ samādhiṃ savitakkasavicārampi bhāveyyāsītiādi vuttaṃ. Tassattho – yadā te bhikkhu
analyzed: imam samādhim sa vitakka sa vicāram pi bhāveyyāsi itiādi vuttam tassa atthaḥ yadā te bhikkhu
translated: “You should develop this concentration with applied thought and sustained thought” and so on. The meaning is as follows:

original: ayaṃ mūlasamādhi evaṃ mettāvasena bhāvito hoti, tadā tvaṃ tāvatakenapi tuṭṭhiṃ anāpajjitvāva🔽imaṃ mūlasamādhiṃ aññesupi ārammaṇesu catukkapañcakajjhānāni pāpayamāno “savitakkasavicārampī”tiādinā
analyzed: ayam mūlasamādhi evam mettā vasena bhāvitaḥ tadā tvam tāvatakena api tuṭṭhim an āpajjitvā ava  imam mūlasamādhim aññesu pi ārammaṇesu catukka pañcaka jjhānāni pāpayamāno sa vitakka sa vicāram pi itiādinā
translated: When, bhikkhu, this basic concentration has been developed by you in this way with loving-kindness, then, without being satisfied with that much,

original: nayena bhāveyyāsīti.
analyzed: nayena bhāveyyā asi iti
translated: you should further “develop this basic concentration with applied thought and sustained thought” and so on, by bringing it to the fourfold and fivefold jhāna in other objects too.

original: Evaṃ vatvā ca pana avasesabrahmavihārapubbaṅgamampissa aññesu ārammaṇesu catukkapañcakajjhānabhāvanaṃ
analyzed: evam vatvā ca pana avasesa brahmavihāra pubbaṅgamam pissa aññesu ārammaṇesu catukka pañcaka jjhāna bhāvanam
translated: And after saying this, he went on to show that he should also develop the fourfold and fivefold jhāna in other objects, which is preceded by the remaining divine abidings,

original: kareyyāsīti dassento yato kho te bhikkhu ayaṃ samādhi evaṃ bhāvito hoti subhāvito,🔽tato te bhikkhu evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ “karuṇā me cetovimuttī”tiādimāha. Evaṃ mettāpubbaṅgamaṃ
analyzed: kareyyāsi iti dassento yatas kho te bhikkhu ayam samādhi evam bhāvitaḥ hoti su bhāvito  tatas te bhikkhu evam sikkhitabbam karuṇā me cetaḥ vimutti iti ādim āha evam mettā pubbaṅgamam
translated: saying, “When, bhikkhu, this concentration has been thus developed by you and well developed,🔽then, bhikkhu, you should train thus” , and so on. Having thus shown the development of the fourfold and fivefold jhāna preceded by loving- kindness,

original: catukkapañcakajjhānabhāvanaṃ dassetvā puna kāyānupassanādipubbaṅgamaṃ dassetuṃ yato
analyzed: catukka pañcaka jjhāna bhāvanam dassetvā puna kāya anupassanā ādi pubbaṅgamam dassetum yatas
translated: he said, “When, bhikkhu, this concentration has been thus developed by you and well developed, then, bhikkhu, you should train thus: ‘I shall be one who possesses perfect confidence in the Buddha’ , and so on, showing the development preceded by the contemplation of the repulsiveness of food.

original: kho te bhikkhu ayaṃ samādhi evaṃ bhāvito hoti subhāvito, tato te bhikkhu evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ🔽“kāye kāyānupassī”tiādiṃ vatvā yato kho te bhikkhu ayaṃ samādhi evaṃ bhāvito hoti🔽subhāvito, tato tvaṃ bhikkhu yena yeneva gagghasītiādimāha. Tattha gagghasīti gamissasi.
analyzed: kho te bhikkhu ayam samādhi evam bhāvitaḥ hoti su bhāvitaḥ tatas te bhikkhu evam sikkhitabbam  kāye kāya anupassī itiādim vatvā yatas kho te bhikkhu ayam samādhi evam bhāvitaḥ hoti  su bhāvito tatas tvam bhikkhu yena yena iva gagghasi itiādim āha tattha gagghasi iti gamissasi
translated: “Bhikkhu, when this concentration has been developed in this way, then you should train further thus:

original: Phāsuṃyevāti iminā arahattaṃ dasseti. Arahattappatto hi sabbiriyāpathesu phāsu viharati nāma.🔽4. Gayāsīsasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: phāsum yeva iti iminā arahattam dasseti arahatta pattaḥ hi sa biriyāpathesu phāsu viharati nāma  gayāsīsa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: ‘I shall be a forest-dweller, rejecting and avoiding dwellings in a village.’🔽“Bhikkhu, when this concentration has been developed and matured in this way, then you should develop the four establishments of mindfulness in this way:🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out experiencing rapture’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out experiencing happiness’ …

original: 64. Catutthe etadavocāti attano padhānabhūmiyaṃ uppannaṃ vitakkaṃ bhikkhusaṅghassa🔽ārocetuṃ – “pubbāhaṃ, bhikkhave”tiādivacanaṃ avoca. Obhāsanti dibbacakkhuñāṇobhāsaṃ.
analyzed: catutthe etat avoca ati attanaḥ padhānabhūmiyam uppannam vitakkam bhikkhu saṅghassa  ārocetum pubbā aham bhikkhave iti ādi vacanam avoca obhāsanti dibba cakkhu ñāṇa ubhāsam
translated: ‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out experiencing the mental formation’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out experiencing the mind’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out experiencing the mental formation’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating impermanence’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating fading away’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating cessation’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating relinquishment’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out calming the mental formation’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out liberating the mind’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating inconstancy’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating fading away’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating cessation’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating relinquishment’ …

original: Ñāṇadassananti dibbacakkhubhūtaṃ ñāṇasaṅkhātaṃ dassanaṃ. Sannivutthapubbanti ekato
analyzed: ñāṇa dassananti dibba cakkhu bhūtam ñāṇa saṅkhātam dassanam sannivuttha pubbanti ekatas
translated: ‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating inconstancy’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating fading away’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating cessation’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating relinquishment’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating inconstancy’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating fading away’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating cessation’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating relinquishment’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating inconstancy’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating fading away’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating cessation’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating relinquishment’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating inconstancy’ …🔽‘I shall breathe in … shall breathe out contemplating fading away’ …

original: vasitapubbaṃ. Imasmiṃ pana sutte dibbacakkhuñāṇaṃ, iddhividhañāṇaṃ, cetopariyañāṇaṃ,
analyzed: vasita pubbam imasmim pana sutte dibba cakkhu ñāṇam iddhividha ñāṇam cetas upariya ñāṇam
translated: and he had lived there before. But in this sutta there is knowledge of the divine eye, knowledge of the kinds of supernormal power, knowledge of encompassing the minds of others,

original: yathākammupagañāṇaṃ, anāgataṃsañāṇaṃ, paccuppannaṃsañāṇaṃ, atītaṃsañāṇaṃ, pubbenivāsañāṇanti
analyzed: yathā kammupaga ñāṇam anāgata sañāṇam paccuppanna sañāṇam atīta sañāṇam pubbenivāsa ñāṇam
translated: knowledge of the way of penetration to the destination of others, knowledge of the future, knowledge of the present, knowledge of the past, and knowledge of past lives.

original: imāni tāva aṭṭha ñāṇāni pāḷiyaṃyeva āgatāni, tehi pana saddhiṃ vipassanāñāṇāni cattāri
analyzed: imāni tāva aṭṭha ñāṇāni pāḷiyam yeva āgatāni tehi pana saddhim vipassanā ñāṇāni cattāri
translated: These are the eight kinds of knowledge given in the text. But in addition to these there are the four kinds of knowledge of insight,

original: maggañāṇāni, cattāri phalañāṇāni, cattāri paccavekkhaṇañāṇāni, cattāri paṭisambhidāñāṇāni🔽cha asādhāraṇañāṇānīti etāni ñāṇāni samodhānetvā kathentena evaṃ idaṃ suttaṃ kathitaṃ nāma hoti.
analyzed: magga ñāṇāni cattāri phala ñāṇāni cattāri paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇāni cattāri paṭisambhidā ñāṇāni  cha asādhāraṇa ñāṇāni iti etāni ñāṇāni samodhānetvā kathentena evam idam suttam kathitam nāma hoti
translated: the four kinds of knowledge of the paths, the four kinds of knowledge of fruition, the four kinds of reviewing knowledge, the four kinds of knowledge of the kinds of supernormal power,🔽and the six kinds of knowledge not shared by disciples. When he teaches this sutta by combining all these kinds of knowledge together,

original: 5. Abhibhāyatanasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: abhibhāyatana sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the “Sutta on the Overcoming of Relentlessness” is finished.

original: 65. Pañcame abhibhāyatanānīti abhibhavanakāraṇāni. Kiṃ abhibhavanti? Paccanīkadhammepi
analyzed: pañcame abhibhāyatanāni iti abhibhavana kāraṇāni kim abhibhavanti paccanīka dhamme pi
translated: In the fifth place, “overcoming of the bases” : the bases for overcoming. What does it overcome? Adverse states

original: ārammaṇānipi. Tāni hi paṭipakkhabhāvena paccanīkadhamme abhibhavanti, puggalassa
analyzed: ārammaṇāni pi tāni hi paṭipakkha bhāvena paccanīka dhamme abhibhavanti puggalassa
translated: and objects. For these are adverse to the path and so they overcome adverse states. They are also adverse to the person

original: ñāṇuttariyatāya ārammaṇāni. Ajjhattaṃ rūpasaññītiādīsu pana ajjhattarūpe parikammavasena
analyzed: ārammaṇāni ajjhattam rūpa saññī iti ādīsu pana ajjhatta rūpe parikamma vasena
translated: and the object is the superior knowledge.🔽As regards the passages beginning, “Perceiving forms internally” , etc.,

original: ajjhattaṃ rūpasaññī nāma hoti. Ajjhattañhi nīlaparikammaṃ karonto kese vā pitte vā
analyzed: ajjhattam rūpa saññī nāma hoti ajjhattam hi nīla parikammam karonto kese vā pitte vā
translated: he is called “perceiving forms internally” because he has made the preliminary work on internal forms.

original: akkhitārakāya vā karoti. Pītaparikammaṃ karonto mede vā chaviyā vā hatthatalapādatalesu🔽vā akkhīnaṃ pītaṭṭhāne vā karoti. Lohitaparikammaṃ karonto maṃse vā lohite vā jivhāya🔽vā akkhīnaṃ rattaṭṭhāne vā karoti. Odātaparikammaṃ karonto aṭṭhimhi vā dante vā nakhe
analyzed: vā karoti pīta parikammam karontaḥ mede vā chaviyā vā hattha tala pāda talesu  vā akkhīnam pīta ṭṭhāne vā karoti lohita parikammam karontaḥ maṃse vā lohite vā jivhāya  vā akkhīnam ratta ṭṭhāne vā karoti odāta parikammam karontaḥ aṭṭhimhi vā dante vā nakhe
translated: For when he is making the preliminary work on blue, he does so on the head hairs, body hairs, teeth, nails, etc.,🔽or on the bile, phlegm, pus, blood, etc., or on the blue part of the eyes. When he is making the preliminary work on yellow, he does so on the skin, the flesh, the colour of turmeric, etc.,🔽or on the yellow part of the eyes. When he is making the preliminary work on red, he does so on the blood, on meat, on lac dye, etc.,

original: vā akkhīnaṃ setaṭṭhāne vā karoti. Taṃ pana sunīlakaṃ supītakaṃ sulohitakaṃ suodātaṃ
analyzed: vā akkhīnam seta ṭṭhāne vā karoti tam pana su nīlakam su pītakam su lohitakam su odātam
translated: or on the red part of the eyes. When he is making the preliminary work on white, he does so on the bones, teeth, nails, etc.,

original: na hoti, avisuddhameva hoti.
analyzed: na hoti a visuddham eva hoti
translated: or on the white part of the eyes. But that is not very blue, very yellow, very red, very white; it is only impure.

original: Eko bahiddhā rūpāni passatīti yassevaṃ parikammaṃ ajjhattaṃ uppannaṃ hoti, nimittaṃ
analyzed: ekaḥ bahiddhā rūpāni passati iti yassa evam parikammam ajjhattam uppannam hoti nimittam
translated: “One perceives forms externally, many forms, beautiful and ugly” .

original: pana bahiddhā, so evaṃ ajjhattaṃ parikammassa bahiddhā ca appanāya vasena “ajjhattaṃ🔽rūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passatī”ti vuccati. Parittānīti avaḍḍhitāni. Suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇānīti
analyzed: pana bahiddhā so evam ajjhattam parikammassa bahiddhā ca appanāya vasena ajjhattam  rūpa saññī ekaḥ bahiddhā rūpāni passati iti vuccati parittāni iti avaḍḍhitāni suvaṇṇa dubbaṇṇāni iti
translated: but he is so called because of the jhāna’s being obtained by means of the pervasion of the sign of the limited and the sign of the beautiful and the ugly, which are external to himself. The limited: not extended. The beautiful and the ugly:

original: suvaṇṇāni vā hontu dubbaṇṇāni vā, parittavaseneva idaṃ abhibhāyatanaṃ vuttanti veditabbaṃ.🔽Tāni abhibhuyyāti yathā nāma sampannaggahaṇiko kaṭacchumattaṃ bhattaṃ labhitvā “kiṃ🔽ettha bhuñjitabbaṃ atthī”ti saṃkaḍḍhitvā ekakabaḷameva karoti, evameva ñāṇuttariko🔽puggalo visadañāṇo “kimettha parittake ārammaṇe samāpajjitabbaṃ atthi, nāyaṃ mama🔽bhāro”ti tāni rūpāni abhibhavitvā samāpajjati, saha nimittuppādenevettha appanaṃ
analyzed: suvaṇṇāni vā hontu dubbaṇṇāni vā paritta vasena iva idam abhibhāyatanam vuttan ti veditabbam  tāni yathā nāma sampanna ggahaṇikaḥ kaṭacchumattam bhattam labhitvā kim  ettha bhuñjitabbam atthi iti saṃkaḍḍhitvā eka kabaḷam eva karoti evam eva ñāṇuttarikaḥ  puggalaḥ visada ñāṇaḥ kim ettha parittake ārammaṇe samāpajjitabbam atthi na ayam mama  tāni rūpāni abhibhavitvā samāpajjati saha nimitta uppādena iva itthā appanam
translated: But he is called “one who, while normally perceiving internal forms, sees external forms” because of the pervasion of the internal and the obtaining of absorption in regard to the external. Limited: not extended. Fair and ugly: whether fair or ugly, this is said to be the base of mastery in the sense of limitedness.

original: pāpetīti attho. Jānāmi passāmīti iminā panassa ābhogo kathito. So ca kho samāpattito
analyzed: pāpā iti iti atthaḥ jānāmi passāmi iti iminā pana assa ābhogaḥ kathitaḥ saḥ ca kho samāpattitaḥ
translated: He masters them: just as a man with a good appetite, having received a bowlful of rice gruel, would gather it together with “Here is something to eat,” and make it into a ball, so too, a person with superior knowledge, with clear knowledge, would master those forms, “What is there to attain in this limited object? This is not my burden,” and he would attain absorption, the meaning is. I know and I see: this is his aspiration.

original: vuṭṭhitassa, na antosamāpattiyaṃ. Evaṃsaññī hotīti ābhogasaññāyapi jhānasaññāyapi
analyzed: vuṭṭhitassa na antosamāpattiyam evaṃsaññī hoti iti ābhoga saññāya api jhāna saññāya api
translated: He is thus only when he has emerged, not while he is in the attainment. He is thus conscious: he is conscious of the exertion and of the jhāna.

original: evaṃsaññī hoti. Abhibhavanasaññā hissa antosamāpattiyampi atthi, ābhogasaññā pana🔽samāpattito vuṭṭhitasseva.
analyzed: evaṃsaññī hoti abhibhavana saññā hissa antosamāpattiyam pi atthi ābhoga saññā pana  samāpattitaḥ vuṭṭhitassa eva
translated: For he is conscious of the exertion while he is in the attainment, but he is conscious of the jhāna only when he has emerged.

original: Appamāṇānīti vaḍḍhitappamāṇāni, mahantānīti attho. Abhibhuyyāti ettha ca pana yathā🔽mahagghaso puriso ekaṃ bhattavaḍḍhitakaṃ labhitvā “aññāpi hotu, aññāpi hotu, kiṃ🔽esā mayhaṃ karissatī”ti na taṃ mahantato passati, evameva ñāṇuttaro puggalo visadañāṇo🔽“kiṃ ettha samāpajjitabbaṃ, nayidaṃ appamāṇaṃ, na mayhaṃ cittekaggatākaraṇe bhāro
analyzed: appamāṇāni iti vaḍḍhita ppamāṇāni mahantāni iti atthaḥ ettha ca pana yathā  mahagghasaḥ puriso ekam bhatta vaḍḍhitakam labhitvā aññā api hotu aññā api hotu kiṃ esā mayham karissati iti na tam mahantataḥ passati evam eva ñāṇa uttaraḥ puggalo visada ñāṇo  kim ettha samāpajjitabbam na yidam appamāṇam na mayham citta ekagga tā karaṇe bhāraḥ
translated: The measureless: the measure of these is not easily taken, thus they are measureless, great, is the meaning. He has attained: he has reached.

original: atthī”ti abhibhavitvā samāpajjati, saha nimittuppādanevettha appanaṃ pāpetīti attho.
analyzed: atthi iti abhibhavitvā samāpajjati saha appanam pāpeti iti atthaḥ
translated: He has overmastered: just as a man of high social status, having obtained a small measure of food, thinks, “What shall I do with this? It is not worth putting in my mouth,” and does not see it as much, so too, the person whose knowledge is superior, whose knowledge is clear, thinks, “What is there to be attained here? This is not measureless. There is no difficulty for me in unifying my mind,” and he overmasters it. The meaning is that he brings it to absorption as soon as the sign arises.

original: Ajjhattaṃ arūpasaññīti alābhitāya vā anatthikatāya vā ajjhattarūpe parikammasaññāvirahito.
analyzed: ajjhattam arūpa saññī iti alābhi tāya vā anatthikatāya vā ajjhatta rūpe parikamma saññā virahitaḥ
translated: “Perceiving forms internally” : he is devoid of the perception of reviewing forms internally because he has not acquired them or because he has no need for them.

original: Eko bahiddhā rūpāni passatīti yassa parikammampi nimittampi bahiddhā uppannaṃ, so🔽evaṃ bahiddhā parikammassa ceva appanāya ca vasena “ajjhattaṃ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā
analyzed: ekaḥ bahiddhā rūpāni passati iti yassa parikammam pi nimittam pi bahiddhā uppannam so  evam bahiddhā parikammassa ca iva appanāya ca vasena ajjhattam arūpa saññī ekaḥ bahiddhā
translated: “One sees forms externally” : his reviewing and his sign arise externally.

original: rūpāni passatī”ti vuccati. Sesamettha catutthābhibhāyatane ca vuttanayameva. Imesu🔽pana catūsu parittaṃ vitakkacaritavasena āgataṃ, appamāṇaṃ mohacaritavasena, suvaṇṇaṃ🔽dosacaritavasena, dubbaṇṇaṃ rāgacaritavasena. Etesañhi etāni sappāyāni. Sā ca nesaṃ
analyzed: rūpāni passati iti vuccati sesam ettha catuttha abhibhāyatane ca vutta nayam eva imesu  pana catūsu parittam vitakka carita vasena āgatam appamāṇam moha carita vasena suvaṇṇam  dosa carita vasena dubbaṇṇam rāga carita vasena etesam hi etāni sappāyāni sā ca nesam
translated: Thus, because of his reviewing externally and because of his attainment externally, he is said to “perceive forms internally, not externally” . The rest is as in the fourth base.

original: sappāyatā visuddhimagge cariyaniddese vuttā.
translated: But in these four, the limited is given in the case of the type who is given to discursive thought, the measureless in the case of the type who is given to delusion, the beautiful in the case of the type who is given to hate, and the ugly in the case of the type who is given to lust. For these are suitable for them. And the suitability of these for them is stated in the Description of the Way in the Path of Purification.

original: Pañcamaabhibhāyatanādīsu nīlānīti sabbasaṅgāhikavasena vuttaṃ. Nīlavaṇṇānīti vaṇṇavasena.
translated: In the fifth base, etc., “blue” is said in the sense of all-inclusive. “Blue in colour” is said in the sense of colour.

original: Nīlanidassanānīti nidassanavasena. Apaññāyamānavivarāni asambhinnavaṇṇāni ekanīlāneva
analyzed: nīla nidassanāni iti nidassana vasena a paññāyamāna vivarāni asambhinna vaṇṇāni eka nīlāni eva
translated: “Blue in their appearance”: in the sense of appearance. “Without interstice”: without any difference of colour; they are all of one blue.

original: hutvā dissantīti vuttaṃ hoti. Nīlanibhāsānīti idaṃ pana obhāsavasena vuttaṃ, nīlobhāsāni🔽nīlappabhāyuttānīti attho. Etena nesaṃ suvisuddhataṃ dasseti. Visuddhavaṇṇavaseneva
analyzed: hutvā dissanti iti vuttam hoti nīla nibhāsāni iti idam pana obhāsa vasena vuttam nīla ubhāsāni  nīla ppabhā yuttāni iti attho etena nesam su visuddha tam dasseti visuddha vaṇṇa vasena iva
translated: “They appear as though burnt”: this is what is meant. “Blue in their sheen”: this is said in the sense of radiance. “Blue in their glow”:🔽this is the meaning. By this he shows their extreme purity. For these bases of mastery are described in terms of the colour of the kasiṇa that has been made perfectly clear.

original: hi imāni abhibhāyatanāni vuttāni. “Nīlakasiṇaṃ uggaṇhanto nīlasmiṃ nimittaṃ gaṇhāti
analyzed: hi imāni abhibhāyatanāni vuttāni nīla kasiṇam uggaṇhantaḥ nīlasmin nimittam gaṇhāti
translated: “One who is learning the blue kasiṇa apprehends the sign in blue,

original: pupphasmiṃ vā vatthasmiṃ vā vaṇṇadhātuyā vā”tiādikaṃ panettha kasiṇakaraṇañca parikammañca
analyzed: pupphasmim vā vatthasmim vā vaṇṇa dhātuyā vāti ādikam pana ittha kasiṇa karaṇam ca parikammam ca
translated: in a flower, in a cloth, or in a colour element” . The making of the kasiṇa, the preliminary work,

original: appanāvidhānañca sabbaṃ visuddhimagge vitthārato vuttamevāti.
analyzed: appanā vidhānam ca sabbam visuddhi magge vitthārataḥ vuttam evā ti
translated: and the directions for attaining jhāna are all given in detail in the Visuddhimagga .

original: 6. Vimokkhasuttavaṇṇanā🔽66. Vimokkhāti kenaṭṭhena vimokkhā? Adhimuccanaṭṭhena. Ko panāyaṃ adhimuccanaṭṭho
analyzed: vimokkha sutta vaṇṇanā  vimokkhā ati kenaṭṭhena vimokkhā adhimuccana ṭṭhena kaḥ pana ayam adhimuccana ṭhaḥ
translated: The Deliverances

original: nāma? Paccanīkadhammehi ca suṭṭhu muccanaṭṭho, ārammaṇe ca abhirativasena suṭṭhu
analyzed: nāma paccanīka dhammehi ca suṭṭhu muccana aṭṭho ārammaṇe ca abhirati vasena suṭṭhu
translated: What is the meaning of “deliverance”? It is the meaning of resolving. But what is this meaning of resolving? It is the meaning of being well delivered from opposing states and of being well delivered by surmounting them through the object.

original: muccanaṭṭho, pituaṅke vissaṭṭhaṅgapaccaṅgassa dārakassa sayanaṃ viya aniggahitabhāvena
analyzed: muccana ṭṭhaḥ pitu aṅke vissaṭṭhaṅga paccaṅgassa dārakassa sayanam viya a niggahita bhāvena
translated: The meaning of “liberation” is like the lying down of a child whose limbs and joints are soft in its father’s lap.

original: nirāsaṅkatāya ārammaṇe pavattīti vuttaṃ hoti. Ayaṃ panattho pacchime vimokkhe natthi,
analyzed: nirāsaṅka tāya ārammaṇe pavatti iti vuttam hoti ayam pana attho pacchime vimokkhe natthi
translated: What is meant is that it occurs with respect to an object without being held in check by the hindrances owing to the absence of any obstruction. But this meaning is not applicable to the last liberation.

original: purimesu vimokkhesu atthi.
analyzed: purimesu vimokkhesu atthi
translated: It is applicable to the first three.

original: Rūpī rūpāni passatīti ettha ajjhattaṃ kesādīsu nīlakasiṇādivasena uppāditaṃ rūpajjhānaṃ
analyzed: rūpī rūpāni passati iti ettha ajjhattam kesa ādīsu nīla kasiṇa ādi vasena uppāditam rūpajjhānam
translated: “Possessed of material form, he sees material forms”: the material-form jhāna arisen in the eye-door through the blue kasiṇa, etc., as object,

original: rūpaṃ, tadassatthīti rūpī. Bahiddhāpi nīlakasiṇādīni rūpāni jhānacakkhunā passati.
analyzed: rūpam tat assa atthi iti rūpī bahiddhā api nīla kasiṇa ādīni rūpāni jhāna cakkhunā passati
translated: is “material form.” He is “possessed of material form” because he has that. He sees the blue kasiṇa, etc., externally with the jhāna eye.

original: Iminā ajjhattabahiddhavatthukesu kasiṇesu uppāditajjhānassa puggalassa cattāri rūpāvacarajjhānāni
analyzed: iminā ajjhatta bahiddha vatthukesu kasiṇesu uppādita jjhānassa puggalassa cattāri rūpāvacara jhānāni
translated: By this statement the four jhānas of the fine-material sphere are shown for a person who has aroused jhāna in the kasiṇa that is the object of jhāna internally and externally.

original: dassitāni. Ajjhattaṃ arūpasaññīti ajjhattaṃ na rūpasaññī, attano kesādīsu anuppāditarūpāvacarajjhānoti
analyzed: dassitāni ajjhattam arūpa saññī iti ajjhattam na rūpa saññī attano kesa ādīsu anuppādita rūpāvacara jjhāno ti
translated: “Not perceiving material forms in himself”: he is not perceiving material forms in himself, he has not aroused the fine-material jhāna in his own head hairs, etc.,

original: attho. Iminā bahiddhā parikammaṃ katvā bahiddhāva uppāditajjhānassa rūpāvacarajjhānāni dassitāni.
analyzed: attho iminā bahiddhā parikammam katvā bahiddhā vā uppādita jhānassa rūpāvacara jhānāni dassitāni
translated: By this statement the fine-material jhānas are shown for one who has aroused jhāna externally after making the preliminary work externally.

original: Subhanteva adhimutto hotīti iminā suvisuddhesu nīlādīsu vaṇṇakasiṇesu jhānāni dassitāni.
analyzed: adhimuttaḥ hoti iti iminā su visuddhesu nīla ādīsu vaṇṇa kasiṇesu jhānāni dassitāni
translated: By “he is intent on what is beautiful” the jhānas in the very pure colour kasiṇas such as blue, etc., are shown.

original: Tattha kiñcāpi antoappanāya “subha”nti ābhogo natthi, yo pana suvisuddhaṃ subhaṃ
analyzed: tattha kiñcā api anto appanāya subhanti ābhogo natthi yaḥ pana su visuddham subhaṃ
translated: Herein, although there is no “beautiful” in the sense of the word in the case of the blue kasiṇa, etc., still,

original: kasiṇaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā viharati, so yasmā “subhanti adhimutto hotī”ti vattabbataṃ
analyzed: kasiṇam ārammaṇam katvā viharati saḥ yasmai adhimutto hoti iti vattabbataṃ
translated: since one who abides making that very pure beauty his object does so by “being intent on what is beautiful,”

original: āpajjati, tasmā evaṃ desanā katā. Paṭisambhidāmagge pana –
analyzed: āpajjati tasmai evam desanā katā paṭisambhidā magge pana
translated: the teaching is given in this way. But in the Paṭisambhidā it is said:

original: “Kathaṃ subhanteva adhimutto hotīti vimokkho? Idha bhikkhu mettāsahagatena cetasā
analyzed: katham subhantā iva adhimuttaḥ hoti iti vimokkhaḥ idha bhikkhu mettā sahagatena cetasā
translated: “How is there liberation by being intent on what is beautiful? Here a bhikkhu abides pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, … and so on with the rest of the directions as in §115 up to …🔽he abides pervading the entire world, upwards, downwards, across, and everywhere with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.🔽By developing loving-kindness he makes beings non-hostile.

original: ekaṃ disaṃ …pe… viharati. Mettāya bhāvitattā sattā appaṭikūlā honti. Karuṇāsahagatena…pe…
analyzed: ekam disam pe viharati mettāya bhāvita ttā sattāḥ a paṭikūlāḥ honti karuṇā sahagatena pe
translated: He abides pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with compassion … and so on with the rest of the directions as in §115 up to …🔽he abides pervading the entire world, upwards, downwards, across, and everywhere with a mind imbued with compassion, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.🔽By developing compassion he makes beings non-hostile.🔽He abides pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with appreciative joy … and so on with the rest of the directions as in §115 up to …

original: muditāsahagatena …pe… upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ…pe… viharati. Upekkhāya
analyzed: muditā sahagatena pe upekkhā sahagatena cetasā ekam disaṃpe viharati upekkhāya
translated: he abides pervading the entire world, upwards, downwards, across, and everywhere with a mind imbued with appreciative joy, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.🔽By developing appreciative joy he makes beings non-hostile.🔽He abides pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with equanimity … and so on with the rest of the directions as in §115 up to …🔽he abides pervading the entire world, upwards, downwards, across, and everywhere with a mind imbued with equanimity, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.🔽By developing equanimity he makes beings non-hostile.

original: bhāvitattā sattā appaṭikūlā honti. Evaṃ subhanteva adhimutto hotīti vimokkho”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: bhāvita ttā sattāḥ a paṭikūlāḥ honti evam subhantā iva adhimutto hoti iti vimokkho ti vuttam
translated: Thus there is liberation by being intent on what is beautiful” .

original: Sabbaso rūpasaññānantiādīsu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ visuddhimagge vuttameva. Ayaṃ aṭṭhamo
analyzed: sabbasas rūpa saññānaṃ ti ādīsu yam vattabbam tam visuddhi magge vuttam eva ayam aṭṭhamo
translated: As to the words “perceptions of form” and so on, what should be said has already been said in the Path of Purity .

original: vimokkhoti ayaṃ catunnaṃ khandhānaṃ sabbaso vissaṭṭhattā vimuttattā aṭṭhamo uttamo vimokkho nāma.
analyzed: vimokkho ti ayam catunnam khandhānam sabbasas vissaṭṭha ttā vimutta ttā aṭṭhamaḥ uttamaḥ vimokkhaḥ nāma
translated: This is the eighth: this is the eighth and best of the liberations because of the complete disentanglement and liberation from the four aggregates.

original: 7-8. Anariyavohārasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: anariya vohāra sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Unedifying Talk Sutta

original: 67-68. Sattame anariyavohārāti na ariyakathā sadosakathā. Yāhi cetanāhi te vohāre voharanti, tāsaṃ etaṃ nāmaṃ. Aṭṭhame vuttapaṭipakkhanayena attho veditabbo.
analyzed: sattame anariya vohārā ti na ariya kathā sa dosa kathā yāhi cetanāhi te vohāre voharanti tāsam etam nāmam aṭṭhame vutta paṭipakkha nayena atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: In the seventh sutta, unedifying talk is not the talk of Noble Ones; it is talk with faults. It is so called because one engages in that talk with those intentions. The meaning in the eighth sutta should be understood in the opposite way to that given above.

original: 9. Parisāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: parisā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Assembly Sutta

original: 69. Navame khattiyaparisāti khattiyānaṃ parisānaṃ sannipāto samāgamo. Esa nayo sabbattha.
analyzed: navame khattiya parisā ati khattiyānam parisānam sannipātaḥ samāgamaḥ esa nayaḥ sabbattha
translated: In the ninth sutta, an assembly of nobles is a gathering, a meeting, of nobles. The same method applies in all cases.

original: Anekasataṃ khattiyaparisanti bimbisārasamāgama-ñātisamāgama-licchavisamāgamādisadisaṃ,
analyzed: aneka satam bimbisāra samāgama ñāti samāgama licchavi samāgama ādi sadisam
translated: An assembly of many hundreds of nobles: such as the assembly of Bimbisara, the assembly of relatives, the assembly of Licchavis, and so on.

original: aññesu cakkavāḷesupi labbhateva. Sallapitapubbanti ālāpasallāpo katapubbo. Sākacchāti
analyzed: aññesu cakkavāḷesu pi labbha tā iva sallapita pubbanti ālāpa sallāpaḥ kata pubbaḥ
translated: It is found also in other world systems. One has had previous conversation with: one has had previous talk.

original: dhammasākacchāpi samāpajjitapubbā. Yādisako tesaṃ vaṇṇoti te odātāpi honti kāḷāpi
analyzed: samāpajjita pubbā tesam te odātā api honti kāḷā api
translated: and they have also discussed the Dhamma together. As to their complexion: they are fair or dark,

original: maṅguracchavīpi, satthā suvaṇṇavaṇṇo. Idaṃ pana saṇṭhānaṃ paṭicca kathitaṃ. Saṇṭhānampi
analyzed: satthā suvaṇṇa vaṇṇo idam pana saṇṭhānam paṭicca kathitam saṇṭhānam pi
translated: with a complexion like that of a parrot. The Teacher is golden-complexioned. This is said with reference to their bodily shape. And that shape

original: ca kevalaṃ tesaṃ paññāyatiyeva. Na pana bhagavā milakkhasadiso hoti, nāpi āmuttamaṇikuṇḍalo,
analyzed: ca kevalam tesam paññāyatiyā iva na pana bhagavā milakkha sadisaḥ hoti na api āmutta maṇi kuṇḍalo
translated: is only apparent to them. The Blessed One is not like a foreigner, nor is he like a man with earrings,

original: buddhaveseneva nisīdati. Tepi attano samānasaṇṭhānameva passanti. Yādisako tesaṃ
analyzed: buddha vesena iva nisīdati te pi attano samāna saṇṭhānam eva passanti yādisakaḥ tesam
translated: but he sits down in the Buddha-array. And they see only their own bodily shape. As to their

original: saroti te chinnassarāpi honti gaggassarāpi kākassarāpi, satthā brahmassarova. Idaṃ🔽pana bhāsantaraṃ sandhāya kathitaṃ. Sacepi hi satthā rājāsane nisinno katheti, “ajja
analyzed: te chinnassarā api honti gaggassarā api kākassarā api satthā brahmassarā uva idam  pana bhāsa antaram sandhāya kathitam sace pi hi satthā rāja āsane nisinnaḥ kathā iti ajja
translated: voice: they have a voice like that of a saw, a voice like that of a dove, a voice like that of a crow,🔽but the Teacher has a voice like Brahmā’s. This is said with reference to the sound of their speech. For if the Teacher speaks while sitting on the royal throne, they think,

original: rājā madhurena kathetī”ti nesaṃ hoti. Kathetvā pakkante pana bhagavati puna rājānaṃ
analyzed: rājā madhurena katheti iti kathetvā pakkante pana bhagavati punar rājānam
translated: “Today the king speaks sweetly.” But when the Blessed One has spoken and departed,🔽and they see the king coming again, they wonder, “Who is he?” There they think,

original: āgataṃ disvā “ko nu kho aya”nti vīmaṃsā uppajjati. Tattha ko nu kho ayanti “imasmiṃ
analyzed: āgatam disvā kaḥ nu kho ayanti vīmaṃsā uppajjati tattha kaḥ nu kho ayanti imasmin
translated: “Who is he?”

original: ṭhāne idāneva māgadhabhāsāya sīhaḷabhāsāya madhurena ākārena kathento ko nu kho ayaṃ🔽antarahito, kiṃ devo udāhu manusso”ti evaṃ vīmaṃsantāpi na jānantīti attho. Kimatthaṃ
analyzed: māgadha bhāsāya sīhaḷa bhāsāya madhurena ākārena kathentaḥ kaḥ nu kho ayam  antarahitaḥ kim devaḥ udāhu manusso ti evam vīmaṃsantā api na jānanti iti attho kimattham
translated: “In the place where the Buddha was teaching the Dhamma, in the Magadhan language and in the sweet Sinhala language, who is this?

original: panevaṃ ajānantānaṃ dhammaṃ desetīti? Vāsanatthāya. Evaṃ sutopi hi dhammo anāgate🔽paccayo hotīti anāgataṃ paṭicca deseti. Anekasataṃ brāhmaṇaparisantiādinaṃ soṇadaṇḍasamāgamādivasena
analyzed: pana ivam a jānantānam dhammam deseti iti vāsana tthāya evam sutaḥ api hi dhammaḥ anāgate  paccayaḥ hoti iti anāgatam paṭicca deseti aneka satam soṇa daṇḍa samāgama ādi vasena
translated: Who is this who has disappeared? Is it a god or a human being?” The meaning is that they did not know even though they were thinking in this way. But why did he teach the Dhamma to those who did not know? For the sake of the impression . For even though they slept, the Dhamma that was heard would be a condition for them in the future.

original: ceva aññacakkavāḷavasena ca sambhavo veditabbo.🔽10. Bhūmicālasuttavaṇṇanā🔽70. Dasame nisīdananti idha cammakhaṇḍaṃ adhippetaṃ. Udenaṃ cetiyanti udenayakkhassa🔽vasanaṭṭhāne katavihāro vuccati. Gotamakādīsupi eseva nayo. Bhāvitāti vaḍḍhitā. Bahulīkatāti
analyzed: ca iva añña cakkavāḷa vasena ca sambhavaḥ veditabbo  bhūmicāla sutta vaṇṇanā  dasame nisīdanam ti idha camma khaṇḍam adhippetam udenam cetiyanti udena yakkhassa  vasana ṭṭhāne kata vihāraḥ vuccati gotamaka ādīsu pi esā iva nayaḥ bhāvitā ati vaḍḍhitā bahulīkatā ati
translated: Therefore he taught the Dhamma with reference to the future. The “many hundreds of brahmin assemblies” and so on can be understood as having occurred in the time of the meeting with Sonadanda and so on, and in other world systems.🔽The Explanation of the Earth-tremor Sutta

original: punappunaṃ katā. Yānīkatāti yuttayānaṃ viya katā. Vatthukatāti patiṭṭhānaṭṭhena vatthu
analyzed: punappunam katā yā anīka tā ati yutta yānam viya katā vatthukatā ati patiṭṭhāna ṭṭhena vatthu
translated: In the tenth sutta, “seat” here means a piece of leather. “The shrine of Udena” is said to be the monastery built in the dwelling place of the yakkha Udena. The same method applies to Gotamaka and so on. “Developed” means increased. “Cultivated” means done again and again. “Made into a vehicle” means made like a yoked vehicle. “Basis” means a basis in the sense of a foundation.

original: viya katā. Anuṭṭhitāti adhiṭṭhitā. Paricitāti samantato citā suvaḍḍhitā. Susamāraddhāti suṭṭhu samāraddhā.
analyzed: viya katā anuṭṭhitā ati adhiṭṭhitā paricitā ati samantataḥ citā su vaḍḍhitā su samāraddhā ati suṭṭhu samāraddhā
translated: and so on. “He could remain” : he could resolve to remain. “He could make it last” : he could make it last long, make it last well. “He could make it go far” : he could make it extend all around, make it well extended. “He could make it well-established” : he could make it well established.

original: Iti aniyamena kathetvā puna niyametvā dassento tathāgatassa khotiādimāha. Ettha kappanti
analyzed: iti aniyamena kathetvā puna niyametvā dassentaḥ tathāgatassa kho ti ādim āha ettha kappanti
translated: Having thus spoken without restriction, he now speaks with restriction, saying “The Tathagata, monks, could remain … for the lifespan or for what is left of the lifespan.”

original: āyukappaṃ. Tasmiṃ tasmiṃ kāle yaṃ manussānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ, taṃ paripuṇṇaṃ karonto🔽tiṭṭheyya. Kappāvasesaṃ vāti “appaṃ vā bhiyyo”ti vuttavassasatato atirekaṃ vā. Mahāsīvatthero
analyzed: āyu kappam tasmin tasmin kāle yam manussānam āyu ppamāṇam tam paripuṇṇam karontaḥ  tiṭṭheyya kappa avasesam vā āti appam vā bhiyyas ti vutta vassa satataḥ atirekam vā mahāsīva thero
translated: Herein, the lifespan is the measure of the lifespan. Making it full, he could remain for the lifespan.🔽“For what is left of the lifespan” means for what is left of the lifespan in any particular period.

original: panāha – “buddhānaṃ aṭṭhāne gajjitaṃ nāma natthi, punappunaṃ samāpajjitvā maraṇantikavedanaṃ
analyzed: pana āha buddhānam aṭṭhāne gajjitam nāma natthi punappunam samāpajjitvā maraṇa antika vedanam
translated: The Elder Maha-Siva, however, said: “The Buddhas have no thunderous roar in the wrong place. Having repeatedly attained jhana, he could remain for the remainder of the lifespan, suppressing the feeling that accompanies death.

original: vikkhambhento bhaddakappameva tiṭṭheyya. Kasmā pana na ṭhitoti? Upādinnakasarīraṃ
analyzed: vikkhambhentaḥ bhadda kappam eva tiṭṭheyya kasmā pana na ṭhitaḥ ti upādinnaka sarīram
translated: But why did he not remain? Because a body that is clung to is overcome by breaking up, etc.,

original: nāma khaṇḍiccādīhi abhibhuyyati, buddhā ca khaṇḍiccādibhāvaṃ appatvā pañcame āyukoṭṭhāse
analyzed: nāma khaṇḍicca ādīhi buddhā ca khaṇḍicca ādi bhāvam ap patvā pañcame āyu koṭṭhāse
translated: and the Buddhas do not remain until they reach the stage of breaking up, etc.

original: bahujanassa piyamanāpakāleyeva parinibbāyanti. Buddhānubuddhesu ca mahāsāvakesu parinibbutesu🔽ekakeneva khāṇukena viya ṭhātabbaṃ hoti daharasāmaṇeraparivārena vā, tato ‘aho buddhānaṃ🔽parisā’ti hīḷetabbataṃ āpajjeyya. Tasmā na ṭhito”ti. Evaṃ vuttepi yo pana vuccati
analyzed: bahu janassa piya manāpa kāleya iva parinibbāyanti buddhānubuddhesu ca mahāsāvakesu parinibbutesu  ekakena iva khāṇukena viya ṭhātabbam hoti dahara sāmaṇera parivārena vā tatas aho buddhānam  parisā ati hi iḷetabbatam āpajjeyya tasmā na ṭhitaḥ ti evam vutte pi yaḥ pana vuccati
translated: When the Great Disciples, who are the Awakened One’s successors, have attained Nibbāna,🔽he would have to stand alone with a retinue of young novices, and then he would be open to the criticism: ‘Oh, the Buddha’s following is small!’ That is why he does not stand.”

original: “āyukappo”ti, idameva aṭṭhakathāya niyāmitaṃ.
analyzed: āyu kappo ti idam eva aṭṭhakathāya niyāmitam
translated: Even when this is said, however, the statement “the time of life” is the only one that is authoritative in the commentaries.

original: Yathā taṃ mārena pariyuṭṭhitacittoti ettha tanti nipātamattaṃ, yathā mārena pariyuṭṭhitacitto
analyzed: yathā tam mārena pariyuṭṭhita cittaḥ iti ettha nipāta mattam yathā mārena pariyuṭṭhita cittaḥ
translated: As to the phrase “his mind was obsessed by Mara,” the word as is merely a particle. Just as any other worldling whose mind is obsessed by Mara,

original: ajjhotthaṭacitto aññopi koci puthujjano paṭivijjhituṃ na sakkuṇeyya, evameva nāsakkhi
analyzed: ajjhotthaṭa cittaḥ aññaḥ api koci puthujjanaḥ paṭivijjhitum na sakkuṇeyya evam eva na asakkhi
translated: whose mind is overwhelmed by Mara, would be unable to penetrate,

original: paṭivijjhitunti attho. Māro hi yassa sabbena sabbaṃ dvādasa vipallāsā appahīnā, tassa
analyzed: paṭivijjhitunti atthaḥ māraḥ hi yassa sabbena sabbam dvādasa vipallāsāḥ a pahīnā tassa
translated: so too he was unable to penetrate. This is the meaning. For Mara obsesses the mind of one in whom the twelve inversions are unabandoned in every way.

original: cittaṃ pariyuṭṭhāti. Therassa ca cattāro vipallāsā appahīnā, tenassa māro cittaṃ
analyzed: cittam pariyuṭṭhāti therassa ca cattāro vipallāsāḥ appahīnā tena assa māro cittam
translated: But the Elder had not abandoned the four inversions, so Mara obsessed his mind.

original: pariyuṭṭhāsi. So pana cittapariyuṭṭhānaṃ karonto kiṃ karotīti? Bheravaṃ rūpārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: pariyuṭṭhāsi saḥ pana citta pariyuṭṭhānam karontaḥ kim karoti iti bheravam rūpa ārammaṇam
translated: But what does he do in doing the adverting? He makes the sign of the triple-condensed in-breath and out-breath his object.🔽

original: vā dasseti, saddārammaṇaṃ vā sāveti. Tato sattā taṃ disvā vā sutvā vā satiṃ vissajjetvā
analyzed: vā dasseti sadda ārammaṇam vā sāveti tatas sattā tam disvā vā sutvā vā satim vissajjetvā
translated: He was possessed. But what does one who is possessed do? He either shows a terrifying visible object as object or he makes a terrifying sound as object. Then, on seeing or hearing that, beings lose their mindfulness and

original: vivaṭamukhā honti, tesaṃ mukhena hatthaṃ pavesetvā hadayaṃ maddati, tato visaññāva🔽hutvā tiṭṭhanti. Therassa panesa mukhe hatthaṃ pavesetuṃ kiṃ sakkhissati, bheravārammaṇaṃ🔽pana dassesi. Taṃ disvā thero nimittobhāsaṃ nappaṭivijjhi. Bhagavā jānantoyeva kimatthaṃ🔽yāva tatiyaṃ āmantesīti? Parato “tiṭṭhatu, bhante bhagavā”ti yācite “tuyhevetaṃ dukkaṭaṃ,🔽tuyhevetaṃ aparaddha”nti dosāropanena so katanukaraṇatthaṃ.
analyzed: vivaṭa mukhāḥ honti tesam mukhena hattham pavesetvā hadayam maddati tatas visaññā ava  hutvā tiṭṭhanti therassa pana esa mukhe hattham pavesetum kim sakkhissati bherava ārammaṇam  pana dassesi tam disvā theraḥ nimitta ubhāsam na paṭivijjhi bhagavā jānantaḥ yā iva kimattham  yāva tatiyam āmantesi iti paratas tiṭṭhatu bhante bhagavā ati yācite dukkaṭam  dosa āropanena saḥ
translated: become open-mouthed. He puts his hand into their mouths and fetches their heart. Then they stand there senseless as though🔽dead. But how could he put his hand into the Elder’s mouth? He showed a terrifying object. On seeing it the Elder did not penetrate the appearance of the sign. But why did the Blessed One call him three times, knowing as he did?

original: Māro pāpimāti ettha satte anatthe niyojento māretīti māro. Pāpimāti tasseva vevacanaṃ.
analyzed: māraḥ pāpimā iti ettha satte anatthe niyojentaḥ māreti iti māraḥ pāpimā iti tassa iva vevacanam
translated: When the other said, “Let the Blessed One be, venerable sir,” he accused him of the fault, saying, “It is your misfortune, it is your mistake,” in order to make him humble.

original: So hi pāpadhammasamannāgatattā “pāpimā”ti vuccati. Kaṇho, antako, namuci, pamattabandhūtipi
analyzed: so hi pāpa dhamma samannāgata ttā pāpimā iti vuccati kaṇhaḥ antakaḥ namuci
translated: He is called “wicked” because he is possessed of wicked states. “Black,” “killer,” “Namuci,” and “friend of the heedless” are also his names.

original: tasseva nāmāni. Bhāsitā kho panesāti ayañhi bhagavato sambodhipattiyā aṭṭhame sattāhe
analyzed: tassa iva nāmāni bhāsitā kho pana isā ati ayan hi bhagavato sambodhi pattiyā aṭṭhame sattāhe
translated: “But this was said by the Exalted One”: after the Exalted One attained enlightenment, on the eighth day after his enlightenment,

original: bodhimaṇḍeyeva āgantvā “bhagavā yadatthaṃ tumhehi pāramiyo pūritā, so vo attho anuppatto,
analyzed: āgantvā bhagavā yadattham tumhehi pāramiyaḥ pūritā saḥ vaḥ atthaḥ an uppatto
translated: the Brahmā Sahampati came to the Bodhi tree and said, “The purpose for which you fulfilled the perfections has now been accomplished;

original: paṭividdhaṃ sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ, kiṃ te lokavicāraṇenā”ti vatvā yathā ajja, evameva🔽“parinibbātu dāni, bhante bhagavā”ti yāci. Bhagavā cassa “na tāvāha”ntiādīni vatvā
analyzed: paṭividdham sabbaññu tad ññāṇam kim te loka vicāraṇena ati vatvā yathā ajja evam eva  parinibbātu dāni bhante bhagavā ati yāci bhagavā ca ssa na vatvā
translated: you have penetrated omniscience. What have you to do with wandering in the world?” Just as he said this today,🔽so he said it then. The Exalted One replied, “Not yet,” and so on, and refused.

original: paṭikkhipi. Taṃ sandhāya – “bhāsitā kho panesā, bhante”tiādimāha.
analyzed: tam sandhāya bhāsitā kho pana isā bhante ti ādim āha
translated: With reference to that, the elder said, “But this was said by the Exalted One.”

original: Tattha viyattāti maggavasena byattā, tatheva vinītā, tathā visāradā. Bahussutāti
analyzed: tattha viyattā ati magga vasena byattā tathā iva vinītā tathā visāradā bahu sutā
translated: Herein, “trained” means trained by the path, disciplined, and confident. “Learned” means they have learned much in the three Piṭakas.

original: tepiṭakavasena bahu sutaṃ etesanti bahussutā. Tameva dhammaṃ dhārentīti dhammadharā.
analyzed: te piṭaka vasena bahu tam eva dhammam dhārenti iti dhamma dharā
translated: “Bearing the Dhamma in mind” means they bear the Dhamma in mind.

original: Atha vā pariyattibahussutā ceva paṭivedhabahussutā ca. Pariyattipaṭivedhadhammānaṃyeva🔽dhāraṇato dhammadharāti evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo. Dhammānudhammappaṭipannāti ariyadhammassa
analyzed: atha vā pariyatti bahussutā ca iva paṭivedha bahussutā ca pariyatti paṭivedha dhammānaṃ eva  dhāraṇataḥ dhamma dharā ti evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo dhamma anudhamma paṭipannā ti ariya dhammassa
translated: Or else, they are both learned in the scriptures and learned in the penetrations.🔽The meaning should be regarded as follows: “They will bear in mind the teachings of the scriptures and the penetrations.”

original: anudhammabhūtaṃ vipassanādhammaṃ paṭipannā. Sāmīcippaṭipannāti anucchavikapaṭipadaṃ
analyzed: anudhamma bhūtam vipassanā dhammam paṭipannā sāmīci paṭipannā ati anucchavika paṭipadam
translated: They are practicing in conformity with the Dhamma of the noble ones: they are practicing the Dhamma of insight, which is in conformity with the Dhamma of the noble path.🔽They are practicing suitably: they are practicing the suitable practice.🔽They are living in conformity with the Dhamma: they have the virtue of living in conformity with the Dhamma.

original: paṭipannā. Anudhammacārinoti anudhammaṃ caraṇasīlā. Sakaṃ ācariyakanti attano ācariyavādaṃ.
analyzed: paṭipannāḥ anudhamma cārino ti anudhammam caraṇa sīlā sakam ācariyakam ti attanaḥ ācariya vādam
translated: Their own teacher’s instruction: the doctrine of their own teacher.🔽All these terms beginning with “They will teach” are synonyms.

original: Ācikkhissantītiādīni sabbāni aññamaññavevacanāni. Sahadhammenāti sahetukena sakāraṇena
analyzed: ācikkhissanti iti ādīni sabbāni aññamañña vevacanāni sahadhammena ati sa hetukena sa kāraṇena
translated: With the Dhamma as their standard: with a statement that has a reason and a cause.

original: vacanena. Sappāṭihāriyanti yāva niyyānikaṃ katvā dhammaṃ desessanti.
analyzed: vacanena sappāṭihāriyanti yāva niyyānikam katvā dhammam desessanti
translated: With what is convincing: they will teach the Dhamma so that it is conducive to complete emancipation.🔽The holy life: the entire holy life of the Dispensation, which is included in the three trainings.

original: Brahmacariyanti sikkhāttayasaṅgahitaṃ sakalaṃ sāsanabrahmacariyaṃ. Iddhanti samiddhaṃ
analyzed: brahmacariyanti sakalam sāsana brahmacariyam iddhanti samiddham
translated: Flourishing: prosperous, through the enjoyment of jhana.

original: jhānassādavasena. Phītanti vuddhipattaṃ sabbapāliphullaṃ viya abhiññāsampattivasena.
analyzed: jhāna ssāda vasena phītanti vuddhi pattam sabba pāli phullam viya abhiññā sampatti vasena
translated: Prospering: having reached growth, like a tree in full flower, through the attainment of the higher knowledges.

original: Vitthārikanti vitthataṃ tasmiṃ tasmiṃ disābhāge patiṭṭhitavasena. Bāhujaññanti bahūhi
analyzed: vitthārikanti vitthatam tasmin tasmin disā bhāge patiṭṭhita vasena bāhujaññanti bahūhi
translated: “Spreading out” means spread out in the various directions.

original: ñātaṃ paṭividdhaṃ mahājanābhisamayavasena. Puthubhūtanti sabbākārena puthulabhāvappattaṃ.🔽Kathaṃ? Yāva devamanussehi suppakāsitanti, yattakā viññujātikā devā ceva manussā
analyzed: ñātam paṭividdham mahā jana abhisamaya vasena puthu bhūtanti sabba ākārena puthula bhāva ppattam  katham yāva deva manussehi suppakāsitanti yattakā viññu jātikā devā ca iva manussā
translated: “In detail” means in detail in each direction. “Well-known” means known, penetrated, by many, by the great multitude. “Widely-known” means reached the state of being wide in every way.

original: ca atthi, sabbehi suṭṭhu pakāsitanti attho. Appossukkoti nirālayo. Tvañhi pāpima
analyzed: ca atthi sabbehi suṭṭhu pakāsitanti attho appossukkaḥ iti nirālayaḥ tvam hi pāpima
translated: How? “As far as gods and men” means as far as gods and men, as far as those who have consciousness, as far as all who exist. The meaning is: well-known by all. “Without concern” means without attachment. For you, Evil One,

original: aṭṭhamasattāhato paṭṭhāya “parinibbātu dāni, bhante bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato”ti
analyzed: aṭṭhama sattāhato paṭṭhāya parinibbātu dāni bhante bhagavā parinibbātu sugato ti
translated: from the eighth day after the Buddha’s enlightenment you have been wandering about crying: “Now let the Lord Buddha attain final Nibbana, let the Well-Farer attain final Nibbana!”

original: viravanto āhiṇḍittha. Ajja dāni paṭṭhāya vigatussāho hohi, mā mayhaṃ parinibbānatthaṃ🔽vāyāmaṃ karohīti vadati.
analyzed: viravantaḥ āhiṇḍittha ajja dāni paṭṭhāya vigata ussāhaḥ hohi mā mayham parinibbāna attham  vā āyāmam karohi iti vadati
translated: From today onwards be free from anxiety, make no effort to bring about my final Nibbana.

original: Sato sampajāno āyusaṅkhāraṃ ossajjīti satiṃ sūpaṭṭhitaṃ katvā ñāṇena paricchinditvā
analyzed: sataḥ sampajānaḥ āyu saṅkhāram ossajji iti satim su upaṭṭhitam katvā ñāṇena paricchinditvā
translated: “Mindfully and with full awareness he relinquished the life-process” means he relinquished, he gave up, the life-process with well-established mindfulness and with full awareness.

original: āyusaṅkhāraṃ vissajji pajahi. Tattha na bhagavā hatthena leḍḍuṃ viya āyusaṅkhāraṃ
analyzed: āyu saṅkhāram vissajji pajahi tattha na bhagavā hatthena leḍḍum viya āyu saṅkhāram
translated: Here the Blessed One did not throw away the life-process as one might throw away a clod or a stone.

original: ossaji, temāsamattameva pana phalasamāpattiṃ samāpajjitvā tato paraṃ na samāpajjissāmīti
analyzed: ossaji te māsa mattam eva pana phala samāpattim samāpajjitvā tatas param na samāpajjissāmi iti
translated: He gave up the life-span, but after attaining fruition attainment for three months, he aroused his mind thus: “I will not attain it again.”

original: cittaṃ uppādesi. Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “ossajī”ti. Ussajītipi pāṭho. Mahābhūmicāloti
analyzed: cittam uppādesi tam sandhāya vuttam ossajī iti ussajī iti pi pāṭhaḥ mahā bhūmi cālo ti
translated: It was in reference to this that it was said: “He gave up the life-span.” The reading ussajji is also correct. A great earthquake:

Bhiṃsanakoti bhayajanako.🔽Devadundubhiyo ca phaliṃsūti devabheriyo phaliṃsu, devo sukkhagajjitaṃ gajji, akālavijjulatā🔽nicchariṃsu, khaṇikavassaṃ vassīti vuttaṃ hoti.🔽Udānaṃ udānesīti kasmā udānesi? Koci nāma vadeyya “bhagavā pacchato pacchato anubandhitvā🔽‘parinibbātu, bhante’ti upadduto bhayena āyusaṅkhāraṃ vissajjesī”ti, tassokāso mā
analyzed: mahantaḥ pathavī kampo tadā kira dasa sahassī lokadhātu kampittha bhiṃsanako uti bhaya janako  ca deva bheriyaḥ ca devaḥ sukkha gajjitam gajji akāla vijjula tā  nicchariṃsu khaṇika vassam vassī iti vuttam hoti  udānam udānesi iti kasmai udānesi koci nāma vadeyya bhagavā pacchatas pacchatas anubandhitvā  parinibbātu bhante ti upaddutaḥ bhayena āyu saṅkhāram vissajjesi iti tassa ukāsaḥ mā
translated: a great trembling of the earth. At that time, it is said, the ten-thousandfold world system shook. Frightful and terrifying: causing fear.
