analyzed: aṭṭhame virecananti dosa nīharaṇa bhesajjam virittā hoti iti nīhaṭā hoti panuditā
translated: In the eighth, purgative: medicine for expelling bile. Is purged: is expelled, is removed.

original: Navame vamananti vamanakaraṇabhesajjaṃ. Dasame niddhamanīyāti niddhamitabbā. Niddhantāti niddhamitā.
analyzed: navame vamananti vamana karaṇa bhesajjam dasame niddhamanīyā ati niddhamitabbā niddhantā ati niddhamitā
translated: In the ninth, emetic: medicine for inducing vomiting. In the tenth, to be vomited: to be vomited up. Vomited: vomited up.

original: 11. Paṭhamaasekhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṭhama asekha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the first Asekhasutta is finished.

original: 111. Ekādasame aṅgaparipūraṇatthaṃ sammādiṭṭhiyeva sammāñāṇanti vuttā. Evamete sabbepi arahattaphaladhammā asekhā, asekhassa pavattattā paccavekkhaṇañāṇampi asekhanti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ekādasame aṅga paripūraṇa attham sammādiṭṭhiyā iva sammāñāṇanti vuttā evam ete sabbe pi arahatta phala dhammā asekhā asekhassa pavattattā paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇam pi asekhanti vuttam
translated: In the eleventh, right view is called right knowledge for the purpose of fulfilling the factors. Thus all these states of the arahant path are called “of the adept” because they occur in the adept, and the reviewing knowledge is called “of the adept” too.

original: 12. Dutiyaasekhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya asekha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the second Asekhasutta is finished.

original: 112. Dvādasame asekhiyāti asekhāyeva, asekhasantakā vā. Iminā suttena khīṇāsavova kathitoti.
analyzed: dvādasame asekhiyā ti asekhāya iva asekha santakā vā iminā suttena khīṇāsavaḥ uva kathitoti
translated: In the twelfth, adept: of the adept only, or belonging to the adept. By this sutta only one whose cankers are destroyed is meant.

original: Samaṇasaññāvaggo paṭhamo.
analyzed: samaṇa saññā vaggo paṭhamaḥ
translated: The first chapter, called “The Chapter on the Idea of a Monk,” is finished.

original: (12) 2. Paccorohaṇivaggo
analyzed: paccorohaṇi vaggo
translated: (12) 2. The Chapter on the Descent

original: 1-2. Adhammasuttadvayavaṇṇanā
translated: The Two Discourses on What is not the True Way

original: 113-114. Dutiyassa paṭhame pāṭiyekkaṃ pucchā ca vissajjanā ca katā. Dutiye ekatova.
analyzed: dutiyassa paṭhame pāṭiyekkam pucchā ca vissajjanā ca katā dutiye ekatas va
translated: In the first of the second group the questions and answers are given separately. In the second they are given together.

original: 3. Tatiyaadhammasuttavaṇṇanā🔽115. Tatiye uddesaṃ uddisitvāti mātikaṃ nikkhipitvā. Satthu ceva saṃvaṇṇitoti pañcasu
analyzed: tatiya adhamma sutta vaṇṇanā  tatiye uddesam uddisitvā ati mātikam nikkhipitvā satthu ca iva saṃvaṇṇito ti pañcasu
translated: The Third Discourse on What is not the True Way🔽In the third, after he had recited the summary, he had set forth the list of the ten courses of unprofitable action.🔽“He is praised by the Master” means that he is praised by the Master who places him at the head in the five places for placing .

original: ṭhānesu etadagge ṭhapentena satthārā saṃvaṇṇito. Sambhāvitoti guṇasambhāvanāya sambhāvito.
analyzed: ṭhānesu etad agge ṭhapentena satthārā saṃvaṇṇitaḥ sambhāvitaḥ iti guṇa sambhāvanāya sambhāvitaḥ
translated: “He is honoured” means that he is honoured by the honouring of his special qualities.🔽“He is capable” means that he is able.🔽“Having gone beyond” means having surpassed.

original: Pahotīti sakkoti. Atisitvāti atikkamitvā. Jānaṃ jānātīti jānitabbakaṃ jānāti. Passaṃ
analyzed: pahoti iti sakkoti atisitvā ati atikkamitvā jānam jānāti iti jānitabbakam jānāti passam
translated: “He knows what is known” means that he knows what should be known.🔽“He sees what is seen” means that he sees what should be seen.

original: passatīti passitabbakaṃ passati. Cakkhubhūtoti cakkhu viya bhūto jāto nibbatto. Ñāṇabhūtoti
analyzed: passati iti passitabbakam passati cakkhu bhūtaḥ ti cakkhu viya bhūtaḥ jātaḥ nibbattaḥ ñāṇa bhūtaḥ ti
translated: “He has become eye” means that he has become, has been born, has arisen, as eye.🔽“He has become knowledge” means that he has become the nature of knowledge.

original: ñāṇasabhāvo. Dhammabhūtoti dhammasabhāvo. Brahmabhūtoti seṭṭhasabhāvo. Vattāti vattuṃ
analyzed: ñāṇa sabhāvaḥ dhamma bhūto ti dhamma sabhāvaḥ brahma bhūto ti seṭṭha sabhāvaḥ vattā ati vattum
translated: “He has become Dhamma” means that he has become the nature of Dhamma.🔽“He has become a Divine State” means that he has become the nature of the best.🔽“He can speak” means that he is able to speak.🔽“He can expound” means that he is able to expound.

original: samattho. Pavattāti pavattetuṃ samattho. Atthassa ninnetāti atthaṃ nīharitvā dassetā.
analyzed: samatthaḥ pavattā ati pavattetum samatthaḥ atthassa ninnetā ati attham nīharitvā dassetā
translated: “He can show the meaning” means that he can show the meaning by bringing it out.

original: Yathā no bhagavāti yathā amhākaṃ bhagavā byākareyya.🔽4. Ajitasuttavaṇṇanā🔽116. Catutthe ajitoti evaṃnāmako. Cittaṭṭhānasatānīti cittuppādasatāni. Yehīti yehi🔽cittaṭṭhānasatehi anuyuñjiyamānā. Upāraddhāva jānanti upāraddhasmāti viraddhā niggahitā
analyzed: yathā naḥ bhagavā ati yathā amhākam bhagavā byākareyya  ajita sutta vaṇṇanā  catutthe ajitoti evaṃnāmako citta ṭṭhāna satāni iti cittuppāda satāni yehi iti yehi  citta ṭṭhāna satehi anuyuñjiyamānā upāraddhā ava jānanti viraddhā niggahitā
translated: . Commentary on the Ajita Sutta

original: evaṃ jānanti “viraddhā mayaṃ, niggahitā mayaṃ, āropito no doso”ti. Paṇḍitavatthūnīti🔽paṇḍitabhāvatthāya kāraṇāni.
analyzed: evam jānanti viraddhāḥ mayam niggahitāḥ mayam āropitaḥ no doso ti paṇḍita vatthūni iti  paṇḍita bhāvatthāya kāraṇāni
translated: . In the fourth sutta, Ajita is the name of the wanderer. A hundred thoughts: a hundred thoughts that arise. By which: by which a hundred thoughts that arise. When questioned: when questioned. They know: they know thus: “We are defeated, we are refuted, our fault has been pointed out to us.” The grounds of a wise man: the grounds, the reasons, for being wise.

original: 5-6. Saṅgāravasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary on the Sangarava Sutta

original: 117-118. Pañcame orimaṃ tīranti lokiyaṃ orimatīraṃ. Pārimaṃ tīranti lokuttaraṃ pārimatīraṃ.
analyzed: pañcame orimam tīranti lokiyam orima tīram pārimam tīranti lokuttaram pārima tīram
translated: . In the fifth sutta, this shore is the mundane, the shore on this side. The further shore is the supramundane, the shore on the other side.

original: Pāragāminoti nibbānagāmino. Tīramevānudhāvatīti sakkāyadiṭṭhitīraṃyeva anudhāvati.
analyzed: pāra gāmino ti nibbāna gāmino tīram eva anudhāvati iti sakkāya diṭṭhi tīram yā iva anudhāvati
translated: One who goes to the further shore: one who goes to Nibbāna. He runs only to the shore: he runs only to the shore of personality view.

original: Dhamme dhammānuvattinoti sammā akkhāte navavidhe lokuttaradhamme anudhammavattino,
analyzed: dhamme dhamma anuvattino ti sammā akkhāte navavidhe lokuttara dhamme anudhamma vattino
translated: In the Dhamma, in the practice of the Dhamma: in the ninefold supramundane Dhamma rightly proclaimed, in the practice of the Dhamma,

original: tassa dhammassānucchavikāya sahasīlāya pubbabhāgapaṭipattiyā pavattamānā. Maccudheyyaṃ
analyzed: tassa dhammassa ānucchavikāya saha sīlāya pubbabhāga paṭipattiyā pavattamānā maccudheyyam
translated: and the practice of virtue is the preliminary training in the kind of virtue that is fitting for the realization of that Dhamma.

original: suduttaranti maccuno ṭhānabhūtaṃ tebhūmakavaṭṭaṃ suduttaraṃ taritvā. Pāramessantīti
analyzed: maccunaḥ ṭhāna bhūtam tebhūmaka vaṭṭam suduttaram taritvā pāramessanti iti
translated: The state of death is hard to cross: the round of rebirths in the three planes, which is the state of death, is hard to cross over.

original: nibbānaṃ pāpuṇissanti.
analyzed: nibbānam pāpuṇissanti
translated: They will reach the further shore: they will reach Nibbāna.🔽Having come to the shelterless place: having come to the place of the turning away from the round of rebirths.

original: Okā anokamāgammāti vaṭṭato vivaṭṭaṃ āgamma. Viveke yattha dūramanti yasmiṃ kāyacittaupadhiviveke
analyzed: okāḥ anokam āgamma ati vaṭṭataḥ vivaṭṭam āgamma viveke yattha yasmin kāya citta opadhi viveke
translated: In solitude where there is no sound: in the solitude of body, mind, and requisites,🔽where there is no sound of delight. There he should wish for delight: there he should wish for delight.

original: durabhiramaṃ, tatrābhiratimiccheyya. Hitvā kāmeti duvidhepi kāme pahāya. Akiñcanoti
analyzed: durabhiramam tatra abhiratim iccheyya hitvā kāma iti duvidhe api kāme pahāya akiñcanā uti
translated: Having abandoned sense desires: having abandoned the two kinds of sense desires.🔽The unattached man: the unfettered man.

original: nippalibodho. Ādānapaṭinissageti gahaṇapaṭinissaggasaṅkhāte nibbāne. Anupādāya ye
analyzed: nippalibodhaḥ ādāna paṭinissage ti gahaṇa paṭinissagga saṅkhāte nibbāne an upādāya ye
translated: In the relinquishing of grasping: in Nibbāna, which is called the relinquishing of grasping.

original: ratāti catūhi upādānehi kiñcipi anupādiyitvā ye abhiratā. Parinibbutāti te apaccayaparinibbānena
analyzed: ratā ati catūhi upādānehi an upādiyitvā ye abhiratā parinibbutā ati te a paccaya parinibbānena
translated: Those who delight in non-grasping: those who delight in non-grasping of anything through the four kinds of grasping.

original: parinibbutā nāmāti veditabbā. Chaṭṭhaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ desitaṃ.🔽7-8. Paccorohaṇīsuttadvayavaṇṇanā
analyzed: parinibbutā nāma ati veditabbā chaṭṭham bhikkhūnam desitam 🔽paccorohaṇī sutta dvaya vaṇṇanā
translated: They are called “fully quenched”: they are called “fully quenched” by the quenching of conditions.

original: 119-120. Sattame paccorohaṇīti pāpassa paccorohaṇaṃ. Pattharitvāti santharitvā. Antarā🔽ca velaṃ antarā ca agyāgāranti vālikārāsissa ca aggiagārassa ca antare. Aṭṭhamaṃ
analyzed: sattame paccorohaṇī iti pāpassa paccorohaṇam pattharitvā ati santharitvā antarā  ca velam antarā ca vālikārāsissa ca aggiagārassa ca antare aṭṭhamaṃ
translated: 119-120. The seventh is called the “down-going” because it is the down-going of evil. “Spread out”: spread out and laid down. “Between the water’s edge and the fire-house”: between the water’s edge and the sand-bank and the fire-house. The eighth is called the “down-going” because it is the down-going of evil.

original: bhikkhusaṅghassa desitaṃ. Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānatthamevāti.
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghassa desitam sesam sabbattha uttāna attham eva ati
translated: In the seventh, the descent is the descent of evil. He spread out means he spread out. Between the bathing place and the fire house means between the bathing place and the fire house. The eighth was taught to the Sangha of monks. The rest is all clear in meaning.

original: Paccorohaṇivaggo dutiyo.
analyzed: paccorohaṇi vaggo dutiyaḥ
translated: The second sub-chapter on the descent is finished.

original: (13) 3. Parisuddhavaggavaṇṇanā
translated: The third sub-chapter on purity

original: 123. Tatiyassa paṭhame parisuddhāti nimmalā. Pariyodātāti pabhassarā. Dutiyādīni uttānatthānevāti.
analyzed: tatiyassa paṭhame parisuddhā ati nimmalā pariyodātā ati pabhassarā dutiya ādīni
translated: In the first of the third, pure means stainless. Very bright means shining. The second and following are clear in meaning.

original: Parisuddhavaggo tatiyo.
analyzed: parisuddha vaggaḥ tatiyaḥ
translated: The third sub-chapter on purity is finished.

original: (14) 4. Sādhuvaggavaṇṇanā
translated: The fourth sub-chapter on good

original: 134. Catutthassa paṭhame sādhunti bhaddakaṃ siliṭṭhakaṃ. Dutiyādīni uttānatthānevāti. Ariyamaggavaggo uttānatthoyevāti.
analyzed: catutthassa paṭhame sādhunti bhaddakam siliṭṭhakam dutiya ādīni uttāna thāna eva ati ariya magga vaggo uttāna tthaḥ yeva ati
translated: In the first of the fourth, good means excellent. The second and following are clear in meaning. The sub-chapter on the noble path is clear in meaning.

original: Sādhuvaggo catuttho.
analyzed: sādhu vaggo catutthaḥ
translated: The fourth sub-chapter on good is finished.

original: Tatiyapaṇṇāsakaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: tatiya paṇṇāsakam niṭṭhitam
translated: The third section is finished.

original: 4. Catutthapaṇṇāsakaṃ
analyzed: catuttha paṇṇāsakam
translated: The fourth section

original: 155. Catutthassa paṭhamādīni uttānatthānevāti.
analyzed: catutthassa paṭhama ādīni
translated: In the first of the fourth and following, the meaning is clear.

original: 8. Kammanidānasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kamma nidāna sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the sutta on the source of kamma

original: 174. Aṭṭhame lobhahetukampīti pāṇātipātassa lobho upanissayakoṭiyā hetu hoti dosamohasampayuttopi. Iminā upāyena sabbattha attho veditabbo.
analyzed: aṭṭhame lobha hetu kampī ti pāṇātipātassa lobho upanissaya koṭiyā hetu hoti dosa moha sampayuttaḥ api iminā upāyena sabbattha atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: In the eighth, he is shaken by greed as cause: greed is a cause for killing living beings as decisive support. And so too in the case of all the rest.

original: 9. Parikkamanasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: parikkamana sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discussion of the Going Forth Sutta

original: 175. Navame parikkamanaṃ hotīti parivajjanaṃ hoti.🔽10. Cundasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: navame parikkamanam hoti iti parivajjanam hoti  cunda sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: In the ninth, there is going forth: there is avoidance.🔽The Discussion of Cunda the Smith Sutta

original: 176. Dasame kammāraputtassāti suvaṇṇakāraputtassa. Kassa no tvanti kassa nu tvaṃ.🔽Pacchābhūmakāti pacchābhūmivāsikā. Kamaṇḍalukāti kamaṇḍaludhārino. Sevālamālikāti
analyzed: dasame kammāra puttassa ati suvaṇṇakāra puttassa kassa no tvam ti kassa nu tvam  pacchābhūmakā ati pacchābhūmi vāsikā kamaṇḍalukā ati kamaṇḍalu dhārinī sevālamālikā ati
translated: In the tenth, the son of a smith: the son of a goldsmith. Whose, now: whose, now, are you?

original: sevālamālā viya dhārenti. Sevālapaṭanivāsitātipi vuttameva. Udakorohakāti sāyatatiyakaṃ
analyzed: viya dhārenti vuttam eva udakorohakā ati
translated: In the future: those who live in the future. Water-sippers: those who drink only water. Wearing plaited hair: they wear plaited hair like a garland. They are also said to wear plaited hair as a cloak.🔽Dwellers in water: they are devoted to the practice of going into the water three times a day.

original: udakorohanānuyogamanuyuttā. Āmaseyyāsīti hatthena parimajjeyyāsi.
analyzed: udakorohana anuyogam anuyuttāḥ āmaseyyāsi iti hatthena parimajjeyyāsi
translated: Rub with the hand: you would rub with the hand.

original: 11. Jāṇussoṇisuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Discussion of Jānussoṇi Sutta

original: 177. Ekādasame upakappatūti pāpuṇātu. Ṭhāneti okāse. No aṭṭhāneti no anokāse. Nerayikānaṃ
analyzed: ekādasame upakappatu uti pāpuṇātu ṭhāne iti okāse no a ṭhāne iti no anokāse nerayikānam
translated: In the eleventh, may it come to pass: may it reach. In a place: in a space. Not in a place: not in a space.

original: āhāro nāma tattha nibbattanakammameva. Teneva hi te tattha yāpenti. Tiracchānayonikānaṃ
analyzed: āhāraḥ nāma tattha nibbattana kammam eva tena iva hi te tattha yāpenti tiracchānayonikānam
translated: Food is the kamma itself that generates them there. For they live on that there. But the animals’ food should be understood as grass, leaves, etc.,🔽humans’ as rice, curry, etc.,🔽gods’ as divine food, etc.,

original: pana tiṇapaṇṇādivasena āhāro veditabbo. Manussānaṃ odanakummāsādivasena, devānaṃ🔽sudhābhojanādivasena, pettivesayikānaṃ kheḷasiṅghāṇikādivasena. Yaṃ vā panassa ito🔽anuppavecchantīti yaṃ tassa mittādayo ito dadantā anupavesenti. Pettivesayikā eva
analyzed: pana tiṇa paṇṇa ādi vasena āhāraḥ veditabbaḥ manussānam odana kummāsa ādi vasena devānam  sudhā bhojana ādi vasena petti vesayikānam kheḷa siṅghāṇika ādi vasena yam vā panassa itas  anuppavecchanti iti yam tassa mitta ādayaḥ itas dadantāḥ anupavesenti pettivesayikāḥ eva
translated: ghosts’ as spittle and mucus.

original: hi paradattūpajīvino honti, na aññesaṃ parehi dinnaṃ upakappati. Dāyakopi anipphaloti🔽yaṃ sandhāya taṃ dānaṃ dinnaṃ, tassa upakappatu vā mā vā, dāyakena pana na sakkā
analyzed: hi para dattu upajīvino honti na aññesam parehi dinnam upakappati dāyakaḥ api anipphalaḥ ti  yam sandhāya tam dānam dinnam tassa upakappatu vā mā vā dāyakena pana na sakkā
translated: Or whatever is sent to them from here: whatever their friends, etc., send to them from here. For only ghosts live on what is given by others. What is given by others does not benefit anyone else.

original: nipphalena bhavituṃ, dāyako tassa dānassa vipākaṃ labhatiyeva.
analyzed: nipphalena bhavitum dāyako tassa dānassa vipākam labhatiyā iva
translated: The giver is not without reward: whether or not what is given benefits the person for whose use it was given, the giver is not without reward, for the giver obtains the result of the giving.

original: Aṭṭhānepi bhavaṃ gotamo parikappaṃ vadatīti anokāse uppannepi tasmiṃ ñātake bhavaṃ
analyzed: aṭṭhāne api bhavam gotamaḥ parikappam vadati iti anokāse uppanne pi tasmin ñātake bhavam
translated: “Even in the case of an unworthy person, Master Gotama speaks in praise of giving”: when such a relative has died and been reborn in a state of loss, etc.,

original: gotamo dānassa phalaṃ parikappetiyeva paññāpetiyevāti pucchati. Brāhmaṇassa hi “evaṃ
analyzed: gotamaḥ dānassa phalam parikappetiya iva paññāpetiya iva ati pucchati brāhmaṇassa hi evam
translated: “Does Gotama praise the fruit of giving, does he proclaim it?” He asks whether the brahmin praises and proclaims the fruit of giving.

original: dinnassa dānassa phalaṃ dāyako na labhatī”ti laddhi. Athassa bhagavā pañhaṃ paṭijānitvā
analyzed: dinnassa dānassa phalam dāyakaḥ na labhati iti laddhi athassa bhagavā pañham paṭijānitvā
translated: He asks whether the Gotama approves of the fruit of giving. For the brahmin has the view that “the giver does not get the fruit of the gift given thus.” Then the Blessed One, having accepted the question,

original: “dāyako nāma yattha katthaci puññaphalūpajīviṭṭhāne nibbatto dānassa phalaṃ labhatiyevā”ti
analyzed: dāyakaḥ nāma yattha katthaci puñña phala upajīvi ṭhāne nibbattaḥ dānassa phalam labhati yeva ati
translated: said, “The giver gets the fruit of the gift wherever he is reborn in any place of rebirth where he can enjoy the fruit of merit,”

original: dassetuṃ idha brāhmaṇātiādimāha. So tattha lābhī hotīti so tattha hatthiyoniyaṃ nibbattopi
analyzed: dassetum idha brāhmaṇa ati ādim āha saḥ tattha lābhī hoti iti saḥ tattha hatthi yoniyam nibbattaḥ api
translated: and to show this he said, “Here, brahmin,” and so on. He is reborn there in the womb of an elephant,

original: maṅgalahatthiṭṭhānaṃ patvā lābhī hoti. Assādīsupi eseva nayo. Sādhuvaggo uttānatthoyevāti.
analyzed: maṅgala hatthi ṭṭhānam patvā lābhī hoti assa ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ sādhu vaggo
translated: and he gets the position of a royal tusker. The same method applies in the case of the horse, etc. The “Good” chapter is plain in meaning.

original: Jāṇussoṇivaggo dutiyo.
analyzed: jāṇussoṇi vaggaḥ dutiyaḥ
translated: The second sub-chapter on Jāṇussoṇi is finished.

original: Catutthapaṇṇāsakaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: catuttha paṇṇāsakam niṭṭhitam
translated: The fourth decade is finished.

original: (21) 1. Karajakāyavaggo
analyzed: karaja kāya vaggo
translated: The sub-chapter on the body made by kamma

original: 211. Pañcamassa paṭhamādīni uttānatthāneva.
analyzed: pañcamassa paṭhama ādīni uttāna tthānā eva
translated: The first, etc., of the fifth are plain in meaning.

original: 6. Saṃsappanīyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṃsappanīya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Saṃsappanīya Sutta

original: 216. Chaṭṭhe saṃsappanīyapariyāyaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammapariyāyanti saṃsappanassa

original: vigatantabhāvaṃ tesaṃ kammānaṃ paricchedaparivaṭumatākaraṇaṃ. Tañca kho diṭṭheva
analyzed: vigata anta bhāvam tesam kammānam pariccheda parivaṭuma tā karaṇam tat ca kho diṭṭhā iva
translated: “Without having experienced” means without having experienced the result of those kamma-s. “The exhaustion” means the exhaustion of the delimitation and the end of the continuity of those kamma-s. And that is done🔽in this very life.

original: dhammeti tañca kho vipākaṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ diṭṭheva dhamme. Upapajjanti upapajjavedanīyaṃ

translated: “Dhamma” is that kamma which has ripening to be experienced here and now, and that which has ripening to be experienced in the next birth.🔽“In this very life” means in the next existence.

original: anantare attabhāve. Apare vā pariyāyeti aparapariyāyavedanīyaṃ pana saṃsārappavatte🔽sati sahassimepi attabhāveti. Iminā idaṃ dasseti “saṃsārappavatte paṭiladdhavipākārahakamme
analyzed: anantare atta bhāve apare vā pariyāya iti apara pariyāya vedanīyam pana saṃsāra ppavatte  sati atta bhāve iti iminā idam dasseti saṃsāra ppavatte paṭiladdha vipāka āraha kamme
translated: “In some future life” means in the course of the round of rebirths.

original: na vijjati so jagatippadeso, yattha ṭhito mucceyya pāpakammā”ti. Tividhāti tippakārā.

original: Kāyakammantasandosabyāpattīti kāyakammantasaṅkhātā vipatti. Iminā nayena sabbapadāni
analyzed: kāya kammanta sandosa byāpatti iti kāya kammanta saṅkhātā vipatti iminā nayena sabba padāni
translated: “Misfortune of bodily action” is misfortune consisting in bodily action. In the same way with the rest.

original: veditabbāni. Aṭṭhame apaṇṇako maṇīti samantato caturasso pāsako.
analyzed: veditabbāni aṭṭhame apaṇṇakaḥ maṇi iti samantataḥ catur assaḥ pāsako
translated: “A trap” is a four-cornered snare.

original: 9. Karajakāyasuttavaṇṇanā🔽219. Navame dukkhassāti vipākadukkhassa, vaṭṭadukkhasseva vā. Imasmiṃ sutte maṇiopammaṃ

original: natthi. Evaṃ vigatābhijjhoti evanti nipātamattaṃ. Yathā vā mettaṃ bhāventā vigatābhijjhā🔽bhavanti, evaṃ vigatābhijjho. Evamassa vigatābhijjhatādīhi nīvaraṇavikkhambhanaṃ
analyzed: natthi evam vigata abhijjhaḥ ti evanti nipāta mattam yathā vā mettam bhāventā vigata abhijjhā  bhavanti evam vigata abhijjhaḥ evam assa vigata abhijjha tā ādīhi nīvaraṇa vikkhambhanam

original: dassetvā idāni akusalanissaraṇāni kathento mettāsahagatenātiādimāha. Appamāṇanti
analyzed: dassetvā idāni akusala nissaraṇāni kathentaḥ mettā sahagatena ati ādim āha appamāṇam ti
translated: There is none. Thus, free from ill will: thus is merely a particle. Or else, just as one who develops loving-kindness is free from ill will, so too he is free from ill will. Having thus shown the suppression of the hindrances by means of the phrases “free from ill will” and so on, he now said, “accompanied by the first jhāna” and so on, in order to show the escape from the unprofitable.

original: appamāṇasattārammaṇatāya ciṇṇavasitāya vā appamāṇaṃ. Pamāṇakataṃ kammaṃ nāma kāmāvacarakammaṃ.

translated: Measureless: either because of having immeasurable beings as object or because of having mastered the measureless. Limited action is sense-sphere action.

original: Na taṃ tatrāvatiṭṭhatīti taṃ mahogho parittaṃ udakaṃ viya attano okāsaṃ gahetvā ṭhātuṃ

original: na sakkoti, atha kho naṃ oghe parittaṃ udakaṃ viya idameva appamāṇaṃ kammaṃ ajjhottharitvā

translated: But rather, like a limited quantity of water in a flood, it is overwhelmed by this very measureless action and produces its own result.

original: attano vipākaṃ nibbatteti. Daharataggeti daharakālato paṭṭhāya.
analyzed: attanaḥ vipākam nibbattā iti daharataggā iti dahara kālataḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: From the time of his youth: from the time of his youth onwards.

translated: is said to be “to be experienced here.”

analyzed: bhavissati idam sotāpanna sakadāgāmi ariya puggalānam paccavekkhaṇam veditabbam anāgāmi tāya ati  jhāna anāgāmitāya idhapaññassa ati imasmin sāsane paññā idhapaññā nāma sāsana caritāya

original: ariyapaññāya ṭhitassa ariyasāvakassāti attho. Uttarivimuttinti arahattaṃ. Dasamaṃ uttānatthamevāti.

original: Manorathapūraṇiyā aṅguttaranikāya-aṭṭhakathāya

analyzed: nissaya vaggaḥ

original: 1-6. Ekādasakanipātassa paṭhamādīni heṭṭhā vuttanayāneva. Kevalañcettha ādito pañcasu nibbidāvirāgaṃ dvidhā bhinditvā ekādasaṅgāni katāni. Chaṭṭhe sikkhāpaccakkhānaṃ adhikaṃ.
analyzed: ekādasaka nipātassa paṭhama ādīni heṭṭhā vutta nayāni eva kevalam ca ittha āditaḥ pañcasu nibbidā virāgam dvidhā bhinditvā katāni chaṭṭhe sikkhā paccakkhānam adhikam

original: 7-8. Sattame atthena atthoti atthena saddhimattho. Byañjanena byañjananti byañjanena
analyzed: sattame atthena attho ti atthena saddhim attho byañjanena byañjananti byañjanena
translated: In the seventh, “meaning with meaning” is meaning together with meaning. “Phrase with phrase” is phrase with

original: saddhiṃ byañjanaṃ. Saṃsandissatīti sampavattissati. Samessatīti samānaṃ bhavissati.
analyzed: saddhim byañjanam saṃsandissati iti sampavattissati samessati iti samānam bhavissati
translated: Together with the phrasing. Will come together: will occur. Will meet: will be the same.

original: Na viggayhissatīti na virajjhissati. Aggapadasminti nibbāne. Aṭṭhame paccavekkhaṇā kathitā.
analyzed: na viggayhissati iti na virajjhissati agga padasmin ti nibbāne aṭṭhame paccavekkhaṇā kathitā
translated: Will not be disunited: will not be dispassionate. In the foremost position: in Nibbāna. The eighth reflection is stated.

original: 9. Saddhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: saddha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the Saddha Sutta

original: 9. Navame doṇiyā baddhoti yavasassadoṇiyā samīpe baddho. Antaraṃ karitvāti abbhantare🔽katvā. Jhāyatīti cinteti. Pajjhāyatīti ito cito ca nānappakārakaṃ jhāyati. Nijjhāyatīti
analyzed: navame doṇiyā baddhaḥ ti yava sassa doṇiyā samīpe baddhaḥ antaram karitvā iti abbhantare  katvā jhāyati iti cinteti pajjhāyati iti itas citas ca nānappakārakam jhāyati nijjhāyati iti
translated: In the ninth sutta, “tethered by the manger” means tethered near the manger for barley and rice. Having made room: having made room

original: nirantaravasena nibaddhaṃ jhāyati. Pathavimpi nissāya jhāyatīti samāpattiyaṃ sanikantikavasenetaṃ
analyzed: nirantara vasena nibaddham jhāyati pathavimpi nissāya jhāyati iti samāpattiyam sa nikantika vasena itaṃ
translated: inside. He meditates: he thinks. He meditates upon: he meditates in various ways here and there. He meditates upon himself: he meditates continuously. He meditates depending on the earth: this is said with reference to the proximity of the earth in the attainment.

original: vuttaṃ. Samāpattiyañhi sanikantikattā esa khaḷuṅko nāma kato. Āpādīsupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: vuttam samāpattiyam hi esa khaḷuṅkaḥ nāma kataḥ āpa ādīsu pi esā iva nayaḥ
translated: For this ass is called “proximate” because of his proximity in the attainment. The same method applies to the other elements.

original: Kathañca saddha ājānīyajhāyitaṃ hotīti kathaṃ kāraṇākāraṇaṃ jānantassa sindhavassa
analyzed: katham ca saddhaḥ ājānīya jhāyitam hoti iti katham kāraṇa akāraṇam jānantassa sindhavassa
translated: How does the meditation of the thoroughbred horse with faith come about?

original: jhāyitaṃ hoti. Yathā iṇantiādīsu iṇasadisaṃ bandhanasadisaṃ dhanajānisadisaṃ kalisaṅkhātamahāparādhasadisañca
analyzed: yathā iṇa nti ādīsu iṇa sadisam bandhana sadisam dhana jāni sadisam kali saṅkhāta mahā aparādha sadisam ca

analyzed: katvā attanaḥ abhimukhassa patodassa ajjhoharaṇa saṅkhātam patanam vipassati iti attho  na iva pathavim nissāya jhāyati iti samāpatti sukha nikantiyāḥ abhāvena pathavi ārammaṇāya
translated: He meditates. original: catukkapañcakajjhānasaññāya na jhāyati, niyantiyā abhāveneva so ājānīyo nāma hotīti.🔽Jhāyati ca panāti nibbānārammaṇāya phalasamāpattiyā jhāyati. Pathaviyaṃ pathavisaññā
analyzed: catukka pañcaka jhāna saññāya na jhāyati niyantiyāḥ abhāvena iva saḥ ājānīyaḥ nāma hoti iti  jhāyati ca pana ati nibbāna ārammaṇāya phala samāpattiyā jhāyati pathaviyam pathavi saññā
translated: And because he has no desire for the earth he is called a thoroughbred.🔽He meditates: he meditates on the fruition attainment with Nibbāna as object.

original: vibhūtā hotīti pathavārammaṇe uppannā catukkapañcakajjhānasaññā vibhūtā pākaṭā hoti.
analyzed: vibhūtā hoti iti pathavā ārammaṇe uppannā catukka pañcaka jjhāna saññā vibhūtā pākaṭā hoti
translated: The perception of earth in regard to earth is abandoned: the perception of the fourfold and fivefold jhānas arisen with the earth as object is abandoned, is evident.

original: “Vibhūtā, bhante, rūpasaññā avibhūtā aṭṭhikasaññā”ti imasmiñhi sutte samatikkamassa
analyzed: vibhūtā bhante rūpa saññā avibhūtā aṭṭhika saññā ti imasmin hi sutte samatikkamassa
translated: “The perception of materiality is abandoned in me, venerable sir, but the perception of bones is not yet abandoned” . Here the abandoning is said because of the presence of surmounting.

original: atthitāya vibhūtatā vuttā, idha pana vipassanāvasena aniccadukkhānattato diṭṭhattā
analyzed: atthitāya vibhūta tā vuttā idha pana vipassanā vasena anicca dukkha ānattataḥ diṭṭhattā
translated: But here it is said because of seeing with insight the impermanence, suffering, and not-self nature of the earth as object.

original: vibhūtā nāma jātā. Āposaññādīsupi eseva nayo. Evamettha heṭṭhā viya samāpattivasena🔽samatikkamaṃ avatvā vipassanācāravasena samatikkamo vutto. Evaṃ jhāyīti evaṃ vipassanāpaṭipāṭiyā
analyzed: vibhūtāḥ nāma jātāḥ āposaññā ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ evam ettha heṭṭhā viya samāpatti vasena  samatikkamam avatvā vipassanā ācāra vasena samatikkamaḥ vuttaḥ evam jhāyī iti evam vipassanā paṭipāṭiyā

original: āgantvā uppāditāya phalasamāpattiyā jhāyanto.
analyzed: āgantvā uppāditāya phala samāpattiyā jhāyantaḥ
translated: “One who is thus a meditator”: one who is thus a meditator on the fruition attainment that has arisen by way of the succession of insight.

original: 10. Moranivāpasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Moranivāpa Sutta is finished.

original: 10. Dasame accantaniṭṭhoti antaṃ atītattā accantasaṅkhātaṃ avināsadhammaṃ nibbānaṃ
analyzed: dasame accanta niṭṭhaḥ ti antam atīta ttā accanta saṅkhātam avināsa dhammam nibbānam
translated: In the tenth, “one who has gone to the end of the world” is one who has gone to the end called nibbāna, which is the state of non-perishing, because he has gone to the end of the world.🔽The rest of the terms should be understood in the same way.🔽“In the world” means in the world that has been generated.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.

original: niṭṭhā assāti accantaniṭṭho. Iminā nayena sesapadāni veditabbāni. Janetasminti janitasmiṃ,🔽pajāyāti attho. Ye gottapaṭisārinoti ye janā tasmiṃ gotte paṭisaranti “ahaṃ gotamo,
analyzed: niṭṭhā assa ati accanta niṭṭhaḥ iminā nayena sesa padāni veditabbāni janetasmin ti janitasmin  pajāyā ati attho ye gotta paṭisārino ti ye janā tasmin gotte paṭisaranti aham gotamaḥ
translated: “In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.

original: ahaṃ kassapo”ti, tesu loke gottapaṭisārīsu khattiyo seṭṭho. Anumatā mayāti mama sabbaññutaññāṇena
analyzed: aham kassapa iti tesu loke gotta paṭisārīsu khattiyaḥ seṭṭhaḥ anumatā mayā ati mama sabbaññuta ññāṇena
translated: “In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.🔽“In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.

original: saddhiṃ saṃsandetvā desitā mayā anuññātā. Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānatthamevāti.
analyzed: saddhim saṃsandetvā desitā mayā anuññātā sesam sabbattha uttāna attham eva ati
translated: “In the world that has been generated” means in the world that has arisen.

original: Nissayavaggo paṭhamo.🔽2. Anussativaggo
analyzed: nissaya vaggaḥ paṭhamaḥ  anussati vaggaḥ
translated: The first sub-chapter on dependence is finished.🔽The sub-chapter on recollection

original: 1-2. Mahānāmasuttadvayavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the two Mahānāma Sutta

original: 11-12. Dutiyassa paṭhame nānāvihārehi viharatanti gihīnaṃ nibaddho eko vihāro nāma
analyzed: dutiyassa paṭhame nānā vihārehi gihīnam nibaddhaḥ ekaḥ vihāraḥ nāma
translated: In the first of the second , “dwells in different dwellings”: householders have no fixed dwelling place.

original: natthi, tasmā amhākaṃ anibaddhavihārena viharantānaṃ kena vihārena katarena nibaddhavihārena🔽vihātabbanti pucchati. Ārādhakoti sampādako paripūrako. Dhammasotasamāpanno buddhānussatiṃ🔽bhāvetīti dhammasotasamāpanno hutvā buddhānussatiṃ bhāveti. Dutiye gilānā vuṭṭhitoti
analyzed: natthi tasmai amhākam a nibaddha vihārena viharantānam kena vihārena katarena nibaddha vihārena  vihātabbanti pucchati ārādhako ti sampādako paripūrako dhamma sota samāpanno buddha anussatim  bhāveti iti dhamma sota samāpannaḥ hutvā buddha anussatim bhāveti dutiye gilānā vuṭṭhito ti
translated: Therefore he asks, “In which dwelling place should we dwell who dwell in an unfixed dwelling place?”🔽“One who has fulfilled” : one who has accomplished, who has completed. “One who has entered upon the stream of the Dhamma” : having entered upon the stream of the Dhamma, he develops the recollection of the Buddha.

original: gilāno hutvā vuṭṭhito.
analyzed: gilānaḥ hutvā vuṭṭhitaḥ
translated: In the second , “one who has recovered from his sickness” : having been sick, he has recovered.

original: 3. Nandiyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nandiya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Nandiya Sutta

original: 13. Tatiye kalyāṇamitteti sumitte. Evamettha kalyāṇamittavasena saṅghānussati kathitā.
analyzed: tatiye kalyāṇa mittā iti sumitte evam ettha kalyāṇa mitta vasena saṅgha anussati kathitā
translated: In the third , “good friends” : good companions. Thus here the recollection of the Community is stated in terms of good friends.

original: Kabaḷīkārāhārabhakkhānanti kāmāvacaradevānaṃ. Asamayavimuttoti asamayavimuttiyā vimutto khīṇāsavo.
analyzed: kabaḷīkāra āhāra bhakkhānam ti kāmāvacara devānam asamaya vimuttaḥ ti asamaya vimuttiyā vimuttaḥ khīṇa āsavaḥ
translated: “Those who feed on physical food” : the sense-sphere gods. “One who is liberated at the proper time” : one who is liberated by the liberation at the proper time, one who is an arahat.

original: 4. Subhūtisuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Subhuti Sutta

original: 14. Catutthe ko nāmāyaṃ subhūtī bhikkhūti jānantopi satthā kathāsamuṭṭhāpanatthaṃ
analyzed: catutthe kaḥ nāma ayam subhūtī bhikkhū iti jānantaḥ api satthā kathā samuṭṭhāpana ttham
translated: In the fourth , although the Teacher knew the name of the bhikkhu, he asked, “What is the name of this bhikkhu?” in order to provide an occasion for a discourse.

original: pucchati. Sudattassa upāsakassa puttoti anāthapiṇḍikaṃ sandhāyāha. Anāthapiṇḍikassa
analyzed: pucchati sudattassa upāsakassa putto ti anāthapiṇḍikam sandhāya āha anāthapiṇḍikassa
translated: The reply, “He is the son of the lay devotee Sudatta,” refers to Anāthapiṇḍika.

original: hi putto attano cūḷapitu santike pabbajito, atha naṃ subhūtitthero ādāya satthu santikaṃ🔽agamāsi. Saddhāpadānesūti saddhānaṃ puggalānaṃ apadānesu lakkhaṇesu.
analyzed: hi puttaḥ attanaḥ cūḷapitu santike pabbajitaḥ atha nam subhūti theraḥ ādāya satthu santikam  agamāsi saddha apadānesu iti saddhānam puggalānam apadānesu lakkhaṇesu
translated: For Anāthapiṇḍika’s son had gone forth under his uncle, and the elder Subhūti had brought him to the Teacher.

original: 5. Mettasuttavaṇṇanā🔽15. Pañcame sukhaṃ supatīti yathā sesajanā samparivattamānā kākacchamānā dukkhaṃ🔽supanti, evaṃ asupitvā sukhaṃ supati. Niddaṃ okkamantopi samāpattiṃ samāpanno viya🔽hoti. Sukhaṃ paṭibujjhatīti yathā aññe nitthunantā vijambhamānā samparivattantā dukkhaṃ🔽paṭibujjhanti, evaṃ appaṭibujjhitvā vikasamānaṃ viya padumaṃ sukhaṃ nibbikāro paṭibujjhati.
analyzed: 🔽pañcame sukham supati iti yathā sesa janā samparivattamānā kākacchamānā dukkham 🔽supanti evam a supitvā sukham supati niddam okkamantaḥ api samāpattim samāpannaḥ viya 🔽hoti sukham paṭibujjhati iti yathā aññe nitthunantā vijambhamānā samparivattantā dukkham 🔽paṭibujjhanti evam a paṭibujjhitvā vikasamānam viya padumam sukham nibbikāraḥ paṭibujjhati
translated: “In the characteristics of those who have faith”: in the characteristics of faithful persons.

original: Na pāpakaṃ supinaṃ passatīti supinaṃ passantopi bhaddakameva supinaṃ passati, cetiyaṃ🔽vandanto viya pūjaṃ karonto viya ca dhammaṃ suṇanto viya ca hoti. Yathā panaññe attānaṃ🔽corehi samparivāritaṃ viya vāḷehi upaddutaṃ viya papāte patantaṃ viya ca passanti,
analyzed: na pāpakam supinam passati iti supinam passantaḥ api bhaddakam eva supinam passati cetiyam  vandantaḥ viya pūjam karontaḥ viya ca dhammam suṇantaḥ viya ca hoti yathā panaññe attānam  corehi samparivāritam viya vāḷehi upaddutam viya papāte patantam viya ca passanti
translated: He does not see any evil dream. Even when he sees a dream, he sees only a good dream, as if worshipping a shrine, as if making offerings, as if listening to the Dhamma. But others see themselves surrounded by thieves, attacked by wild beasts, falling into ravines,

original: na evaṃ pāpakaṃ supinaṃ passati.
analyzed: na evam pāpakam supinam passati
translated: He does not see evil dreams: even when he sees dreams, he sees only auspicious dreams, as if worshipping a shrine, as if making offerings, as if listening to the Dhamma. But others see themselves surrounded by thieves, attacked by wild beasts, falling into ravines, and so on. He does not see such evil dreams.

original: Manussānaṃ piyo hotīti ure āmukkamuttāhāro viya sīse piḷandhitamālā viya ca manussānaṃ🔽piyo hoti manāpo. Amanussānaṃ piyo hotīti yatheva manussānaṃ, amanussānampi piyo
analyzed: manussānam piyaḥ hoti iti sīse piḷandhita mālā viya ca manussānam  piyaḥ hoti manāpaḥ amanussānam piyaḥ hoti iti yathā iva manussānam amanussānam piyaḥ
translated: He is dear to human beings: he is dear and agreeable to human beings as if he were their bosom-born son or as if he were a garland of choice flowers placed on his head.

original: hoti visākhatthero viya. Vatthu visuddhimagge mettākammaṭṭhānaniddese vitthāritameva.
analyzed: hoti visākha theraḥ viya vatthu visuddhi magge mettā kammaṭṭhāna niddese vitthāritam eva
translated: He is dear to non-human beings: as he is to human beings, so he is also to non-human beings, as was the Elder Visākha. The story is related in the Visuddhimagga in the description of the meditation subject of loving-kindness .

original: Devatā rakkhantīti puttamiva mātāpitaro devatā rakkhanti. Nāssa aggi vā visaṃ vā
analyzed: devatāḥ rakkhanti iti puttam iva mātā pitaraḥ devatāḥ rakkhanti na assa aggi vā visam vā
translated: Deities guard him: deities guard him as a mother and father guard their little son.

original: satthaṃ vā kamatīti mettāvihārissa kāye uttarāya upāsikāya viya aggi vā, saṃyuttabhāṇakacūḷasīvattherasseva
analyzed: sattham vā kamati iti mettāvihārissa kāye uttarāya upāsikāya vā saṃyuttabhāṇaka cūḷasīva therassa iva
translated: He does not come to harm by a weapon: the heart’s core of one who abides in loving-kindness is not pierced by a weapon, as the laywoman Uttarā’s was not,

original: visaṃ vā, saṃkiccasāmaṇerasseva satthaṃ vā na kamati nappavisati, nāssa kāyaṃ vikopetīti🔽vuttaṃ hoti. Dhenuvatthumpi cettha kathayanti. Ekā kira dhenu vacchakassa khīradhāraṃ🔽muñcamānā aṭṭhāsi. Eko luddako “taṃ vijjhissāmī”ti hatthena samparivattetvā dīghadaṇḍaṃ
analyzed: visam vā saṃkicca sāmaṇerassa iva sattham vā na kamati na pavisati na assa kāyam vikopeti iti  vuttam hoti dhenu vatthum pi ca ittha kathayanti ekā kira dhenu vacchakassa khīra dhāram  muñcamānā aṭṭhāsi ekaḥ luddako tam vijjhissāmi iti hatthena samparivattetvā dīgha daṇḍam
translated: or by poison, as the teacher Saṃkicca’s pupil Cūḷa-Sīva’s was not, or by a weapon, as the novice Saṅkicca’s was not. It does not enter his body and violate it, is what is meant.

original: sattiṃ muñci. Sā tassā sarīraṃ āhacca tālapaṇṇaṃ viya vaṭṭamānā gatā, neva upacārabalena🔽na appanābalena, kevalaṃ vacchake balavahitacittatāya. Evaṃ mahānubhāvā mettā.
analyzed: sattim sā tassā sarīram tāla paṇṇam viya vaṭṭamānā gatā na iva upacāra balena  na appanā balena kevalam vacchake balava hita citta tāya evam mahā anubhāvā mettā
translated: And here they tell a story about a cow. A cow, it seems, stood giving milk to a calf. A hunter, thinking “I shall shoot her,” turned his hand and released an arrow with a long shaft. It struck her body and went away, rolling like a palm leaf, not by the power of access concentration,🔽nor by the power of absorption, but just by the strength of the calf’s mind being occupied with its powerful mother. So powerful is loving-kindness.

original: Tuvaṭaṃ cittaṃ samādhiyatīti mettāvihārino khippameva cittaṃ samādhiyati, natthi
analyzed: tuvaṭam cittam samādhiyati iti mettā vihārino khippam eva cittam samādhiyati natthi
translated: His mind is easily concentrated: the mind of one who abides in loving-kindness is quickly concentrated.

original: tassa dandhāyitattaṃ. Mukhavaṇṇo vippasīdatīti bandhanā pavuttatālapakkaṃ viya cassa
analyzed: tassa dandhāyi tattam mukha vaṇṇaḥ vippasīdati iti bandhanā pavutta tālapakkam viya ca assa
translated: His face is serene. His face is serene like a ripe palm fruit that has fallen from its stalk.

original: vippasannavaṇṇaṃ mukhaṃ hoti. Asammūḷho kālaṃ karotīti mettāvihārino sammohamaraṇaṃ🔽nāma natthi, asammūḷho pana niddaṃ okkamanto viya kālaṃ karoti. Uttari appaṭivijjhantoti🔽mettāsamāpattito uttari arahattaṃ adhigantuṃ asakkonto ito cavitvā suttappabuddho
analyzed: vippasanna vaṇṇam mukham hoti asammūḷhaḥ kālam karoti iti mettā vihārino sammoha maraṇaṃ  nāma natthi asammūḷhaḥ pana niddam okkamantaḥ viya kālam karoti uttari a paṭivijjhanto ti  mettā samāpattitaḥ uttari arahattam adhigantum a sakkontaḥ itas cavitvā sutta ppabuddhaḥ
translated: He dies undeluded. There is no such thing as a death of one who cultivates loving-kindness in a deluded state. But he dies as undeluded as a man who is going to sleep.

original: viya brahmalokaṃ upapajjatīti.
analyzed: viya brahma lokam upapajjati iti
translated: Failing to penetrate still further: failing to reach the further stage of Arahantship beyond the attainment of loving-kindness. Passing away from here, he is reborn in the Brahmā-world like one who has awakened from his sleep.

original: 6. Aṭṭhakanāgarasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aṭṭhaka nāgara sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discussion of the Discourse on the Elder Aṭṭhakanāga

original: 16. Chaṭṭhe dasamoti jātigottavasena ceva sārapattakulagaṇanāya ca dasame ṭhāne gaṇīyati,
analyzed: chaṭṭhe dasamaḥ ti jāti gotta vasena ca iva sāra patta kula gaṇanāya ca dasame ṭhāne
translated: The sixth: he is reckoned as the sixth in the order of birth and clan and in the order of the number of the clans that had attained the fruit of stream-entry.

original: tenassa dasamotveva nāmaṃ jātaṃ. Aṭṭhakanāgaroti aṭṭhakanagaravāsī. Kukkuṭārāmeti
analyzed: tena assa dasamaḥ tu eva nāmam jātam aṭṭhakanāgaro ti aṭṭhaka nagara vāsī kukkuṭārāma iti
translated: Therefore he came to be called the Elder Dasaka. Aṭṭhakanāga: the dweller in the city of Aṭṭha. Kukkuṭārāma:

original: kukkuṭaseṭṭhinā kārite ārāme.
analyzed: kukkuṭaseṭṭhinā kārite ārāme
translated: in the monastery built by the merchant Kukkuṭa.

original: Tena bhagavatā…pe… sammadakkhātoti ettha ayaṃ saṅkhepattho – yo so bhagavā samatiṃsa
analyzed: tena bhagavatā āpe sammat akkhātaḥ ti ettha ayam saṅkhepa atthaḥ yaḥ saḥ bhagavā samatiṃsa
translated: By the Blessed One: the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, is what is meant. The Dhamma: the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its own meaning and phrasing, and which reveals the spiritual life that is utterly perfect and pure.

original: pāramiyo pūretvā sabbakilese bhañjitvā anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho, tena🔽bhagavatā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ āsayānusayaṃ jānatā, hatthatale ṭhapitaṃ āmalakaṃ
analyzed: pāramiyaḥ pūretvā sabba kilese bhañjitvā anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambuddhaḥ tena  bhagavatā tesam tesam sattānam āsaya anusayam jānatā hattha tale ṭhapitam āmalakam
translated: having fulfilled the Perfections, having crushed all the Defilements, he was Enlightened in the supreme and complete Enlightenment, by that🔽Blessed One, who knew the inclinations and latent tendencies of beings, who saw all knowable things

original: viya sabbañeyyadhamme passatā, apica pubbenivāsādīhi jānatā, dibbena cakkhunā passatā,
analyzed: viya sabba ñeyya dhamme passatā apica pubbenivāsa ādīhi jānatā dibbena cakkhunā passatā
translated: as if they were an āmalaka fruit in the palm of his hand, who knew by means of the knowledge of his previous lives, and saw by means of the divine eye,

original: tīhi vā vijjāhi chahi vā pana abhiññāhi jānatā, sabbattha appaṭihatena samantacakkhunā🔽passatā, sabbadhammajānanasamatthāya paññāya jānatā, sabbasattānaṃ cakkhuvisayātītāni
analyzed: tīhi vā vijjāhi chahi vā pana abhiññāhi jānatā sabbattha a paṭihatena samanta cakkhunā  passatā sabba dhamma jānana samatthāya paññāya jānatā sabba sattānam cakkhu visaya atītāni
translated: who knew by means of the three knowledges, or by means of the six kinds of direct knowledge, who saw by means of the all-seeing eye, which is unobstructed in all things,🔽who knew by means of the wisdom that is able to know all things, who saw by means of the fleshly eye, which is purified and surpasses the divine eye,

original: tirokuṭṭādigatāni cāpi rūpāni ativisuddhena maṃsacakkhunā vā passatā, attahitasādhikāya
analyzed: tirokuṭṭa ādi gatāni ca api rūpāni ati visuddhena maṃsa cakkhunā vā passatā atta hita sādhikāya
translated: the forms of all beings, which are beyond the range of the eye, and which are behind walls, etc., who knew by means of the penetrating wisdom, which is the basis for concentration, and which brings about one’s own welfare,

original: samādhipadaṭṭhānāya paṭivedhapaññāya jānatā, parahitasādhikāya karuṇāpadaṭṭhānāya
analyzed: samādhi pada ṭṭhānāya paṭivedha paññāya jānatā para hita sādhikāya karuṇā pada ṭṭhānāya
translated: who saw by means of the wisdom of teaching, which is the basis for compassion, and which brings about the welfare of others, who knew the hindrances,

original: desanāpaññāya passatā, antarāyikadhamme vā jānatā, niyyānikadhamme passatā, arīnaṃ
analyzed: desanā paññāya passatā antarāyika dhamme vā jānatā niyyānika dhamme passatā arīnaṃ
translated: or who saw the way out.

original: hatattā arahatā, sammā sāmaṃ sabbadhammānaṃ buddhattā sammāsambuddhenāti evaṃ catuvesārajjavasena🔽catūhi kāraṇehi thomitena atthi nu kho eko dhammo akkhātoti.🔽Abhisaṅkhatanti kataṃ uppāditaṃ. Abhisañcetayitanti cetayitaṃ kappayitaṃ. So tattha
analyzed: hata ttā arahatā sammā sāmam sabba dhammānam buddha ttā sammāsambuddhena ati evam catu vesārajja vasena  catūhi kāraṇehi thomitena atthi nu kho ekaḥ dhammo akkhāto ti  katam uppāditam abhisañcetayitanti cetayitam kappayitam saḥ tattha
translated: He is a Worthy One because he has destroyed, a Rightly Self-awakened One because he has rightly and by himself fully awakened to all things.🔽So it is by means of the four grounds for self-confidence that he is called ‘the Blessed One’ in the sense of ‘he who is praised by the world with its deities, its Brahmas, and its ascetics and Brahmins, by the world with its princes and men, and by deities and men.’

original: ṭhitoti so tasmiṃ samathavipassanādhamme ṭhito. Dhammarāgena dhammanandiyāti padadvayenapi🔽samathavipassanāsu chandarāgo vutto. Samathavipassanāsu hi sabbena sabbaṃ chandarāgaṃ
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ iti saḥ tasmin samatha vipassanā dhamme ṭhitaḥ dhamma rāgena dhamma nandiyā ati pada dvayena api  samatha vipassanāsu chanda rāgaḥ vuttaḥ samatha vipassanāsu hi sabbena sabbam chanda rāgam
translated: ‘ Intentionally’ : made, produced. ‘ Purposely’ : intended, planned. ‘ Standing there’ : standing in that state of serenity and insight. ‘ With lust for the Dhamma, delighting in the Dhamma’ : by means of the two terms ‘ lust for the Dhamma’ and ‘ delighting in the Dhamma’🔽he shows lust and desire for serenity and insight.

original: pariyādiyituṃ sakkonto arahā hoti, asakkonto anāgāmī hoti. So samathavipassanāsu
analyzed: pariyādiyitum sakkontaḥ arahā hoti a sakkontaḥ anāgāmī hoti so samatha vipassanāsu
translated: For when one is able to abandon lust and desire for serenity and insight in all aspects, he becomes an Arahant; when he is unable to do so, he becomes a Non-returner.

original: chandarāgassa appahīnattā catutthajjhānacetanāya suddhāvāse nibbattati. Ayaṃ ācariyānaṃ samānatthakathā.
analyzed: chanda rāgassa appahīna ttā catuttha jhāna cetanāya suddhāvāse nibbattati ayam ācariyānam samāna attha kathā
translated: Since he has not abandoned lust and desire for serenity and insight, he is reborn in the Pure Abodes by the volition of the fourth jhana. This is the teachers’ explanation of the same meaning.

original: Vitaṇḍavādī panāha – “teneva dhammarāgenāti vacanato akusalena suddhāvāse nibbattatī”ti.
analyzed: vitaṇḍa vādī pana āha tena iva dhamma rāgena ati vacanataḥ akusalena suddhāvāse nibbattati iti
translated: But the one who argues says that he is reborn in the Pure Abodes by the unwholesome root of lust, because of the words ‘ with lust for the Dhamma’ .

original: So “suttaṃ āharāhī”ti vattabbo. Addhā aññaṃ apassanto idameva āharissati. Tato vattabbo
analyzed: saḥ suttam āharāhi iti vattabbaḥ addhā aññam a passantaḥ idam eva āharissati tatas vattabbaḥ
translated: He should be asked, “Please quote the text.” He will certainly quote this very sutta, not seeing any other. Then he should be asked,

original: “kimpanidaṃ suttaṃ nītatthaṃ, udāhu neyyattha”nti. Addhā “nītattha”nti vakkhati.
analyzed: kim panidam suttam nīta attham udāhu neyyatthanti addhā nīta atthanti vakkhati
translated: “But is this sutta of definite or indefinite meaning?” He will certainly say, “Of definite meaning.”

original: Tato vattabbo – evaṃ sante anāgāmiphalatthikena samathavipassanāsu chandarāgo kattabbo🔽bhavissati, chandarāge uppādite anāgāmiphalaṃ paṭiladdhaṃ bhavissati, mā “suttaṃ
analyzed: tatas vattabbo evam sante anāgāmi phala tthikena samatha vipassanāsu chanda rāgaḥ kattabbo  bhavissati chanda rāge uppādite anāgāmi phalam paṭiladdham bhavissati mā suttam
translated: Then he should be asked, “If that is so, then one who seeks the fruit of non-returner will have to arouse desire and lust for serenity and insight,🔽and when desire and lust have arisen, he will have attained the fruit of non-returner. So please explain what you mean by ‘I have got the text.’

original: me laddha”nti yaṃ vā taṃ vā dīpehi. Pañhaṃ kathentena hi ācariyassa santike uggahetvā🔽attharasaṃ paṭivijjhitvā kathetuṃ vaṭṭati. Akusalena hi sagge, kusalena ca apāye🔽paṭisandhi nāma natthi. Vuttañcetaṃ bhagavatā –
analyzed: me laddhanti yam vā tam vā dīpehi pañham kathentena hi ācariyassa santike uggahetvā  attha rasam paṭivijjhitvā kathetum vaṭṭati akusalena hi sagge kusalena ca apāye  paṭisandhi nāma natthi vuttam ca itam bhagavatā
translated: For when one answers a question, it is proper to answer it after having learned it from the teacher and after having examined it.🔽For there is no rebirth-linking in the happy destinies by means of unwholesome kamma or in the unhappy destinies by means of wholesome kamma. And this has been said by the Blessed One:

original: “Na, bhikkhave, lobhajena kammena, dosajena kammena, mohajena kammena devā paññāyanti,
analyzed: na bhikkhave lobha jena kammena dosa jena kammena moha jena kammena devā paññāyanti
translated: “Bhikkhus, it is not possible to point to any one realm of beings and say: ‘They are only happy, never unhappy,’ or ‘They are only unhappy, never happy.’

original: manussā paññāyanti, yā vā panaññāpi kāci sugatiyo. Atha kho, bhikkhave, lobhajena
analyzed: manussā paññāyanti yā vā pana aññā api kāci sugatiyaḥ atha kho bhikkhave lobha jena
translated: and the good destinations are known.

original: kammena, dosajena kammena, mohajena kammena nirayo paññāyati, tiracchānayoni paññāyati,
analyzed: kammena dosa jena kammena moha jena kammena nirayaḥ paññāyati tiracchāna yoni paññāyati
translated: But when there is kamma born of greed, kamma born of hate, and kamma born of delusion, then hell is known, the animal realm is known,

original: pettivisayo paññāyati, yā vā panaññāpi kāci duggatiyo”ti –
analyzed: petti visayo paññāyati yā vā panaññā api kāci duggatiyā ti
translated: the ghost realm is known, and the other bad destinations are known.”

original: Evaṃ saññāpetabbo. Sace sañjānāti, sañjānātu. No ce sañjānāti, “gaccha pātova vihāraṃ pavisitvā yāguṃ pivā”ti uyyojetabbo.🔽Ayaṃ kho, gahapati, ekadhammo akkhātoti ekaṃ dhammaṃ pucchitena “ayampi ekadhammo
analyzed: evam saññāpetabbo sace sañjānāti sañjānātu no ce sañjānāti gaccha pātova vihāram pavisitvā yāgum pivāti uyyojetabbo  ayam kho gahapati eka dhammo akkhāto ti ekam dhammam pucchitena ayam pi eka dhammo
translated: If he understands, let him understand. If not, he should be dismissed, saying, “Go in the morning to the monastery and drink rice porridge.”

original: akkhāto, ayampi ekadhammo akkhāto”ti evaṃ pucchāvasena kathitattā ekādasapi dhammā
analyzed: akkhātaḥ ayam pi eka dhammo akkhātaḥ ti evam pucchā vasena kathita ttā ekādasa api dhammā
translated: “This one quality is taught”: the questioner asked about one quality, and the answerer explained it by way of questions, saying, “This one quality is taught, this one quality is taught.” Thus eleven qualities are treated as one.

original: ekadhammo nāma kato. Amatuppattiatthena vā sabbepi ekadhammoti vattuṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: eka dhammo nāma kataḥ amata uppatti atthena vā sabbe pi eka dhammo ti vattum vaṭṭati
translated: Or all of them can be treated as one in the sense of leading to the deathless.

original: Nidhimukhaṃ gavesantoti nidhiṃ pariyesanto. Sakidevāti ekappayogeneva. Kathaṃ pana
analyzed: nidhi mukham gavesanto iti nidhim pariyesanto sakid eva ati eka ppayogena iva katham pana
translated: Searching for the mouth of the treasure: searching for the treasure. At one time: at one occasion.

original: ekappayogeneva ekādasannaṃ nidhīnaṃ adhigamo hotīti? Idhekacco araññe jīvitavuttiṃ
analyzed: eka ppayogena iva ekādasannam nidhīnam adhigamaḥ hoti iti idha ekaccaḥ araññe jīvita vuttim
translated: “Is it by means of a single condition that the eleven treasures are acquired?”🔽Here someone lives in the forest,

original: gavesamāno carati. Tamenaṃ aññataro atthacarako disvā “kiṃ, bho, carasī”ti pucchati.
analyzed: gavesamāno carati tam enam aññataraḥ attha carakaḥ disvā kim bho carasi iti pucchati
translated: Does the discovery of the eleven treasures come about through the same means? Here someone is wandering in the forest seeking a means of livelihood. Another man, a hunter, sees him and asks, “What are you seeking, my good man?”

original: So “jīvitavuttiṃ pariyesāmī”ti āha. Itaro “tena hi samma āgaccha, etaṃ pāsāṇaṃ pavaṭṭehī”ti🔽āha. So taṃ pavaṭṭetvā uparūpariṭṭhitā vā kucchiyā kucchiṃ āhacca ṭhitā vā ekādasa🔽kumbhiyo passati. Evaṃ ekappayogena ekādasannaṃ adhigamo hoti.🔽Ācariyadhanaṃ pariyesissantīti aññatitthiyā hi yassa santike sippaṃ uggaṇhanti, tassa
analyzed: saḥ jīvita vuttim pariyesāmi iti āha itaraḥ tena hi samme āgaccha etam pāsāṇam pavaṭṭehi iti  āha saḥ tam pavaṭṭetvā uparu upariṭṭhitā vā kucchiyā kucchim āhat ca ṭhitāḥ vā ekādasa  kumbhiyo passati evam eka ppayogena ekādasannam adhigamaḥ hoti  ācariya dhanam pariyesissanti iti añña titthiyāḥ hi yassa santike sippam uggaṇhanti tassa
translated: He replies, “I am seeking a means of livelihood.” The hunter says, “Well then, come along, let us turn over this rock.”🔽After turning it over, he sees eleven pots placed one above the other, either with the mouth of one pot touching the belly of the next or with one pot resting on the belly of the next. In this way the discovery of the eleven treasures comes about through the same means.

original: sippuggahaṇato pure vā pacchā vā antarantarā vā gehato nīharitvā dhanaṃ denti. Yesaṃ
analyzed: sippu gahaṇataḥ pure vā pacchā vā antar antarā vā gehataḥ nīharitvā dhanam denti yesam
translated: “Seeking the teacher’s fee”: the non-Buddhist sectarians give the fee for learning a craft either before or after the craft is learned, or in the middle, after taking it out of the house.

original: gehe natthi, te ñātisabhāgato pariyesanti. Yesaṃ tampi natthi, te sabhāgato pariyesanti.
analyzed: gehe natthi te ñāti sabhāgato pariyesanti yesam tam pi natthi te sabhāgato pariyesanti
translated: Those who do not have it in their house seek it from their relatives. Those who do not have it there seek it from their friends.

original: Tathā alabhamānā bhikkhampi caritvā dentiyeva. Taṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tathā alabhamānā bhikkham pi caritvā dentiyā iva tam sandhāya itam vuttam
translated: and if they cannot get it, they give it after they have gone on their alms round. That is what is meant here.

original: Kiṃ panāhanti bāhirakā tāva aniyyānikepi sāsane sippamattadāyakassa dhanaṃ pariyesanti,
analyzed: kim pana ahanti bāhirakā tāva aniyyānike pi sāsane sippa matta dāyakassa dhanam pariyesanti
translated: “But why?” He says: “Outsiders, even though they are not in the Dispensation, seek wealth for one who teaches them a mere craft.

original: ahaṃ pana evaṃvidhe niyyānikasāsane ekādasavidhaṃ amatuppattipaṭipadaṃ desentassa
analyzed: aham pana evaṃvidhe niyyānika sāsane ekādasavidham amata uppatti paṭipadam desentassa
translated: But I, in such a Dispensation as this, which is the means of attaining the eleven kinds of supramundane states,

original: ācariyassa pūjaṃ kiṃ na karissāmi, karissāmiyevāti vadati. Paccekaṃ dussayugena acchādesīti
analyzed: ācariyassa pūjam kim na karissāmi karissāmi iva ati vadati paccekam dussa yugena acchādesi iti
translated: why should I not honour the teacher who teaches the eleven kinds of supramundane states? I shall honour him.”

original: ekamekassa bhikkhuno ekekaṃ dussayugaṃ adāsīti attho. Samudācāravacanaṃ panettha🔽evarūpaṃ hoti, tasmā acchādesīti vuttaṃ. Pañcasataṃ vihāranti pañcasatagghanikaṃ
analyzed: ekam ekassa bhikkhuno ekekam dussayugam adāsi iti attho samudācāra vacanam pana ittha  evarūpam hoti tasmai acchādesi iti vuttam pañca satam vihāranti pañca satagghanikam
translated: “With a pair of cloths for each” means: he gave a pair of cloths to each bhikkhu. But here the expression is🔽in the form of a presentative, and therefore it is said “with a pair of cloths.”

original: paṇṇasālaṃ kāresīti attho.
analyzed: paṇṇasālam kāresi iti attho
translated: “A dwelling worth five hundred” means: a leaf hut worth five hundred.

original: 7. Gopālasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: gopāla sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The explanation of the Gopālaka Sutta

analyzed: sattame tissaḥ kathāḥ eka nāḷikā catur assā nisinna vattikā ti tattha pāḷim vatvā
translated: . In the seventh, the three stories are the single-thatched hut, the four-sided bench, and the sitting mat.

analyzed: ekekassa padassa attha kathanam ekanāḷikā nāma apaṇḍita gopālakam dassetvā apaṇḍita bhikkhum  dassetvā paṇḍita gopālakam dassetvā paṇḍita bhikkhum dassetvā ati catukkam bandhitvā

analyzed: dassetvā pariyosāna gamanan ti ayam nisinnavattikā nāma ayam idha sabba ācariyānam āciṇṇā  ekādasahi bhikkhave aṅgehi iti ekādasahi aguṇa koṭṭhāsehi go gaṇanti go maṇḍalam pariharitunti

analyzed: gunnam satam vā sahassam vā ati saṅkhyam na jānāti saḥ gāvīsu haṭāsu vā palātāsu vā  go gaṇam gaṇetvā ajja ettakāḥ na dissanti iti dve tīṇi gāmantarāni vā aṭavim vā vicarantaḥ  na pariyesati aññesam gāvīsu attanaḥ go gaṇam paviṭṭhāsu api go gaṇam gaṇetvā imāḥ ettikā

analyzed: gunnam vaṇāḥ vaḍḍhanti gambhīrāḥ honti pāṇakā kucchim pavisanti gāvaḥ gelañña abhibhūtā
translated: The wounds of the cows increase, they become deep, and worms enter their bellies. The cows are overcome by sickness.

analyzed: saḥ samuṭṭhānataḥ rūpam a jānantaḥ rūpam pariggahetvā āpe paribāhiraḥ hoti  na lakkhaṇa kusalaḥ hoti iti kamma lakkhaṇaḥ bālaḥ kamma lakkhaṇo paṇḍito ti evam vuttam
translated: He does not know whether it is originated by one of the two origins of materiality.🔽As to characteristic: he does not know that the fool’s characteristic is unprofitable action and the wise man’s is profitable action.🔽He does not know that the fool’s characteristic is unprofitable action and the wise man’s is profitable action.🔽As to characteristic: he does not know that the fool’s characteristic is unprofitable action and the wise man’s is profitable action.

original: kusalākusalakammaṃ paṇḍitabālalakkhaṇanti na jānāti. So evaṃ ajānanto bāle vajjetvā🔽paṇḍite na sevati. Bāle vajjetvā paṇḍite asevanto kappiyākappiyaṃ kusalākusalaṃ sāvajjānavajjaṃ
analyzed: kusala akusala kammam paṇḍita bāla lakkhaṇan ti na jānāti saḥ evam a jānantaḥ bāle vajjetvā  paṇḍite na sevati bāle vajjetvā paṇḍite a sevanto kappiya akappiyam kusala akusalam sāvajja anavajjam

original: garukalahukaṃ satekicchātekicchaṃ kāraṇākāraṇaṃ na jānāti. Taṃ ajānanto kammaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: garuka lahukam sa tekiccha atekiccham kāraṇa akāraṇam na jānāti tam a jānantaḥ kammaṭṭhānam
translated: As to characteristic: he does not know that the fool’s characteristic is unprofitable action and the wise man’s is profitable action.🔽As to characteristic: he does not know that the fool’s

original: gahetvā vaḍḍhetuṃ na sakkoti. So yathā tassa gopālakassa gogaṇo na vaḍḍhati, evaṃ🔽imasmiṃ sāsane yathāvuttehi sīlādīhi na vaḍḍhati. So gopālako viya ca pañcahi gorasehi,
analyzed: gahetvā vaḍḍhetum na sakkoti saḥ yathā tassa gopālakassa go gaṇaḥ na vaḍḍhati evam  imasmim sāsane yathā vuttehi sīla ādīhi na vaḍḍhati saḥ gopālakaḥ ca pañcahi gorasehi
translated: He cannot increase his knowledge by learning. He is like the cowherd who cannot increase his herd.

original: pañcahi dhammakkhandhehi paribāhiro hoti.
analyzed: pañcahi dhammakkhandhehi paribāhiraḥ hoti
translated: And he is outside the five benefits and the five portions of the Dhamma.

original: Na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hotīti “uppannaṃ kāmavitakka”nti evaṃ vutte kāmavitakkādayo na
analyzed: na āsāṭikam hāretā hoti iti uppannam kāma vitakkam ti evam vutte kāma vitakka ādayaḥ na
translated: He does not remove the milk-skin. When lust, etc., arise, he does not remove them by dispelling them.

original: vinodeti. So imaṃ akusalavitakkaṃ āsāṭikaṃ ahāretvā vitakkavasiko hutvā vicaranto
analyzed: vinodeti saḥ imam akusala vitakkam āsāṭikam a hāretvā vitakka vasikaḥ hutvā vicarantaḥ
translated: He is like the cowherd who does not remove the milk-skin. He wanders about with his thoughts on the subject of his lust, etc.,

original: kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā vaḍḍhetuṃ na sakkoti. So yathā tassa gopālakassa…pe… paribāhiro hoti.
analyzed: kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā vaḍḍhetum na sakkoti saḥ yathā tassa gopāla kassape paribāhiraḥ hoti
translated: and he cannot increase his knowledge by learning. He is like the cowherd who cannot increase his herd. He is outside the five benefits and the five portions of the Dhamma.

original: Na vaṇaṃ paṭicchādetā hotīti “cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā nimittaggāhī hotī”tiādinā nayena
analyzed: na vaṇam paṭicchādetā hoti iti cakkhunā rūpam disvā nimitta ggāhī hoti itiādinā nayena
translated: He does not cover up the wounds. When he sees a visible object with the eye, he grasps at the sign of it.

original: sabbārammaṇesu nimittaṃ gaṇhanto yathā so gopālako vaṇaṃ na paṭicchādeti, evaṃ saṃvaraṃ
analyzed: sabba ārammaṇesu nimittam gaṇhantaḥ yathā saḥ gopālakaḥ vaṇam na paṭicchādeti evam saṃvaram
translated: He is like the cowherd who does not cover up the wounds.

original: na sampādeti. So vivaṭadvāro vicaranto kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā vaḍḍhetuṃ na sakkoti…pe… paribāhiro hoti.
analyzed: na sampādeti saḥ vivaṭa dvāraḥ vicarantaḥ kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā vaḍḍhetum na sakkoti pe paribāhiraḥ hoti
translated: He does not succeed. He goes about with his door open. He is unable to take up and develop a meditation subject. … He is outside.

original: Na dhūmaṃ kattā hotīti so gopālako dhūmaṃ viya dhammadesanādhūmaṃ na karoti, dhammakathaṃ
analyzed: na dhūmam kattā hoti iti saḥ gopālakaḥ dhūmam viya dhamma desanā dhūmam na karoti dhamma katham
translated: He does not make smoke: he does not make the smoke of the Dhamma-talk,

original: vā sarabhaññaṃ vā upanisinnakakathaṃ vā anumodanaṃ vā na karoti, tato naṃ manussā
analyzed: vā sarabhaññam vā upanisinnaka katham vā anumodanam vā na karoti tatas nam manussā
translated: or the talk consisting of mixed speech, or the talk of appreciation, or the talk of benediction. People do not know him as one who is learned and virtuous.

original: “bahussuto guṇavā”ti na jānanti. Te guṇāguṇaṃ ajānanto catūhi paccayehi saṅgahaṃ🔽na karonti. So paccayehi kilamamāno buddhavacanaṃ sajjhāyaṃ kātuṃ vattapaṭivattaṃ
analyzed: bahu ssutaḥ guṇavā ati na jānanti te guṇa aguṇam a jānantaḥ catūhi paccayehi saṅgaham  na karonti saḥ paccayehi kilamamānaḥ buddha vacanam sajjhāyam kātum vatta paṭivattam
translated: Not knowing his virtues and faults, they do not give him the four requisites.🔽He is exhausted by the effort to get requisites. He is unable to recite the Buddha’s word, to fulfil the duties of civility,

original: pūretuṃ kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā vaḍḍhetuṃ na sakkoti…pe… paribāhiro hoti.
analyzed: pūretum kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā vaḍḍhetum na sakkotipe paribāhiraḥ hoti
translated: to take up and develop a meditation subject. … He is outside.

original: Na titthaṃ jānātīti titthabhūte bahussutabhikkhū na upasaṅkamati. Anupasaṅkamanto
analyzed: na tittham jānāti iti tittha bhūte bahu ssuta bhikkhū na upasaṅkamati an upasaṅkamantaḥ
translated: He does not know the ford: he does not approach bhikkhus who are learned, etc., as fords. Not approaching them,

original: “idaṃ, bhante, byañjanaṃ kathaṃ ropetabbaṃ? Imassa bhāsitassa ko attho? Imasmiṃ ṭhāne
analyzed: idam bhante byañjanam katham ropetabbam imassa bhāsitassa kaḥ atthaḥ imasmin ṭhāne
translated: he does not know “This is how to construe this, how to interpret it.” He does not know the meaning of this or that statement.

original: pāḷi kiṃ vadati? Imasmiṃ ṭhāne attho kiṃ dīpetī”ti evaṃ na paripucchati na paripañhati,
analyzed: kim vadati imasmin ṭhāne attho kim dīpeti iti evam na paripucchati na paripañhati
translated: What does the text say? What does it show here? ”

original: na jānāpetīti attho. Tassa te evaṃ aparipucchitā avivaṭañceva na vivaranti, bhājetvā
analyzed: na jānāpeti iti atthaḥ tassa te evam a paripucchitāḥ a vivaṭan ca iva na vivaranti bhājetvā
translated: He does not ask and does not seek to know. The meaning is that he does not get them to know.

original: na dassenti, anuttānīkatañca na uttāniṃ karonti, apākaṭaṃ na pākaṭaṃ karonti. Anekavihitesu
analyzed: na dassenti an uttānīkatañca na uttānim karonti apākaṭam na pākaṭam karonti aneka vihitesu
translated: They do not open up to him what is not open, nor do they make plain what is not plain, nor do they clarify what is not clear.

original: ca kaṅkhāṭhāniyesu dhammesūti anekavidhāsu kaṅkhāsu ekakaṅkhampi na paṭivinodenti.
analyzed: ca kaṅkhāṭhāniyesu dhammesu uti anekavidhāsu kaṅkhāsu eka kaṅkham pi na paṭivinodenti
translated: In the many kinds of matters that give rise to doubt: in the many kinds of doubts. They do not remove even one kind of doubt.

original: Kaṅkhāyeva hi kaṅkhāṭhāniyā dhammā nāma. Tattha ekaṃ kaṅkhampi na nīharantīti attho.
analyzed: kaṅkhāya iva hi kaṅkhā ṭhāniyāḥ dhammāḥ nāma tattha ekam kaṅkham pi na nīharanti iti attho
translated: For matters that give rise to doubt are called doubt itself. The meaning is that they do not remove even one doubt from among them.

original: So evaṃ bahussutatitthaṃ anupasaṅkamitvā sakaṅkho kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā vaḍḍhetuṃ
analyzed: saḥ evam bahussutatittham an upasaṅkamitvā sa kaṅkhaḥ kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā vaḍḍhetum
translated: So, without approaching the learned, he takes up the meditation subject with his doubt unresolved.

original: na sakkoti. Yathā vā so gopālako titthaṃ na jānāti, evaṃ ayampi bhikkhu dhammatitthaṃ
analyzed: na sakkoti yathā vā saḥ gopālakaḥ tittham na jānāti evam ayam pi bhikkhu dhamma tittham
translated: And he is unable to develop it. Or just as the cowherd does not know the ford, so this bhikkhu does not know the Dhamma-ford.🔽Not knowing it, he asks about the unaskable,

original: na jānāti. Ajānanto avisaye pañhaṃ pucchati, ābhidhammikaṃ upasaṅkamitvā kappiyākappiyaṃ
analyzed: na jānāti a jānantaḥ a visaye pañham pucchati ābhidhammikam upasaṅkamitvā kappiya akappiyam
translated: approaching an Abhidhamma scholar and asking about what is allowable and what is not.

original: pucchati, vinayadharaṃ upasaṅkamitvā rūpārūpaparicchedaṃ pucchati. Te avisaye puṭṭhā
analyzed: pucchati vinaya dharam upasaṅkamitvā rūpa arūpa paricchedam pucchati te avisaye puṭṭhā
translated: He asks, he goes to an expert on the Monastic Law and asks him about the analysis of the visible-form aggregate and the formless aggregates.

original: kathetuṃ na sakkonti. So attanā sakaṅkho kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā vaḍḍhetuṃ na sakkoti…pe… paribāhiro hoti.
analyzed: kathetum na sakkonti saḥ attanā sakaṅkhaḥ kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā vaḍḍhetum na sakkoti pe paribāhiraḥ hoti
translated: But when asked about what is not in his field of experience, he is unable to explain. He is unsure of himself, and so he is unable to take up and develop a meditation subject. … he is excluded.

original: Na pītaṃ jānātīti yathā so gopālako pītāpītaṃ na jānāti, evaṃ dhammūpasañhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ
analyzed: na pītam jānāti iti yathā saḥ gopālakaḥ pīta apītam na jānāti evam dhamma upasañhitam pāmojjam
translated: He does not know what is drunk: just as that cowherd does not know what is drunk and what is not drunk, so he does not know and does not get the joy connected with the Dhamma.

original: na jānāti na labhati. Savanamayaṃ puññakiriyavatthuṃ nissāya ānisaṃsaṃ na vindati,🔽dhammassavanaggaṃ gantvā sakkaccaṃ na suṇāti, nisinno niddāyati, kathaṃ katheti,🔽aññavihitako hoti. So sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ assuṇanto kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā vaḍḍhetuṃ
analyzed: na jānāti na labhati savana mayam puñña kiriya vatthum nissāya ānisaṃsam na vindati  dhammassavana ggam gantvā sakkaccam na suṇāti nisinnaḥ niddāyati katham kathā iti  aññavihitakaḥ hoti so sakkaccam dhammam a suṇantaḥ kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā vaḍḍhetuṃ
translated: He does not find the benefit that comes from the basis of making merit consisting in giving and sharing.🔽He does not listen respectfully, he does not listen with eagerness, he does not listen with appreciation, he does not listen by directing his entire mind, he falls asleep while sitting, he engages in conversation.

original: na sakkoti…pe… paribāhiro hoti.
analyzed: na sakkotipe paribāhiraḥ hoti
translated: He does not listen respectfully to the Dhamma, and so he is unable to take up and develop a meditation subject. … he is excluded.🔽He does not know the path: just as that cowherd does not know the right and wrong paths, so he does not know the noble path,

original: Na vīthiṃ jānātīti so gopālako maggāmaggaṃ viya “ayaṃ lokiyo, ayaṃ lokuttaro”ti ariyaṃ
analyzed: na vīthim jānāti iti saḥ gopālakaḥ magga amaggam viya ayam lokiyaḥ ayam lokuttaraḥ ti ariyam
translated: which is of two kinds as “mundane” and “supramundane.”

original: aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti. Ajānanto lokiyamagge abhinivisitvā lokuttaraṃ
analyzed: aṭṭhaṅgikam maggam yathābhūtam na ppajānāti a jānantaḥ lokiya magge abhinivisitvā lokuttaram
translated: he does not understand as it really is the noble path leading to the cessation of suffering. Not understanding this, he is bound up with craving and is not freed from birth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair. He is not freed from suffering, I say.🔽

original: nibbattetuṃ na sakkoti…pe… paribāhiro hoti.
analyzed: nibbattetum na sakkoti pe paribāhiraḥ hoti
translated: He does not understand the Noble Eightfold Path as it actually is. Not understanding it, he misapprehends the mundane path and is unable to produce the supramundane path. … He is excluded.

original: Na gocarakusalo hotīti so gopālako pañcāhikasattāhikacāre viya cattāro satipaṭṭhāne🔽“ime lokiyā, ime lokuttarā”ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti. Ajānanto sukhumaṭṭhānesu attano
analyzed: na gocara kusalaḥ hoti iti so gopālako pañcāhika sattāhika cāre viya cattāraḥ satipaṭṭhāne  ime lokiyāḥ ime lokuttarāḥ ti yathābhūtam na pajānāti a jānantaḥ sukhuma ṭṭhānesu attanaḥ
translated: He is not skilled in the pastures: just as the cowherd does not know the five or six pastures and makes the cattle eat grass in a restricted area, so too this meditator does not know the four foundations of mindfulness as they actually are,

original: ñāṇaṃ carāpetvā lokiyasatipaṭṭhāne abhinivisitvā lokuttaraṃ nibbattetuṃ na sakkoti…pe… paribāhiro hoti.
analyzed: ñāṇam carāpetvā lokiya satipaṭṭhāne abhinivisitvā lokuttaram nibbattetum na sakkoti pe paribāhiraḥ hoti
translated: “These are mundane, these supramundane,” and so on. Not knowing them, he is unable to make his knowledge graze in the subtle field and, misapprehending the mundane foundations of mindfulness, he is unable to produce the supramundane path. … He is excluded.

original: Anavasesadohī hotīti paṭiggahaṇe mattaṃ ajānanto anavasesaṃ duhati. Niddesavāre panassa🔽abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavārentīti abhiharitvā pavārenti. Ettha dve abhihārā vācābhihāro ca,
analyzed: anavasesa dohī hoti iti paṭiggahaṇe mattam a jānantaḥ anavasesam duhati niddesa vāre pana assa  abhihaṭṭhum pavārenti iti abhiharitvā pavārenti ettha dve abhihārā vācābhihāro ca
translated: He milks dry: not knowing moderation in accepting, he milks dry. But in the Niddesa passage,

original: paccayābhihāro ca. Vācābhihāro nāma manussā bhikkhussa santikaṃ gantvā “vadeyyātha,
analyzed: paccaya abhihāraḥ ca vācā abhihāraḥ nāma manussāḥ bhikkhussa santikam gantvā vadeyyātha
translated: they let him milk until he is satisfied: they let him milk after he has milked. Here there are two kinds of milking: milking by speech and milking by conditions. Milking by speech is when people go to the bhikkhu and say, “Please recommend something for us to buy with this.”

original: bhante, yenattho”ti pavārenti. Paccayābhihāro nāma vatthādīni vā sappinavanītaphāṇitādīni
analyzed: bhante yena attho ti pavārenti paccaya abhihāraḥ nāma vattha ādīni vā sappi navanīta phāṇita ādīni
translated: The offering of requisites: people take robe-cloth, etc., or ghee, fresh butter, oil, etc.,

original: vā gahetvā bhikkhussa santikaṃ gantvā “gaṇhatha, bhante, yāvatakena attho”ti vadanti.🔽Tatra bhikkhu mattaṃ na jānātīti bhikkhu tesu paccayesu pamāṇaṃ na jānāti. “Dāyakassa
analyzed: vā gahetvā bhikkhussa santikam gantvā gaṇhatha bhante yāvatakena attho ti vadanti  tatra bhikkhu mattam na jānāti iti bhikkhu tesu paccayesu pamāṇam na jānāti dāyakassa
translated: to a bhikkhu and say, “Venerable sir, take what you need.”

original: vaso veditabbo, deyyadhammassa vaso veditabbo, attano thāmo veditabbo”ti iminā nayena
analyzed: vasaḥ veditabbaḥ deyya dhammassa vasaḥ veditabbaḥ attano thāmaḥ veditabbaḥ iti iminā nayena
translated: The bhikkhu does not know moderation: he does not know the right amount. “The donor’s wish should be fulfilled, the merit should be fulfilled, and one’s own need should be fulfilled” .🔽He takes all that is brought without taking what is proper in accordance with this method.

original: pamāṇayuttakaṃ aggahetvā yaṃ āharanti, taṃ sabbaṃ gaṇhātīti attho. Manussā vippaṭisārino🔽na puna abhiharitvā pavārenti. So paccayehi kilamanto kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā vaḍḍhetuṃ
analyzed: pamāṇa yuttakam aggahetvā yam āharanti tam sabbam gaṇhāti iti atthaḥ manussāḥ vippaṭisārinaḥ  na puna abhiharitvā pavārenti saḥ paccayehi kilamantaḥ kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā vaḍḍhetum
translated: The people are remorseful.

original: na sakkoti…pe… paribāhiro hoti.
analyzed: na sakkotipe paribāhiraḥ hoti
translated: They do not bring any more. He is troubled by the lack of requisites. He is unable to take up or to increase meditation as a subject of meditation. …🔽He is outside.

original: Te na atirekapūjāya pūjetā hotīti so gopālako mahāusabhe viya there bhikkhū imāya
analyzed: te na atireka pūjāya pūjetā hoti iti so gopālakaḥ mahāusabhe viya there bhikkhū
translated: He does not honor those worthy of honor: just as the cowherd does not honor the big bulls,

original: āvi ceva raho ca mettākāyakammādikāya atirekapūjāya na pūjeti. Tato therā “ime amhesu
analyzed: āvi ca iva raho ca mettā kāya kamma ādikāya atireka pūjāya na pūjā iti tatas therāḥ ime amhesu
translated: and he does not honour them with the special kinds of service consisting in bodily action, etc., either openly or in private. Then the elder bhikkhus think:🔽“These young bhikkhus do not honour us with their thoughts,

original: garucittīkāraṃ na karontī”ti navake bhikkhū dvīhi saṅgahehi na saṅgaṇhanti, neva🔽dhammasaṅgahena saṅgaṇhanti, na āmisasaṅgahena, cīvarena vā pattena vā pattapariyāpannena🔽vā vasanaṭṭhānena vā kilamantepi nappaṭijagganti, pāḷiṃ vā aṭṭhakathaṃ vā dhammakathābandhaṃ
analyzed: garu cittīkāram na karonti iti navake bhikkhū dvīhi saṅgahehi na saṅgaṇhanti na iva  dhamma saṅgahena saṅgaṇhanti na āmisa saṅgahena cīvarena vā pattena vā patta pariyāpannena  vā vasanaṭṭhānena vā kilamante pi na paṭijagganti pāḷim vā aṭṭhakatham vā dhamma kathā bandham
translated: with their words, and with their deeds.” So they do not look after the young bhikkhus with the two kinds of assistance,

original: vā guḷhaganthaṃ vā na sikkhāpenti. Navakā therānaṃ santikā sabbaso ime dve saṅgahe🔽alabhamānā imasmiṃ sāsane patiṭṭhātuṃ na sakkonti. Yathā tassa gopālakassa gogaṇo
analyzed: vā guḷha gantham vā na sikkhāpenti navakāḥ therānam santikā sabbaso ime dve saṅgahe  a labhamānāḥ imasmiṃ sāsane patiṭṭhātum na sakkonti yathā tassa gopālakassa go gaṇaḥ
translated: that is to say, with assistance in the Dhamma and with assistance in worldly things. They do not look after them even if they are sick, and they do not teach them the texts and the commentaries and the Dhamma and the word of the Elders. And the young bhikkhus, not getting these two kinds of assistance from the elder bhikkhus,🔽are unable to remain in the Dispensation. They are like the cattle of the negligent cowherd that do not thrive.

original: na vaḍḍhati, evaṃ sīlādīhi na vaḍḍhanti. Yathā ca so gopālako pañcahi gorasehi, evaṃ
analyzed: na vaḍḍhati evam sīla ādīhi na vaḍḍhanti yathā ca saḥ gopālakaḥ pañcahi gorasehi evam
translated: And just as the negligent cowherd did not get the five products of the cow,

original: pañcahi dhammakkhandhehi paribāhirā honti. Sukkapakkho kaṇhapakkhe vuttavipallāsavasena yojetvā veditabbo.
